table_lines.name: Code Value
table_lines.comment:
The identifier of the Coded Entry.
See
Shall be present if the code value length is 16 characters or less, and the code value is not a URN or URL.

table_lines.name: Coding Scheme Designator
table_lines.comment:
The identifier of the coding scheme in which the Coded Entry is defined.
See
Shall be present if Code Value (0008,0100) or Long Code Value (0008,0119) is present. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Coding Scheme Version
table_lines.comment:
An identifier of the version of the coding scheme if necessary to resolve ambiguity.
See

table_lines.name: Code Meaning
table_lines.comment:
Text that conveys the meaning of the Coded Entry.
See

table_lines.name: Long Code Value
table_lines.comment:
The identifier of the Coded Entry.
See
Shall be present if Code Value (0008,0100) is not present and the Code Value is not a URN or URL.

table_lines.name: URN Code Value
table_lines.comment:
The identifier of the Coded Entry.
See
Shall be present if Code Value (0008,0100) is not present and the Code Value is a URN or URL.

table_lines.name: Context Identifier
table_lines.comment:
The identifier of the Context Group from which the Coded Entry was selected.
See

table_lines.name: Context UID
table_lines.comment:
The unique identifier of the Context Group from which the Coded Entry was selected.
See

table_lines.name: Mapping Resource
table_lines.comment:
The identifier of the Mapping Resource that defines the Context Group from which Coded Entry was selected.
See

table_lines.name: Mapping Resource UID
table_lines.comment: The unique identifier of the Mapping Resource that defines the Context Group from which Coded Entry was selected.

table_lines.name: Mapping Resource Name
table_lines.comment:
The name of the Mapping Resource that defines the Context Group from which Coded Entry was selected.
See

table_lines.name: Context Group Version
table_lines.comment:
The identifier of the version of the Context Group from which the Coded Entry was selected.
See
Required if Context Identifier (0008,010F) is present.

table_lines.name: Context Group Extension Flag
table_lines.comment: sect_8.7

table_lines.name: Context Group Local Version
table_lines.comment:
An implementation-specific version of a Context Group that contains private extensions.
See

table_lines.name: Context Group Extension Creator UID
table_lines.comment: Required if the value of Context Group Extension Flag (0008,010B) is "Y".

table_lines.name: Equivalent Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Codes that are considered equivalent by the creating system.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: Person Identification Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A coded entry that identifies a person.
The Code Meaning Attribute, though it will be encoded with a VR of LO, may be encoded according to the rules of the PN VR (e.g., caret '^' delimiters shall separate name components), except that a single component (i.e., the whole name unseparated by caret delimiters) is not permitted. Name component groups for use with multi-byte character sets are permitted, as long as they fit within the 64 characters (the length of the LO VR).
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Person's Address
table_lines.comment: Person's mailing address.

table_lines.name: Person's Telephone Numbers
table_lines.comment: Person's telephone number(s).

table_lines.name: Person's Telecom Information
table_lines.comment: The person's telecommunication contact information, including telephone, email, or other telecom addresses.

table_lines.name: Institution Name
table_lines.comment:
Institution or organization to which the identified individual is responsible or accountable.
Required if Institution Code Sequence (0008,0082) is not present. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Institution Address
table_lines.comment: Mailing address of the institution or organization to which the identified individual is responsible or accountable.

table_lines.name: Institution Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Institution or organization to which the identified individual is responsible or accountable.
Required if Institution Name (0008,0080) is not present. May be present otherwise.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Institutional Department Name
table_lines.comment: The Department, Unit or Service within the healthcare facility.

table_lines.name: Institutional Department Type Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A coded description of the type of Department or Service within the healthcare facility.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Value Type
table_lines.comment: The type of the value encoded in this name-value Item.

table_lines.name: Observation DateTime
table_lines.comment: The date and time on which this Item was completed. For the purpose of recording measurements or logging events, completion time is defined as the ending time of data acquisition of the measurement, or the ending time of occurrence of the event.

table_lines.name: Observation Start DateTime
table_lines.comment: The date and time on which this Item was started. For the purpose of recording measurements or logging events, start time is defined as the ending time of data acquisition of the measurement, or the start time of occurrence of the event.

table_lines.name: Concept Name Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Coded concept name of this name-value Item.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: DateTime
table_lines.comment:
DateTime value for this name-value Item.
Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is DATETIME.

table_lines.name: Date
table_lines.comment:
Date value for this name-value Item.
Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is DATE.

table_lines.name: Time
table_lines.comment:
Time value for this name-value Item.
Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is TIME.

table_lines.name: Person Name
table_lines.comment:
Person name value for this name-value Item.
Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is PNAME.

table_lines.name: UID
table_lines.comment:
UID value for this name-value Item.
Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is UIDREF.

table_lines.name: Text Value
table_lines.comment:
Text value for this name-value Item.
Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is TEXT.

table_lines.name: Concept Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Coded concept value of this name-value Item.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is CODE.

table_lines.name: Numeric Value
table_lines.comment:
Numeric value for this name-value Item. Only a single value shall be present.
Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is NUMERIC.

table_lines.name: Floating Point Value
table_lines.comment:
The floating point representation of Numeric Value (0040,A30A). The same number of values as Numeric Value (0040,A30A) shall be present.
Required if Numeric Value (0040,A30A) has insufficient precision to represent the value as a string. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Rational Numerator Value
table_lines.comment:
The integer numerator of a rational representation of Numeric Value (0040,A30A), encoded as a signed integer value. The same number of values as Numeric Value (0040,A30A) shall be present.
Required if Numeric Value (0040,A30A) has insufficient precision to represent a rational value as a string. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Rational Denominator Value
table_lines.comment:
The integer denominator of a rational representation of Numeric Value (0040,A30A), encoded as a non-zero unsigned integer value. The same number of values as Numeric Value (0040,A30A) shall be present.
Required if Rational Numerator Value (0040,A162) is present.

table_lines.name: Measurement Units Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Units of measurement for a numeric value in this name-value Item.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is NUMERIC.

table_lines.name: Referenced SOP Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Composite SOP Instance Reference value for this name-value Item.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is COMPOSITE or IMAGE or WAVEFORM.

table_lines.name: >Referenced Frame Number
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the frame numbers within the Referenced SOP Instance to which the reference applies. The first frame shall be denoted as frame number 1.
Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a multi-frame image and the reference does not apply to all frames, and Referenced Segment Number (0062,000B) is not present.

table_lines.name: >Referenced Segment Number
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the segments to which the reference applies identified by Segment Number (0062,0004).
Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a Segmentation or Surface Segmentation and the reference does not apply to all segments and Referenced Frame Number (0008,1160) is not present.

table_lines.name: >Referenced Waveform Channels
table_lines.comment: Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a Waveform that contains multiple Channels and the reference does not apply to all Channels of all Multiplex Groups.

10.2.1-1.table_caption: Content Item with Modifiers Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Content Item Modifier Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Specifies modifiers for the Content Item.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

10-3.table_caption: Image SOP Instance Reference Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Referenced Frame Number
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the frame numbers within the Referenced SOP Instance to which the reference applies. The first frame shall be denoted as frame number 1.
Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a multi-frame image and the reference does not apply to all frames, and Referenced Segment Number (0062,000B) is not present.

table_lines.name: Referenced Segment Number
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the Segment Number to which the reference applies.
Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a Segmentation or Surface Segmentation and the reference does not apply to all segments and Referenced Frame Number (0008,1160) is not present.

10-3b.table_caption: Referenced Instances and Access Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Type of Instances
table_lines.comment: Type of object Instances referenced.

table_lines.name: Study Instance UID
table_lines.comment:
Unique identifier for the Study.
Required if Type of Instances (0040,E020) is DICOM and the Information Model of the referenced Instance contains the Study IE.

table_lines.name: Series Instance UID
table_lines.comment:
Unique identifier for the Series that is part of the Study identified in Study Instance UID (0020,000D), if present, and contains the referenced object Instance(s).
Required if Type of Instances (0040,E020) is DICOM and the Information Model of the referenced Instance contains the Series IE.

table_lines.name: Referenced SOP Sequence
table_lines.comment:
References to object Instances.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

table_lines.name: >Referenced SOP Instance UID
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

table_lines.name: >HL7 Instance Identifier
table_lines.comment:
Instance Identifier of the encapsulated HL7 Structured Document, encoded as a UID (OID or UUID), concatenated with a caret ("^") and Extension value (if Extension is present in Instance Identifier).
Required if Type of Instances (0040,E020) is CDA.

table_lines.name: >Referenced Frame Number
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the frame numbers within the Referenced SOP Instance to which the reference applies. The first frame shall be denoted as frame number 1.
Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a multi-frame image and the reference does not apply to all frames, and Referenced Segment Number (0062,000B) is not present.

table_lines.name: >Referenced Segment Number
table_lines.comment: Identifies the Segment Number to which the reference applies. Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a Segmentation and the reference does not apply to all segments and Referenced Frame Number (0008,1160) is not present.

table_lines.name: DICOM Retrieval Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Details for retrieving Instances via the DICOM Retrieve Service.
Required if DICOM Media Retrieval Sequence (0040,E022), WADO Retrieval Sequence (0040,E023), WADO-RS Retrieval Sequence (0040,E025) and XDS Retrieval Sequence (0040,E024) are not present. May be present otherwise.
This Sequence shall only identify sources known to have Instances referenced in Referenced SOP Sequence (0008,1199).
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Retrieve AE Title
table_lines.comment: Title of a DICOM Application Entity where the referenced Instance(s) may be retrieved on the network.

table_lines.name: DICOM Media Retrieval Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Details for retrieving Instances from Media.
Required if DICOM Retrieval Sequence (0040,E021), WADO Retrieval Sequence (0040,E023), and WADO-RS Retrieval Sequence (0040,E025) and XDS Retrieval Sequence (0040,E024) are not present. May be present otherwise.
This Sequence shall only identify media known to have Instances referenced in Referenced SOP Sequence (0008,1199).
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Storage Media File-Set ID
table_lines.comment: The user or implementation specific human readable identifier that identifies the Storage Media on which the referenced Instance(s) reside.

table_lines.name: >Storage Media File-Set UID
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies the Storage Media on which the referenced Instance(s) reside.

table_lines.name: WADO Retrieval Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Details for retrieving Instances available via WADO-URI.
Required if DICOM Retrieval Sequence (0040,E021), DICOM Media Retrieval Sequence (0040,E022), WADO-RS Retrieval Sequence (0040,E025) and XDS Retrieval Sequence (0040,E024) are not present. May be present otherwise.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Retrieve URI
table_lines.comment: biblio_RFC_3986

table_lines.name: XDS Retrieval Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Details for retrieving Instances using the IHE XDS-I.b RAD-69 Transaction.
Required if DICOM Retrieval Sequence (0040,E021), DICOM Media Retrieval Sequence (0040,E022), WADO-RS Retrieval Sequence (0040,E025) and WADO Retrieval Sequence (0040,E023) are not present. May be present otherwise.
This Sequence shall only identify repositories known to have Instances referenced in Referenced SOP Sequence (0008,1199).
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Repository Unique ID
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies a Repository from which the referenced Instances can be retrieved.

table_lines.name: >Home Community ID
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies a Community to which requests for the referenced Instances can be directed.

table_lines.name: WADO-RS Retrieval Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Details for retrieving Instances via WADO-RS.
Required if DICOM Retrieval Sequence (0040,E021), DICOM Media Retrieval Sequence (0040,E022), WADO Retrieval Sequence (0040,E023) and XDS Retrieval Sequence (0040,E024) are not present. May be present otherwise.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Retrieve URL
table_lines.comment: URL specifying the location of the referenced Instance(s).

table_lines.name: Referenced SOP Class UID
table_lines.comment:
Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.
Required if the storage request only applies to a specific SOP Class.

table_lines.name: DICOM Storage Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Details for storing Instances via the DICOM Storage Service.
Required if STOW-RS Storage Sequence (0040,4072) or XDS Storage Sequence (0040,4074) is not present. May be present otherwise.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Destination AE
table_lines.comment: Title of a DICOM Application Entity to which Instances will be stored.

table_lines.name: STOW-RS Storage Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Details for storing Instances via STOW-RS.
Required if DICOM Storage Sequence (0040,4071) and XDS Storage Sequence (0040,4074) are not present. May be present otherwise.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Storage URL
table_lines.comment:
URI/URL specifying the location of the STOW-RS storage service to which Instances will be stored.
The value shall be a fully specified URI with protocol, authority and path, in accordance with

table_lines.name: XDS Storage Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Required if STOW-RS Storage Sequence (0040,4072) and DICOM Storage Sequence (0040,4071) are not present. May be present otherwise.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Repository Unique ID
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies a Repository from which the referenced Instances can be retrieved.

table_lines.name: >Home Community ID
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies a Community to which requests for the referenced Instances can be directed.

table_lines.name: Anatomic Region Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies the anatomic region of interest in this Instance (i.e., external anatomy, surface anatomy, or general region of the body).
Zero or one Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: >Anatomic Region Modifier Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items that modifies the anatomic region of interest of this Instance
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: Anatomic Region Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies the anatomic region of interest in this Instance (i.e., external anatomy, surface anatomy, or general region of the body).
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: >Anatomic Region Modifier Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items that modifies the anatomic region of interest of this Instance
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

10-7b.table_caption: Multiple Site General Anatomy Optional Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Anatomic Region Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies the anatomic region of interest in this Instance (i.e., external anatomy, surface anatomy, or general region of the body).

Sequence of Items that modifies the anatomic region of interest in this Instance

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: >Primary Anatomic Structure Modifier Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items that modifies the primary anatomic structure of interest in this Instance.

table_lines.name: Requested Procedure ID
table_lines.comment:
Identifier that identifies the Requested Procedure in the Imaging Service Request.
Required if procedure was scheduled. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Accession Number
table_lines.comment: A departmental Information System generated number that identifies the Imaging Service Request.

table_lines.name: Issuer of Accession Number Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifier of the Assigning Authority that issued the Accession Number.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Study Instance UID
table_lines.comment: The unique identifier for the Study provided for this Requested Procedure.

table_lines.name: Referenced Study Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Uniquely identifies the Studies associated with this SOP Instance.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: Requested Procedure Description
table_lines.comment: Institution-generated administrative description or classification of Requested Procedure.

table_lines.name: Requested Procedure Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A Sequence that conveys the Procedure Type of the requested procedure.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Reason for the Requested Procedure
table_lines.comment: Reason for requesting this procedure.

table_lines.name: Reason for Requested Procedure Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Coded Reason for requesting this procedure.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: Scheduled Procedure Step ID
table_lines.comment:
Identifier that identifies the Scheduled Procedure Step.
Required if procedure was scheduled.

table_lines.name: Scheduled Procedure Step Description
table_lines.comment: Institution-generated description or classification of the Scheduled Procedure Step to be performed.

table_lines.name: Scheduled Protocol Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: Sequence describing the Scheduled Protocol following a specific coding scheme. One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: >Protocol Context Sequence
table_lines.comment: Sequence that specifies the context for the Scheduled Protocol Code Sequence (0040,0008) Item. One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: >>Content Item Modifier Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that specifies modifiers for a Protocol Context Content Item.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

10-10.table_caption: Basic Pixel Spacing Calibration Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Pixel Spacing Calibration Description
table_lines.comment:
A free text description of the type of correction or calibration performed.
Required if Pixel Spacing Calibration Type (0028,0A02) is present.

table_lines.name: Referenced SOP Class UID
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

table_lines.name: Referenced SOP Instance UID
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

table_lines.name: Instance Number
table_lines.comment: A number that identifies this SOP Instance.

table_lines.name: Content Label
table_lines.comment: A label that is used to identify this SOP Instance.

table_lines.name: Content Description
table_lines.comment: A description of the content of the SOP Instance.

table_lines.name: Concept Name Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A coded description of the content of the SOP Instance.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Alternate Content Description Sequence
table_lines.comment: A Sequence containing alternate descriptions suitable for presentation to the user, e.g., in different languages. One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Content Description
table_lines.comment: An alternate description that is used to identify this SOP Instance.

table_lines.name: >Language Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: The language in which Content Description (0070,0081) within this Item is written. A single Item shall be present.

table_lines.name: >Concept Name Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
An alternate coded description of the content of the SOP Instance.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: User Content Label
table_lines.comment:
User-defined label for this SOP Instance.
See

table_lines.name: Content Description
table_lines.comment:
User-defined description for the content of this SOP Instance.
See

table_lines.name: User Content Long Label
table_lines.comment:
User-defined label for the content of this SOP Instance.
See

table_lines.name: Content Description
table_lines.comment:
User-defined description for the content of this SOP Instance.
See

table_lines.name: Content Creator's Name
table_lines.comment: Name of operator (such as a technologist or physician) creating the content of the SOP Instance.

table_lines.name: Content Creator's Identification Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the person who created the content.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Contributing SOP Instances Reference Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A Sequence that identifies the contributing SOP Instances.
Required if this SOP Instance is created from other DICOM SOP Instances.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Study Instance UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identifier for the Study of the Contributing SOP Instances.

table_lines.name: >Referenced Series Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items each of which includes the Attributes of one Series.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Series Instance UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identifier of the Series containing the referenced Instances.

table_lines.name: >>Series Number
table_lines.comment: A number that identifies this Series.

table_lines.name: >>Referenced Instance Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items each providing a reference to an Instance that is part of the Series defined by Series Instance UID (0020,000E) in the enclosing Item.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>>Instance Number
table_lines.comment: A number that identifies this Instance.

table_lines.name: Manufacturer
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer of the equipment that produced the sources.

table_lines.name: Manufacturer's Model Name
table_lines.comment:
Manufacturer's model name of the equipment that produced the sources.
Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

table_lines.name: Device Serial Number
table_lines.comment:
Manufacturer's serial number of the equipment that produced the sources.
Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

table_lines.name: Software Versions
table_lines.comment: Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

table_lines.name: Date of Manufacture
table_lines.comment: The date the equipment that produced the sources was originally manufactured or re-manufactured (as opposed to refurbished).

table_lines.name: Date of Installation
table_lines.comment: The date the equipment that produced the sources was installed in its current location. The device may or may not have been used prior to installation in its current location.

table_lines.name: Acquisition DateTime
table_lines.comment:
The time the acquisition of data that resulted in sources started.
The value shall be the start date and time of the first contributing SOP Instance of the group specified by the Contributing SOP Instances Reference Sequence (0020,9529).
Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

table_lines.name: Station Name
table_lines.comment:
User defined name identifying the machine that produced the sources.
Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

table_lines.name: Operators' Name
table_lines.comment:
Name(s) of the operator(s) supporting the Series.
Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

table_lines.name: Operator Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the operator(s) supporting the Series. One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Operators' Name (0008,1070), if present.
Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

table_lines.name: Protocol Name
table_lines.comment:
User-defined description of the conditions under which the Series was performed.
Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

table_lines.name: Performed Protocol Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence describing the Protocol performed for the Procedure Step creating the sources. One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

table_lines.name: Acquisition Protocol Name
table_lines.comment:
User defined name of the protocol used to acquire this image.
Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

table_lines.name: Rows
table_lines.comment: Number of rows in the images.

table_lines.name: Columns
table_lines.comment: Number of columns in the images.

table_lines.name: Bits Stored
table_lines.comment: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored. See

table_lines.name: Lossy Image Compression
table_lines.comment:
Specifies whether the Source Images have undergone lossy compression (at a point in their lifetime).
See
Required if it is known whether or not Lossy Compression has been performed on the Images.

table_lines.name: Lossy Image Compression Ratio
table_lines.comment:
Describes the approximate lossy compression ratio(s) that have been applied to this image.
See
Required if Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) is "01".

table_lines.name: Lossy Image Compression Method
table_lines.comment:
A label for the lossy compression method(s) that have been applied to the source images.
See
Required if Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) is "01".

table_lines.name: Patient Orientation Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Description of the orientation of the Patient with respect to gravity.
See
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Patient Orientation Modifier Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Patient orientation modifier.
Required if needed to fully specify the orientation of the Patient with respect to gravity.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Patient Gantry Relationship Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Patient Equipment Relationship Code Sequence

10-16.table_caption: Performed Procedure Step Summary Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Performed Procedure Step ID
table_lines.comment: User or equipment generated identifier of that part of a Procedure that has been carried out within this step.

table_lines.name: Performed Procedure Step Start Date
table_lines.comment: Date on which the Performed Procedure Step started.

table_lines.name: Performed Procedure Step Start Time
table_lines.comment: Time on which the Performed Procedure Step started.

table_lines.name: Performed Procedure Step End Date
table_lines.comment: Date on which the Performed Procedure Step ended.

table_lines.name: Performed Procedure Step End Time
table_lines.comment: Time at which the Performed Procedure Step ended.

table_lines.name: Performed Procedure Step Description
table_lines.comment: Institution-generated description or classification of the Procedure Step that was performed.

table_lines.name: Performed Protocol Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: Sequence describing the Protocol performed for this Procedure Step. One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: >Protocol Context Sequence
table_lines.comment: Sequence that specifies the context for the Performed Protocol Code Sequence (0040,0260) Item. One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: >>Content Item Modifier Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that specifies modifiers for a Protocol Context Content Item.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: Comments on the Performed Procedure Step
table_lines.comment: User-defined comments on the Performed Procedure Step.

table_lines.name: Local Namespace Entity ID
table_lines.comment: Identifies an entity within the local namespace or domain. Required if Universal Entity ID (0040,0032) is not present; may be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Universal Entity ID
table_lines.comment: Universal or unique identifier for an entity. Required if Local Namespace Entity ID (0040,0031) is not present; may be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Universal Entity ID Type
table_lines.comment: Standard defining the format of the Universal Entity ID. Required if Universal Entity ID (0040,0032) is present.

10-18.table_caption: Issuer of Patient ID Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Issuer of Patient ID
table_lines.comment: Identifier of the Assigning Authority (system, organization, agency, or department) that issued the Patient ID.

table_lines.name: Issuer of Patient ID Qualifiers Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Attributes specifying or qualifying the identity of the issuer of the Patient ID, or scoping the Patient ID.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Universal Entity ID
table_lines.comment: Universal or unique identifier for the Patient ID Assigning Authority. The authority identified by this Attribute shall be the same as that of Issuer of Patient ID (0010,0021), if present.

table_lines.name: >Universal Entity ID Type
table_lines.comment:
Standard defining the format of the Universal Entity ID (0040,0032). Required if Universal Entity ID (0040,0032) is present.
See

table_lines.name: >Identifier Type Code
table_lines.comment: Type of Patient ID. Refer to HL7 v2 Table 0203 for Defined Terms.

table_lines.name: >Assigning Facility Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the Patient. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Assigning Jurisdiction Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: The geo-political body that assigned the Patient identifier. Typically a code for a country or a state/province. Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Assigning Agency or Department Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: The agency or department that assigned the Patient identifier. Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Algorithm Family Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The family of algorithm(s) that best describes the software algorithm used.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: Algorithm Name Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The code assigned by a manufacturer to a specific software algorithm.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Algorithm Name
table_lines.comment: The name assigned by a manufacturer to a specific software algorithm.

table_lines.name: Algorithm Version
table_lines.comment: The software version identifier assigned by a manufacturer to a specific software algorithm.

table_lines.name: Algorithm Parameters
table_lines.comment: The input parameters used by a manufacturer to configure the behavior of a specific software algorithm.

table_lines.name: Algorithm Source
table_lines.comment: Source of the algorithm, e.g., the name of the manufacturer, researcher, university, etc.

table_lines.name: Selector Attribute
table_lines.comment:
Data Element Tag of the Attribute to be referenced.
Required if the selected content is not a Sequence Item.

table_lines.name: Selector Value Number
table_lines.comment:
Non-negative integer identifying which value of a multi-valued Attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is to be referenced. The value 1 identifies the first value. The value 0 identifies all values.
When the Value Multiplicity of the Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is 1 then the value of this Attribute shall be 1.
Required if the selected content is a single Attribute of any VR other than SQ.

table_lines.name: Selector Sequence Pointer
table_lines.comment:
Contains the Data Element Tags of the path to the Sequence that contains the Attribute that is identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026) or to the Item(s) to be selected in Selector Sequence Pointer Items (0074,1057).
This Attribute shall have the same number of values as the level of nesting of Selector Attribute (0072,0026) or the selected Item(s).
Required if Selector Attribute (0072,0026) is nested in one or more Sequences or is absent.
See

table_lines.name: Selector Sequence Pointer Private Creator
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the creator of a group of Private Data Elements used to encode Attributes in the Selector Sequence Pointer (0072,0052).
This Attribute shall have the same number of values as Selector Sequence Pointer (0072,0052).
For values of the Selector Sequence Pointer (0072,0052) that are not the Data Element Tag of a Private Attribute, the corresponding value in Selector Sequence Pointer Private Creator (0072,0054) shall be empty.
Required if Selector Sequence Pointer (0072,0052) is present and one or more of the values of Selector Sequence Pointer (0072,0052) is the Data Element Tag of a Private Attribute.
See

table_lines.name: Selector Sequence Pointer Items
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the Item indices in the Selector Sequence Pointer (0072,0052).
This Attribute shall have the same number of values as the Selector Sequence Pointer (0072,0052).
The value 1 identifies the first Item of the corresponding Sequence. The value 0 identifies all Items of the corresponding Sequence.
Required if Selector Sequence Pointer (0072,0052) is present.
See

table_lines.name: Selector Attribute Private Creator
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the creator of a group of Private Data Elements.
Required if the Selector Attribute (0072,0026) value is the Data Element Tag of a Private Attribute.
See

table_lines.name: Selector Attribute Name
table_lines.comment:
Name of the Selector Attribute (0072,0026).
For Standard Data Elements, this shall be the value in the Name column of

table_lines.name: Selector Attribute Keyword
table_lines.comment:
Keyword of the Selector Attribute (0072,0026).
For Standard Data Elements, this shall be the value in the Keyword column of

table_lines.name: Selector Attribute VR
table_lines.comment:
Value Representation of the Selector Attribute (0072,0026).
For Standard Data Elements, this shall be the value in the VR column of

10-22.table_caption: Externally-Sourced Data Set Identification Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Data Set Name
table_lines.comment: The name assigned to the Externally-Sourced Data Set.

table_lines.name: Data Set Version
table_lines.comment: The software version identifier assigned to the Externally-Sourced Data Set.

table_lines.name: Data Set Source
table_lines.comment: Source of the Externally-Sourced Data Set. E.g., the name of the manufacturer, researcher, university, etc.

table_lines.name: Data Set Description
table_lines.comment: Description of the Externally-Sourced Data Set.

table_lines.name: Exposure Index
table_lines.comment: Measure of the detector response to radiation in the relevant image region of an image acquired with a digital X-Ray imaging system as defined in IEC 62494-1.

table_lines.name: Target Exposure Index
table_lines.comment: The target value used to calculate Deviation Index (0018,1413) as defined in IEC 62494-1.

table_lines.name: Deviation Index
table_lines.comment: A scaled representation of the difference of the Exposure Index compared to the Target Exposure Index as defined in IEC 62494-1 and the report of AAPM TG 116.

table_lines.name: View Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that describes the projection of the anatomic region of interest.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.comment:
View Modifier.

table_lines.comment: Table Top Longitudinal position in IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system (mm).

table_lines.name: Constraint Type
table_lines.comment:
Describes how the value(s) specified in the Constraint Value Sequence (0082,0034) shall be used to determine the acceptability of a given value for the Attribute identified by Selector Attribute (0072,0026)
See

table_lines.name: Constraint Violation Significance
table_lines.comment:
Level of significance of a Selector Attribute value exceeding this constraint.
See

table_lines.name: Constraint Violation Condition
table_lines.comment:
Conditionality of the constraint violation significance. If the condition is not met, the violation has no significance.
The condition may be expressed as a mathematical expression, a human readable text or other form.
Required if Constraint Violation Significance (0082,0036) is only significant under certain conditions.

table_lines.name: Constraint Value Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Value(s) used to constrain the contents of the Attribute referenced by the Selector Attribute (0072,0026).
Required if Constraint Type (0082,0032) is not UNCONSTRAINED.
If the Constraint Type (0082,0032) is GREATER_OR_EQUAL, LESS_OR_EQUAL, GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN, EQUAL or MEMBER_OF_CID only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
If the Constraint Type (0082,0032) is RANGE_INCL or RANGE_EXCL, exactly two Items shall be included in this Sequence, the first of which is less than or equal to the second.
If the Constraint Type (0082,0032) is MEMBER_OF or NOT_MEMBER_OF, one or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage:
Any sub-Sequences in the Constraint Value Sequence (0082,0034) shall only contain one Item.

Any Attribute in the Sequence Item(s) shall contain a single value.

If Constraint Type (0082,0032) is MEMBER_OF_CID, this shall be a Selector UI Value (0072,007F), despite the Selector Attribute VR (0072,0050) being SQ.

See

table_lines.name: Recommended Default Value Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Contains a default value for the contents of the Selector Attribute (0072,0026).
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Measurement Units Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Units of measurement for the values in the Item(s) in the Constraint Value Sequence (0082,0034) and the Recommended Default Value Sequence (0082,0035).
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Reference Location Label
table_lines.comment: Brief user-readable label for the location.

table_lines.name: Reference Location Description
table_lines.comment:
Further elaboration of the Reference Location.
The value may include a description of the relative anatomical location, the appearance of the feature or landmark, or how it can be identified.

table_lines.name: Reference Basis Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The anatomical feature or point of reference on which the reference location is based.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: Reference Geometry Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Characterizes the geometry of the reference location (e.g., a plane or point).
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: Offset Distance
table_lines.comment:
Positive offset (in mm) from the Reference Basis to the actual Reference Location.
See

table_lines.name: Offset Direction
table_lines.comment:
Direction of the offset (in terms of patient position) from the Reference Basis to the Reference Location.
Required if Offset Distance (0018,9904) is present.

table_lines.name: Protocol Element Number
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the protocol element and the order in which the elements are performed in the Protocol.
The value shall start at 1 and increase monotonically by 1.

table_lines.name: Protocol Element Name
table_lines.comment: Name for this protocol element.

table_lines.name: Protocol Element Purpose
table_lines.comment: Description of the purpose this element serves in the protocol.

table_lines.name: Protocol Element Characteristics Summary
table_lines.comment: Summary description of characteristics of this element.

table_lines.name: Unique Device Identifier
table_lines.comment:
The entire Human Readable Form of the UDI as defined by the Issuing Agency.
See

table_lines.name: Device Description
table_lines.comment:
Further description in free form text describing the device.
This can be used to distinguish between Items when multiple UDIs are recorded in a Sequence.

table_lines.name: Assertion Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The Assertion being made.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Assertion UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identification of this Assertion.

table_lines.name: Asserter Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The person or device making the Assertion.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Assertion DateTime
table_lines.comment: Date and time at which the Assertion was made.

table_lines.name: Assertion Expiration DateTime
table_lines.comment:
Date and time at which the Assertion expires.
If this Attribute is absent or empty, it means the Assertion does not have a pre-determined date and time at which it expires.

table_lines.name: Assertion Comments
table_lines.comment: Comments on the nature, extent or basis of the Assertion.

table_lines.name: Pertinent Documents Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Reference to document(s) that describe the Assertion semantics, or provide the basis for making the Assertion.
Items shall not be empty.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Referenced SOP Class UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identifier for the class of the referenced document.

table_lines.name: >HL7 Instance Identifier
table_lines.comment: Instance Identifier of the referenced document, encoded as a UID (OID or UUID), concatenated with a caret ("^") and Extension value (if Extension is present in Instance Identifier).

table_lines.name: >Retrieve URI
table_lines.comment:
Retrieval access path to the referenced document.
Includes fully specified scheme, authority, path, and query in accordance with

table_lines.name: Related Assertion Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Other Assertions which may be of interest to systems examining this Assertion.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Referenced Assertion UID
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies a related Assertion.

table_lines.name: Entity Label
table_lines.comment:
User-defined label for this entity.
See

table_lines.name: Entity Name
table_lines.comment:
User-defined name for this entity.
See

table_lines.name: Entity Description
table_lines.comment:
User-defined description for this entity.
See

table_lines.name: Entity Long Label
table_lines.comment:
User-defined label for this entity.
See

table_lines.name: Entity Description
table_lines.comment:
User-defined description for this entity.
See

table_lines.name: Conceptual Volume UID
table_lines.comment: A UID identifying the Conceptual Volume.

table_lines.name: Originating SOP Instance Reference Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Reference to the SOP Instance that contains the original definition of this Conceptual Volume identified by Conceptual Volume UID (3010,0006).
Required when Conceptual Volume UID (3010,0006) was not issued in the current SOP Instance, but read from another SOP Instance.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Equivalent Conceptual Volumes Sequence
table_lines.comment:
References one or more existing Conceptual Volumes that represent the same concept as the current Conceptual Volume.
This Sequence might be used when Conceptual Volume references of existing SOP Instances are retrospectively identified as representing the same entity.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >Referenced Conceptual Volume UID
table_lines.comment: A UID identifying the Conceptual Volume.

table_lines.name: >Equivalent Conceptual Volume Instance Reference Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Reference to a SOP Instance that contains the Referenced Conceptual Volume UID (3010,000B) of the Equivalent Conceptual Volume.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Derivation Conceptual Volume Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Description of a Conceptual Volume that was used to derive this Conceptual Volume.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Derivation Description
table_lines.comment: A user-readable text description of how this Conceptual Volume was derived.

table_lines.name: >Source Conceptual Volume Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The set of Conceptual Volumes that were used to derive this Conceptual Volume.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Source Conceptual Volume UID
table_lines.comment: UID identifying the Conceptual Volume that was used to derive this Conceptual Volume.

table_lines.name: >>Conceptual Volume Constituent Index
table_lines.comment:
Index of the constituent in the Source Conceptual Volume Sequence.
The value shall start at 1 and increase monotonically by 1.

table_lines.name: >>Conceptual Volume Constituent Segmentation Reference Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Contains the reference to the constituents of the RT Segment Annotation Instance from which Conceptual Volume is derived.
Zero or one Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>>Referenced Direct Segment Instance Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Reference to the SOP Instance that contains the Direct Segment Reference Sequence (3010,0023).
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >>>Referenced Segment Reference Index
table_lines.comment:
The Segment Reference Index (3010,0022) in the Segment Reference Sequence (3010,0021) corresponding to the segment representing this Conceptual Volume.
Shall reference only segment Items that contain the Direct Segment Reference Sequence (3010,0023).

table_lines.name: >Conceptual Volume Derivation Algorithm Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Algorithm used to derive this Conceptual Volume.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

10.34-1.table_caption: Conceptual Volume Segmentation Reference And Combination Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Conceptual Volume Combination Flag
table_lines.comment: Indication that this Conceptual Volume is a combination of other Conceptual Volumes.

table_lines.name: Conceptual Volume Constituent Sequence
table_lines.comment:
References to Conceptual Volumes which are constituents of this Conceptual Volume.
See
Required if Conceptual Volume Combination Flag (3010,000E) equals YES.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
The combined Conceptual Volume UID shall not be included in the Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Conceptual Volume Constituent Index
table_lines.comment:
An index referenced in the Conceptual Volume Combination Expression (3010,000C) identifying the Conceptual Volume Constituent.
The value shall start at 1 and increase monotonically by 1.

table_lines.name: >Constituent Conceptual Volume UID
table_lines.comment: UID identifying the Conceptual Volume that is a constituent of the combined Conceptual Volume.

table_lines.name: >Originating SOP Instance Reference Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Reference to the SOP Instance that contains the original definition of the Conceptual Volume constituent identified by Constituent Conceptual Volume UID (3010,0013) in this Sequence.
If this Conceptual Volume originated in the current SOP Instance, then the referenced SOP Instance UID is the current SOP Instance UID.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Conceptual Volume Constituent Segmentation Reference Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Contains a segmented representation of the Conceptual Volume constituent.
Required if the Conceptual Volume Segmentation Defined Flag (3010,0010) equals YES and the Conceptual Volume is not a Combination of other Conceptual Volumes.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >>Referenced Direct Segment Instance Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Reference to the SOP Instance that contains the Direct Segment Reference Sequence (3010,0023).
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >>Referenced Segment Reference Index
table_lines.comment:
The Segment Reference Index (3010,0022) in the Segment Reference Sequence (3010,0021) corresponding to the segment representing this Conceptual Volume.
Shall reference only segment Items that contain the Direct Segment Reference Sequence (3010,0023).

table_lines.name: Conceptual Volume Combination Expression
table_lines.comment:
Symbolic expression specifying the combination of Conceptual Volumes as a text string consisting of Conceptual Volume Constituent Index (3010,000D) values, combination operators and parentheses.
Required if Conceptual Volume Combination Flag (3010,000E) equals YES.
See

table_lines.name: Conceptual Volume Combination Description
table_lines.comment:
Human-readable description of the combination of Conceptual Volumes. This information is intended for display and shall not be used for structured processing.
Required if Conceptual Volume Combination Flag (3010,000E) equals YES.

table_lines.name: Conceptual Volume Segmentation Defined Flag
table_lines.comment: Indication that there are defined segmentations for this Conceptual Volume.

table_lines.name: Conceptual Volume Segmentation Reference Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Contains a segmented representation of the Conceptual Volume.
Required when Conceptual Volume Segmentation Defined Flag (3010,0010) equals YES and Conceptual Volume Combination Flag (3010,000E) equals NO.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >Referenced Direct Segment Instance Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Reference to the SOP Instance that contains the Segment Reference Sequence (3010,0021) in which the segment is defined.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >Referenced Segment Reference Index
table_lines.comment:
The Segment Reference Index (3010,0022) in the Segment Reference Sequence (3010,0021) corresponding to the segment representing this Conceptual Volume.
In the segment Item referenced, the Direct Segment Reference Sequence (3010,0023) shall be present.

table_lines.name: Manufacturer
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer of the device.

table_lines.name: Manufacturer's Model Name
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer's model name of the device.

table_lines.name: Manufacturer's Model Version
table_lines.comment: A version number of the Manufacturer's model of the device.

table_lines.name: Device Type Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The type of the device.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: Device Label
table_lines.comment: User-defined label for this device.

table_lines.name: Long Device Description
table_lines.comment: User-defined description for this device.

table_lines.name: Device Serial Number
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer's serial number of the device.

table_lines.name: Software Versions
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer's designation of software version of the equipment.

table_lines.name: Date of Manufacture
table_lines.comment: The date the device was originally manufactured or re-manufactured (as opposed to refurbished).

table_lines.name: Date of Installation
table_lines.comment: The date the device was installed in its current location. The device may or may not have been used prior to installation in its current location.

table_lines.name: UDI Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Unique Device Identifier (UDI) of the device.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Manufacturer's Device Identifier
table_lines.comment:
An identifier issued by the manufacturer.
See Note.

table_lines.name: Device Alternate Identifier
table_lines.comment: An identifier intended to be read by a device such as a bar code reader.

table_lines.name: Device Alternate Identifier Type
table_lines.comment:
Defines the type of Device Alternate Identifier.
Required if Device Alternate Identifier (3010,001B) has a value.

table_lines.name: Device Alternate Identifier Format
table_lines.comment:
Description of the format in which the Device Alternate Identifier (3010,001B) is issued.
Required if Device Alternate Identifier (3010,001B) has a value.
See

table_lines.name: Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Describes the purpose for which the references are made.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage: CID may be defined in the Macro invocation.

table_lines.name: Referenced Study Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Studies which are relevant for the invocation context.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Study Instance UID
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies the referenced Study.

table_lines.name: >Pertinent SOP Classes in Study
table_lines.comment:
The SOP Classes in the Study which are relevant for the invocation context.
If not present, all SOP Instances included in the referenced Study are considered relevant.

table_lines.name: >Referenced Series Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Series which are relevant for the invocation context.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Series Instance UID
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies the referenced Series.

table_lines.name: >>Pertinent SOP Classes in Series
table_lines.comment:
The SOP Classes in the Series which are relevant for the invocation context.
If not present, all SOP Instances included in the referenced Series are considered relevant.

table_lines.name: >>Referenced Image Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Image SOP Instances which are relevant in the invocation context.
One or more Items are permitted for this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Referenced Instance Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Non-Image SOP Instances which are relevant in the invocation context.
One or more Items are permitted for this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Outline Shape Type
table_lines.comment:
Type of shape of the outline.
See

table_lines.name: Outline Left Vertical Edge
table_lines.comment:
X-coordinate in mm of the left edge of the rectangular outline (parallel to the y-axis of the coordinate system).
Required if Outline Shape Type (0018,1630) is RECTANGULAR.
See

table_lines.name: Outline Right Vertical Edge
table_lines.comment:
X-coordinate in mm of the right edge of the rectangular outline (parallel to the y-axis of the coordinate system).
Required if Outline Shape Type (0018,1630) is RECTANGULAR.
See

table_lines.name: Outline Upper Horizontal Edge
table_lines.comment:
Y-coordinate in mm of the upper edge of the rectangular outline (parallel to the x-axis of the coordinate system).
Required if Outline Shape Type (0018,1630) is RECTANGULAR.
See

table_lines.name: Outline Lower Horizontal Edge
table_lines.comment:
Y-coordinate in mm of the lower edge of the rectangular outline (parallel to the x-axis of the coordinate system).
Required if Outline Shape Type (0018,1630) is RECTANGULAR.
See

table_lines.name: Center of Circular Outline
table_lines.comment:
Location (x,y) in mm of the center of the circular outline.
Required if Outline Shape Type (0018,1630) is CIRCULAR.
See

table_lines.name: Diameter of Circular Outline
table_lines.comment:
Diameter in mm of the circular outline.
Required if Outline Shape Type (0018,1630) is CIRCULAR.
See

table_lines.name: Number of Polygonal Vertices
table_lines.comment:
Number of Vertices in Vertices of the Polygonal Outline (0018,1638).
Required if Outline Shape Type (0018,1630) is POLYGONAL.

table_lines.name: Vertices of the Polygonal Outline
table_lines.comment:
A data stream of pairs of x and y in mm. Polygonal outlines are implicitly closed from the last vertex to the origin vertex and all edges shall be non-intersecting except at the vertices. Any given vertex shall occur only once in the data stream.
Required if Outline Shape Type (0018,1630) is POLYGONAL.
The number of pairs in this data stream shall equal the value of Number of Polygonal Vertices (0018,1637).
See

10.39-1.table_caption: Patient to Equipment Relationship Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Image to Equipment Mapping Matrix
table_lines.comment:
A rigid, homogeneous 4x4 transformation matrix that maps the patient coordinate space in the Frame of Reference used for the patient model to the coordinate system defined by the equipment. Matrix elements shall be listed in row-major order.
See

table_lines.name: Frame of Reference Transformation Comment
table_lines.comment: Comments entered by a human operator about the relationship between the patient frame of reference and the equipment. For display purposes only, shall not be used for other purposes.

table_lines.name: Patient Location Coordinates Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Specific points in the patient coordinate system which further characterize the position of the patient with respect to the equipment.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >3D Point Coordinates
table_lines.comment: Coordinate (x,y,z) in mm describing the location in the patient Frame of Reference that will be transformed to the Equipment Frame of Reference by using the Image to Equipment Mapping Matrix (0028,9520).

table_lines.name: >Patient Location Coordinates Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the type of Patient Location Coordinate.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Patient Support Position Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Actual Patient Support Position parameters. Shall be consistent with the Image to Equipment Mapping Matrix (0028,9520).
See
Zero or one Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Patient Support Position Specification Method
table_lines.comment: Method of specification for patient support parameters.

table_lines.name: Patient Support Position Device Parameter Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Translational and rotational parameters for Patient Support devices.
Required if Patient Support Position Specification Method (300A,065C) does not equal ABSENT.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence if Patient Support Position Specification Method (300A,065C) equals DEVICE_SPECIFIC.
Only one Item shall be included in this Sequence if Patient Support Position Specification Method (300A,065C) equals GLOBAL.

table_lines.name: >Referenced Device Index
table_lines.comment:
The value of Device Index (3010,0039) in Patient Support Devices Sequence (300A,0686) corresponding to the Patient Support Device in use.
Required if Patient Support Position Specification Method (300A,065C) equals DEVICE_SPECIFIC.

table_lines.name: >Device Order Index
table_lines.comment:
Index defining the order in which the Items in the Patient Support Position Device Parameter Sequence (300A,065D) are applied.
The value shall start at 1 and increase monotonically by 1.
Required if Patient Support Position Specification Method (300A,065C) equals DEVICE_SPECIFIC.
See

table_lines.name: >Patient Support Position Parameter Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Translational and rotational parameters for a particular Patient Support device.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Patient Support Position Parameter Order Index
table_lines.comment:
Index defining the order in which the Items in the Patient Support Position Parameter Sequence (300A,065B) are applied.
The value shall start at 1 and increase monotonically by 1.
Required if Patient Support Position Specification Method (300A,065C) equals DEVICE_SPECIFIC.
See

10.41-1.table_caption: General Procedure Protocol Reference Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Referenced Defined Protocol Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Defined Procedure Protocol SOP Instance(s) that were used for this Instance.
Required if this instance is a Performed Procedure Protocol that resulted from a Defined Procedure Protocol. May be present otherwise.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >Source Acquisition Protocol Element Number
table_lines.comment:
A single value corresponding to the Protocol Element Number (0018,9921) of the Acquisition Protocol Element Specification Sequence (0018,991F) that corresponds to this Instance.
Shall not be present if Source Reconstruction Protocol Element Number (0018,993A) is present.

table_lines.name: >Source Reconstruction Protocol Element Number
table_lines.comment:
A single value corresponding to the Protocol Element Number (0018,9921) of the Reconstruction Protocol Element Specification Sequence (0018,9933) that corresponds to this Instance.
Shall not be present if Source Acquisition Protocol Element Number (0018,9938) is present.

table_lines.name: Referenced Performed Protocol Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Performed Procedure Protocol SOP Instance(s) that describe the conditions by which this Instance was generated.
Required if a related Performed Procedure Protocol SOP Instance was created.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >Source Acquisition Protocol Element Number
table_lines.comment:
A single value corresponding to the Protocol Element Number (0018,9921) of the Acquisition Protocol Element Sequence (0018,9920) that corresponds to this Instance.
Shall not be present if Source Reconstruction Protocol Element Number (0018,993A) is present.

table_lines.name: >Source Reconstruction Protocol Element Number
table_lines.comment:
A single value corresponding to the Protocol Element Number (0018,9921) of the Reconstruction Protocol Element Sequence (0018,9934) that corresponds to this Instance.
Shall not be present if Source Acquisition Protocol Element Number (0018,9938) is present.

table_lines.name: Referenced Raw Data Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The Raw data that was used to derive this Image.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Referenced Waveform Sequence
table_lines.comment:
References to waveforms acquired in conjunction with this image. These Waveforms may or may not be temporally synchronized with this image.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Referenced Image Evidence Sequence
table_lines.comment:
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if the Referenced Image Sequence (0008,1140) is present and not empty, and the SOP Class UID of the referencing SOP Instance is not a legacy converted SOP Class (Legacy Converted Enhanced CT Image Storage "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.2.2", Legacy Converted Enhanced MR Image Storage "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.4.4", Legacy Converted Enhanced PET Image Storage "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.128.1"). May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Source Image Evidence Sequence
table_lines.comment:
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if the Source Image Sequence (0008,2112) is present and not empty, and the SOP Class UID of the referencing SOP Instance is not a legacy converted SOP Class (Legacy Converted Enhanced CT Image Storage "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.2.2", Legacy Converted Enhanced MR Image Storage "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.4.4", Legacy Converted Enhanced PET Image Storage "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.128.1"). May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Referenced Presentation State Sequence
table_lines.comment:
References to Presentation State instances created together with this instance
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if Presentation State is created together with the images.

table_lines.name: Referenced Study Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Uniquely identifies the Studies associated with the Patient. One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: Referenced Visit Sequence
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies the Visits associated with this Patient. One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Patient's Name
table_lines.comment: Patient's full name.

table_lines.name: Patient ID
table_lines.comment: Primary identifier for the Patient.

table_lines.name: Type of Patient ID
table_lines.comment: The type of identifier in the Patient ID (0010,0020).

table_lines.name: Other Patient IDs Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A Sequence of identification numbers or codes used to identify the Patient, which may or may not be human readable, and may or may not have been obtained from an implanted or attached device such as an RFID or barcode.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Patient ID
table_lines.comment: An identifier for the Patient.

table_lines.name: >Type of Patient ID
table_lines.comment: The type of identifier in the Patient ID (0010,0020) in this Item.

table_lines.name: Other Patient Names
table_lines.comment: Other names used to identify the Patient.

table_lines.name: Patient's Birth Name
table_lines.comment: Patient's birth name.

table_lines.name: Patient's Mother's Birth Name
table_lines.comment: Birth name of Patient's mother.

table_lines.name: Referenced Patient Photo Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A photo to confirm the identity of a Patient.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: Patient's Age
table_lines.comment: Age of the Patient.

table_lines.name: Occupation
table_lines.comment: Occupation of the Patient.

table_lines.name: Confidentiality Constraint on Patient Data Description
table_lines.comment: Special indication to the modality operator about confidentiality of Patient information (e.g., that he should not use the Patient's name where other patients are present).

table_lines.name: Patient's Birth Date
table_lines.comment: Date of birth of the named Patient.

table_lines.name: Patient's Birth Time
table_lines.comment: Time of birth of the named Patient.

table_lines.name: Patient's Sex
table_lines.comment: Sex of the named Patient.

table_lines.name: Quality Control Subject
table_lines.comment:
Indicates whether or not the subject is a quality control phantom.
If this Attribute is absent, then the subject may or may not be a phantom.
This Attribute describes a characteristic of the Imaging Subject. It is distinct from Quality Control Image (0028,0300) in the

table_lines.name: Patient's Insurance Plan Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: A Sequence that conveys the Patient's insurance plan. Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Patient's Primary Language Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The languages that can be used to communicate with the Patient.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence. The Items are ordered by preference (most preferred language to least preferred language).

table_lines.name: >Patient's Primary Language Modifier Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A modifier for a Patient's Primary Language. Can be used to specify a national language variant.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Patient's Size
table_lines.comment: Patient's height or length in meters.

table_lines.name: Patient's Weight
table_lines.comment: Weight of the Patient in kilograms.

table_lines.name: Patient's Size Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Patient's size category code
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Patient's Address
table_lines.comment: Legal address of the named Patient.

table_lines.name: Military Rank
table_lines.comment: Military rank of Patient.

table_lines.name: Branch of Service
table_lines.comment: Branch of the military. The country allegiance may also be included (e.g., U.S. Army).

table_lines.name: Country of Residence
table_lines.comment: Country in which Patient currently resides.

table_lines.name: Region of Residence
table_lines.comment: Region within Patient's country of residence.

table_lines.name: Patient's Telephone Numbers
table_lines.comment: Telephone numbers at which the Patient can be reached.

table_lines.name: Patient's Telecom Information
table_lines.comment: The Patient's personal telecommunication contact information, including telephone, email, or other telecom addresses.

table_lines.name: Ethnic Group
table_lines.comment: Ethnic group or race of Patient.

table_lines.name: Patient's Religious Preference
table_lines.comment: The religious preference of the Patient.

table_lines.name: Patient Comments
table_lines.comment: User-defined comments about the Patient.

table_lines.name: Responsible Person
table_lines.comment: Name of person with medical or welfare decision making authority for the Patient.

table_lines.name: Responsible Person Role
table_lines.comment:
Relationship of Responsible Person to the Patient.
See

table_lines.name: Responsible Organization
table_lines.comment: Name of organization with medical or welfare decision making authority for the Patient.

table_lines.name: Patient Species Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Patient Breed Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Breed Registration Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Information identifying a non-human organism within a breed registry.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Breed Registration Number
table_lines.comment: Identification number of a non-human organism within the registry.

table_lines.name: >Breed Registry Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the organization with which a non-human organism is registered.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Strain Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence. If more than one Item is present, each Item represents the same information but encoded using a different coding scheme (rather than post-coordinated modifiers).

table_lines.name: Strain Stock Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Information identifying a non-human organism within a strain stock.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Strain Source Registry Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Genetic Modifications Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The genetic modifications of the Patient.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >Genetic Modifications Description
table_lines.comment: The genetic modifications of the Patient described using a specific nomenclature.

table_lines.name: >Genetic Modifications Nomenclature
table_lines.comment: The nomenclature used for Genetic Modifications Description (0010,0222).

table_lines.name: >Genetic Modifications Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A coded identification of the genetic modifications of the Patient.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence. If more than one Item is present, each Item represents the same information but encoded using a different coding scheme (rather than post-coordinated modifiers).

table_lines.name: Medical Alerts
table_lines.comment: Conditions to which medical staff should be alerted (e.g., contagious condition, drug allergies, etc.).

table_lines.name: Allergies
table_lines.comment: Description of prior reaction to contrast agents, or other Patient allergies or adverse reactions.

table_lines.name: Smoking Status
table_lines.comment: Indicates whether Patient smokes.

table_lines.name: Additional Patient History
table_lines.comment: Additional information about the Patient's medical history.

table_lines.name: Pregnancy Status
table_lines.comment: Describes pregnancy state of Patient.

table_lines.name: Last Menstrual Date
table_lines.comment: Date of onset of last menstrual period.

table_lines.name: Patient's Sex Neutered
table_lines.comment: Whether or not a procedure has been performed in an effort to render the Patient sterile.

table_lines.name: Patient's Body Mass Index
table_lines.comment: Body Mass Index of the Patient in kg/m2.

table_lines.name: Measured AP Dimension
table_lines.comment: The thickness in mm of the body part being scanned, in the antero-posterior dimension (per AAPM Report 204).

table_lines.name: Measured Lateral Dimension
table_lines.comment: The side-to-side (left to right) dimension in mm of the body part being scanned (per AAPM Report 204).

table_lines.name: Special Needs
table_lines.comment: Medical and social needs (e.g., wheelchair, oxygen, translator, etc.).

table_lines.name: Patient State
table_lines.comment: Description of Patient state (comatose, disoriented, vision impaired, etc.).

table_lines.name: Pertinent Documents Sequence
table_lines.comment:
List of Documents (e.g., SR, or CDA) that contain information considered pertinent for the Patient medical condition.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: Describes the purpose for which the document reference is made. Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Document Title
table_lines.comment: Title of the referenced document.

table_lines.name: Pertinent Resources Sequence
table_lines.comment:
List of resources that contain information considered pertinent for the Patient medical condition.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Retrieve URI
table_lines.comment: biblio_RFC_3986

table_lines.name: >Resource Description
table_lines.comment: Description or title of the resource.

table_lines.name: Patient Clinical Trial Participation Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of identifiers for clinical trials or research in which the Patient participates.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Clinical Trial Sponsor Name
table_lines.comment: The name of the clinical trial or research sponsor, responsible for conducting the clinical trial and for defining the Clinical Trial Protocol.

table_lines.name: >Clinical Trial Protocol ID
table_lines.comment: Identifier for the noted protocol, used by the Clinical Trial Sponsor to uniquely identify the investigational protocol.

table_lines.name: >Clinical Trial Protocol Name
table_lines.comment: The name or title of the clinical trial or research protocol.

table_lines.name: >Clinical Trial Site ID
table_lines.comment: The identifier, issued by the Clinical Trial Sponsor, of the site responsible for submitting clinical trial or research data.

table_lines.name: >Clinical Trial Site Name
table_lines.comment: Name of the site responsible for submitting clinical trial or research data.

table_lines.name: >Clinical Trial Subject ID
table_lines.comment: The assigned identifier for the Patient as a clinical trial or research subject.

table_lines.name: >Clinical Trial Subject Reading ID
table_lines.comment: Identifies the Patient as a clinical trial or research subject for blinded evaluations.

table_lines.name: Referenced Study Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Uniquely identifies the Studies associated with the Visit. One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: Referenced Patient Sequence
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies the Patient that relates to the Visit. Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Institution Name

table_lines.comment: Institution-generated description or classification of the Scheduled Procedure Step to be performed.
