table_lines.comment: Sequence describing the Scheduled Protocol following a specified coding scheme. One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>>Content Item Modifier Sequence

Sequence that specifies modifiers for a Protocol Context Content Item.

table_lines.comment: Identifier that identifies the Scheduled Procedure Step.

table_lines.name: >Scheduled Procedure Step Status
table_lines.comment: A Real World condition that may affect the selection of the Scheduled Procedure Step.

table_lines.name: >Comments on the Scheduled Procedure Step
table_lines.comment: User-defined comments on the Scheduled Procedure Step.

table_lines.comment:
Type of device, process or method for which the Scheduled Procedure Step is scheduled.

table_lines.comment: Contrast agent requested for use in the Scheduled Procedure Step.

table_lines.name: >Pre-Medication
table_lines.comment: Medication to be administered at the beginning of the Scheduled Procedure Step, e.g., Nuclear Medicine radiopharmaceutical.

table_lines.name: >Anatomical Orientation Type
table_lines.comment: The anatomical orientation type appropriate for this Patient.

table_lines.comment: A unique identifier of the RT Treatment Session to which Instances created during this Procedure Step will belong.

table_lines.comment: Sequence of Items identifying specimens to be imaged in the identified Scheduled Procedure Step(s), with their characteristics.

table_lines.comment: Barcode interpreted from a scanned label.

table_lines.comment: Identifier that identifies the Requested Procedure in the Imaging Service Request.

table_lines.comment: Reason for requesting this imaging procedure.

table_lines.comment: User-defined comments on the Requested Procedure.

table_lines.comment:

table_lines.comment:
A Sequence that conveys the Requested Procedure of one Procedure Type.

table_lines.name: Study Instance UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identifier to be used to identify the Study.

table_lines.name: Study Date
table_lines.comment: Date the Study started, if any previous procedure steps within the same Study have already been performed.

table_lines.name: Study Time
table_lines.comment: Time the Study started, if any previous procedure steps within the same Study have already been performed.

table_lines.name: Referenced Study Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Uniquely identifies the Studies associated with this SOP Instance.

table_lines.name: Requested Procedure Description
table_lines.comment: Institution-generated administrative description or classification of Requested Procedure.

table_lines.name: Requested Procedure Priority
table_lines.comment: Requested Procedure Type Urgency.

table_lines.name: Patient Transport Arrangements
table_lines.comment: Mode of transportation of the Patient to the location of examination.

table_lines.name: Requested Procedure Location
table_lines.comment: Physical location at which the Requested Procedure is to be performed.

table_lines.name: Confidentiality Code
table_lines.comment: Confidentiality Constraints on the Requested Procedure by the party filling the order.

table_lines.name: Reporting Priority
table_lines.comment: Requested Reporting Priority.

table_lines.name: Names of Intended Recipients of Results
table_lines.comment: Names of the physicians, who are intended recipients of results.

table_lines.name: Intended Recipients of Results Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the physicians who are intended recipients of results.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Names of Intended Recipients of Results (0040,1010), if present.

table_lines.name: Imaging Service Request Comments
table_lines.comment: User-defined comments on the Imaging Service Request.

table_lines.name: Requesting Physician Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment:

table_lines.name: Referring Physician's Name
table_lines.comment: Name of the Patient's referring physician for this Imaging Service Request.

table_lines.name: Referring Physician Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the Patient's referring physician.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Requesting Service
table_lines.comment:
Institutional department, unit or service where the request initiated.

table_lines.comment:
Institutional department, unit or service where the request initiated. Equivalent to HL7 v2.x ORC-17.

table_lines.comment: A departmental Information System generated number that identifies the Imaging Service Request.

table_lines.comment:

table_lines.comment: Date on which the Imaging Service Request was issued by the requester.

table_lines.comment: Time at which the Imaging Service Request was issued by the requester.

table_lines.name: Placer Order Number / Imaging Service Request
table_lines.comment: The order number assigned to the Imaging Service Request by the party placing the order.

table_lines.name: Order Placer Identifier Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifier of the Assigning Authority that issued the Placer Order Number.

table_lines.comment: The order number assigned to the Imaging Service Request by the party filling the order.

table_lines.name: Order Filler Identifier Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifier of the Assigning Authority that issued the Filler Order Number.

table_lines.comment: The location at which the Imaging Service Request was entered.

table_lines.comment: Telephone Number at which additional information can be retrieved.

table_lines.comment: The telecommunication contact information, including telephone, email, or other telecom addresses, at which additional information about the order can be retrieved.

table_lines.name: Admission ID
table_lines.comment: Identification number of the Visit as assigned by the healthcare provider

table_lines.name: Issuer of Admission ID Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifier of the Assigning Authority that issued the Admission ID.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Reason for Visit
table_lines.comment: Reason(s) for this visit by the patient to the facility or provider.

table_lines.name: Reason for Visit Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Coded reason(s) for this visit by the patient to the facility or provider.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.comment: Date on which the Performed Procedure Step ended.

table_lines.comment: Time at which the Performed Procedure Step ended.

table_lines.comment: Contains the state of the Performed Procedure Step.

table_lines.comment: User-defined comments on the Performed Procedure Step.

table_lines.comment: The reason the Performed Procedure Step Status (0040,0252) was set to DISCONTINUED.

table_lines.comment:

table_lines.comment:
Sequence that specifies the context for the Performed Protocol Code Sequence (0040,0260) Item.

Sequence that specifies modifiers for a Protocol Context Content Item.

table_lines.comment:
Attributes of the Series that comprise this Modality Performed Procedure Step.

table_lines.comment:

table_lines.name: >Operators' Name
table_lines.comment: Name(s) of the operator(s) who supporting this Series.

table_lines.comment: Title of the DICOM Application Entity where the Images and other Composite SOP Instances in this Series may be retrieved on the network.

table_lines.comment: The Instances in this Series are expected to be archived in the long term archive.

table_lines.comment: The identifier for the container that contains the specimen(s) imaged.

table_lines.comment:
Sequence of identifiers and detailed description of the specimen(s) imaged.

table_lines.comment: A departmental information system identifier for the Specimen.

table_lines.name: >>>Specimen UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identifier for the Specimen.

table_lines.comment:
Uniquely identifies Instances, other than images, of any SOP Class that conforms to the DICOM Composite IOD Information Model, such as Waveforms, Presentation States or Structured Reports, created during the acquisition of the procedure step, and that are not referenced in Referenced Image Sequence (0008,1140).

table_lines.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
table_lines.comment:

table_lines.name: >Series Instance UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identifier of the Series of which all the Instances referenced in this Item are part.

table_lines.name: >Referenced SOP Sequence
table_lines.comment:

table_lines.comment: Date of birth of the named Patient in the Alternative Calendar (0010,0035).

table_lines.comment: Date of death of the named Patient in the Alternative Calendar (0010,0035).

This Attribute describes a characteristic of the Imaging Subject. It is distinct from Quality Control Image (0028,0300) in the

Information identifying a non-human organism within a breed registry.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if the Patient is a non-human organism.

table_lines.name: >Breed Registration Number
table_lines.comment: Identification number of a non-human organism within the registry.

table_lines.name: >Breed Registry Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the organization with which a non-human organism is registered.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Strain Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence. If more than one Item is present, each Item represents the same information but encoded using a different coding scheme (rather than post-coordinated modifiers).

table_lines.name: Strain Stock Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Information identifying a non-human organism within a strain stock.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Strain Source Registry Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Genetic Modifications Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The genetic modifications of the Patient.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >Genetic Modifications Description
table_lines.comment: The genetic modifications of the Patient described using a specific nomenclature.

table_lines.name: >Genetic Modifications Nomenclature
table_lines.comment: The nomenclature used for Genetic Modifications Description (0010,0222).

table_lines.name: >Genetic Modifications Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A coded identification of the genetic modifications of the Patient.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence. If more than one Item is present, each Item represents the same information but encoded using a different coding scheme (rather than post-coordinated modifiers).

table_lines.name: Responsible Person
table_lines.comment:
Name of person with medical or welfare decision making authority for the Patient.
Required if the Patient is a non-human organism. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Responsible Person Role
table_lines.comment:
Relationship of Responsible Person to the Patient.
See
Required if Responsible Person is present and has a value.

table_lines.name: Responsible Organization
table_lines.comment:
Name of organization with medical or welfare decision making authority for the Patient.
Required if Patient is a non-human organism. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Patient Identity Removed
table_lines.comment: The true identity of the Patient has been removed from the Attributes and the Pixel Data

table_lines.name: De-identification Method
table_lines.comment:
A description or label of the mechanism or method use to remove the Patient's identity. May be multi-valued if successive de-identification steps have been performed.
Required if Patient Identity Removed (0012,0062) is present and has a value of YES and De-identification Method Code Sequence (0012,0064) is not present. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: De-identification Method Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A code describing the mechanism or method use to remove the Patient's identity.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence. Multiple Items are used if successive de-identification steps have been performed or to describe options of a defined profile.
Required if Patient Identity Removed (0012,0062) is present and has a value of YES and De-identification Method (0012,0063) is not present. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Clinical Trial Protocol Ethics Committee Name
table_lines.comment: Name of the Ethics Committee or Institutional Review Board (IRB) or Institutional Animal Care and Use Committees (IACUC) responsible for approval of the Clinical Trial or research. Required if Clinical Trial Protocol Ethics Committee Approval Number (0012,0082) is present.

table_lines.name: Clinical Trial Protocol Ethics Committee Approval Number
table_lines.comment: Approval number issued by committee described in Clinical Trial Protocol Ethics Committee Name (0012,0081).

table_lines.name: Source Patient Group Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment: Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Patient ID
table_lines.comment: Primary identifier for the group of subjects.

table_lines.name: Group of Patients Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment: One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Patient ID
table_lines.comment: Primary identifier for an individual subject.

table_lines.name: Study Instance UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identifier for the Study.

table_lines.name: Study Date
table_lines.comment: Date the Study started.

table_lines.name: Study Time
table_lines.comment: Time the Study started.

table_lines.name: Referring Physician's Name
table_lines.comment: Name of the Patient's referring physician.

table_lines.name: Referring Physician Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the Patient's referring physician.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Consulting Physician's Name
table_lines.comment: Consulting physician(s) for this Patient Visit.

table_lines.name: Consulting Physician Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the consulting physician(s).
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Consulting Physician's Name (0008,009C), if present.

table_lines.name: Study ID
table_lines.comment: User or equipment generated Study identifier.

table_lines.name: Accession Number
table_lines.comment: A departmental Information System generated number that identifies the Imaging Service Request.

table_lines.name: Issuer of Accession Number Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifier of the Assigning Authority that issued the Accession Number.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Study Description
table_lines.comment: Institution-generated description or classification of the Study performed.

table_lines.name: Physician(s) of Record
table_lines.comment: sect_C.7.3.1

table_lines.name: Physician(s) of Record Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the physician(s) who are responsible for overall Patient care at time of Study.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Physician(s) of Record (0008,1048), if present.

table_lines.name: Name of Physician(s) Reading Study
table_lines.comment: Names of the physician(s) reading the Study.

table_lines.name: Physician(s) Reading Study Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment: Identification of the physician(s) reading the Study. One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Name of Physician(s) Reading Study (0008,1060), if present.

table_lines.name: Requesting Service
table_lines.comment:
Institutional department, unit or service where the request initiated.
See Note

table_lines.name: Requesting Service Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Institutional department, unit or service where the request initiated.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Referenced Study Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A Sequence that provides reference to a Study.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: Procedure Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A Sequence that conveys the type of procedure performed.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Reason For Performed Procedure Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Coded reason(s) for performing this procedure.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Admitting Diagnoses Description
table_lines.comment: Description of the admitting diagnosis (diagnoses).

table_lines.name: Admitting Diagnoses Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A Sequence that conveys the admitting diagnosis (diagnoses).
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Patient's Age
table_lines.comment: Age of the Patient.

table_lines.name: Patient's Size
table_lines.comment: Length or size of the Patient, in meters.

table_lines.name: Patient's Weight
table_lines.comment: Weight of the Patient, in kilograms.

table_lines.name: Patient's Body Mass Index
table_lines.comment: Body Mass Index of the Patient in kg/m2.

table_lines.name: Measured AP Dimension
table_lines.comment: The thickness in mm of the body part being scanned, in the antero-posterior dimension (per AAPM Report 204).

table_lines.name: Measured Lateral Dimension
table_lines.comment: The side-to-side (left to right) dimension in mm of the body part being scanned (per AAPM Report 204).

table_lines.name: Patient's Size Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Patient's size category code
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Medical Alerts
table_lines.comment: Conditions to which medical staff should be alerted (e.g., contagious condition, drug allergies, etc.).

table_lines.name: Allergies
table_lines.comment: Description of prior reaction to contrast agents, or other patient allergies or adverse reactions.

table_lines.name: Smoking Status
table_lines.comment: Indicates whether Patient smokes.

table_lines.name: Pregnancy Status
table_lines.comment: Describes pregnancy state of Patient.

table_lines.name: Last Menstrual Date
table_lines.comment: Date of onset of last menstrual period.

table_lines.name: Patient State
table_lines.comment: Description of Patient state (comatose, disoriented, vision impaired, etc.).

table_lines.name: Occupation
table_lines.comment: Occupation of the Patient.

table_lines.name: Additional Patient History
table_lines.comment: Additional information about the Patient's medical history.

table_lines.name: Admission ID
table_lines.comment: Identifier of the Visit as assigned by the healthcare provider

table_lines.name: Issuer of Admission ID Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifier of the Assigning Authority that issued Admission ID (0038,0010).
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Reason for Visit
table_lines.comment: Reason(s) for this visit by the patient to the facility or provider.

table_lines.name: Reason for Visit Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Coded reason(s) for this visit by the patient to the facility or provider.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Service Episode ID
table_lines.comment: Identifier of the Service Episode as assigned by the healthcare provider.

table_lines.name: Issuer of Service Episode ID Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifier of the Assigning Authority that issued the Service Episode ID (0038,0060).
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Service Episode Description
table_lines.comment: Description of the type of service episode.

table_lines.name: Patient's Sex Neutered
table_lines.comment:
Whether or not a procedure has been performed in an effort to render the Patient sterile.
Required if Patient is a non-human organism. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Clinical Trial Time Point Type Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Longitudinal Temporal Offset from Event
table_lines.comment: An offset in days from a particular event of significance. May be fractional. In the context of a clinical trial, this is often the days since enrollment, or the baseline imaging Study.

table_lines.name: Longitudinal Temporal Event Type
table_lines.comment:
The type of event to which Longitudinal Temporal Offset from Event (0012,0052) is relative.
Required if Longitudinal Temporal Offset from Event (0012,0052) is present.

table_lines.name: Consent for Clinical Trial Use Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A Sequence that conveys information about consent for Clinical Trial or research use of the Composite Instances within this Study.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >Distribution Type
table_lines.comment:
The type of distribution for which consent to distribute has been granted.
See
Required if Consent for Distribution Flag (0012,0085) equals YES or WITHDRAWN.

table_lines.name: >Clinical Trial Protocol ID
table_lines.comment:
The identifier of the protocol for which consent to distribute has been granted.
Required if Distribution Type (0012,0084) is NAMED_PROTOCOL and the protocol is not that which is specified in Clinical Trial Protocol ID (0012,0020) in the

table_lines.name: >Consent for Distribution Flag
table_lines.comment:
Whether or not consent to distribute has been granted for the purpose described in Distribution Type (0012,0084).
See

table_lines.name: Modality
table_lines.comment:
Type of device, process or method that originally acquired or produced the data used to create the Instances in this Series.
See

table_lines.name: Series Instance UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identifier of the Series.

table_lines.name: Series Number
table_lines.comment: A number that identifies this Series.

table_lines.name: Laterality
table_lines.comment: Laterality of (paired) body part examined. Required if the body part examined is a paired structure and Image Laterality (0020,0062) or Frame Laterality (0020,9072) or Measurement Laterality (0024,0113) are not present.

table_lines.name: Series Date
table_lines.comment: Date the Series started.

table_lines.name: Series Time
table_lines.comment: Time the Series started.

table_lines.name: Performing Physician's Name
table_lines.comment: Name of the physician(s) administering the Series.

table_lines.name: Performing Physician Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the physician(s) administering the Series.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Performing Physician's Name (0008,1050), if present.

table_lines.name: Protocol Name
table_lines.comment: User-defined description of the conditions under which the Series was performed.

table_lines.name: Series Description
table_lines.comment: Description of the Series.

table_lines.name: Series Description Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A coded description of the Series.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Operators' Name
table_lines.comment: Name(s) of the operator(s) supporting the Series.

table_lines.name: Operator Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the operator(s) supporting the Series.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Operators' Name (0008,1070), if present.

table_lines.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Uniquely identifies the Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance to which the Series is related.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Related Series Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identification of Series significantly related to this Series.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Study Instance UID
table_lines.comment: Instance UID of Study to which the related Series belongs.

table_lines.name: >Series Instance UID
table_lines.comment: Instance UID of Related Series.

table_lines.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Describes the purpose for which the reference is made.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
When absent, implies that the reason for the reference is unknown.

table_lines.name: Body Part Examined
table_lines.comment: Text description of the part of the body examined. See

table_lines.name: Patient Position
table_lines.comment:
Patient position descriptor relative to the equipment. Required for images where Patient Orientation Code Sequence (0054,0410) is not present and whose SOP Class is one of the following: CT ("1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.2") or MR ("1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.4") or Enhanced CT ("1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.2.1") or Enhanced MR Image ("1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.4.1") or Enhanced Color MR Image ("1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.4.3") or MR Spectroscopy ("1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.4.2") Storage SOP Classes.
May be present for other SOP Classes if Patient Orientation Code Sequence (0054,0410) is not present.
See

table_lines.name: Smallest Pixel Value in Series
table_lines.comment: The minimum value of all images in this Series.

table_lines.name: Largest Pixel Value in Series
table_lines.comment: The maximum value of all images in this Series.

table_lines.name: Request Attributes Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that contains Attributes from the Imaging Service Request.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Anatomical Orientation Type
table_lines.comment:
The anatomical orientation type used in Instances generated by this equipment.
Required if the Patient is a non-human organism and the anatomical Frame of Reference is not bipedal. May be present otherwise. See

table_lines.name: Treatment Session UID
table_lines.comment: A unique identifier of the RT Treatment Session to which Instances in this Series belong.

table_lines.name: Series Number
table_lines.comment: A number that identifies this Series.

table_lines.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Uniquely identifies the Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance to which the Series is related.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if a Performed Procedure Step SOP Class was involved in the creation of this Series.

table_lines.name: Synchronization Trigger
table_lines.comment: Data acquisition synchronization with external equipment

table_lines.name: Trigger Source or Type
table_lines.comment: Specifies equipment ID of trigger source and/or type of trigger.

table_lines.name: Synchronization Channel
table_lines.comment: Required if synchronization channel or trigger is encoded in a waveform in this SOP Instance.

table_lines.name: Acquisition Time Synchronized
table_lines.comment:
Acquisition DateTime (0008,002A) synchronized with external time reference.
See

table_lines.name: Time Source
table_lines.comment: ID of equipment or system providing time reference.

table_lines.name: Time Distribution Protocol
table_lines.comment: Method of time distribution used to synchronize this equipment.

table_lines.name: NTP Source Address
table_lines.comment: IP Address of NTP, SNTP, or PTP time source. IPv4 addresses shall be in dotted decimal (e.g., 192.168.1.1). The IPv6 addresses shall be in colon separated hexadecimal (e.g., 12:34:56:78:9a:bc:de:f0).

table_lines.name: Manufacturer
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer of the equipment that produced the Composite Instances.

table_lines.name: Institution Name
table_lines.comment: Institution where the equipment that produced the Composite Instances is located.

table_lines.name: Institution Address
table_lines.comment: Mailing address of the institution where the equipment that produced the Composite Instances is located.

table_lines.name: Station Name
table_lines.comment: User defined name identifying the machine that produced the Composite Instances.

table_lines.name: Institutional Department Name
table_lines.comment: Department in the institution where the equipment that produced the Composite Instances is located.

table_lines.name: Institutional Department Type Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A coded description of the type of Department or Service within the healthcare facility.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Manufacturer's Model Name
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer's model name of the equipment that produced the Composite Instances.

table_lines.name: Manufacturer's Device Class UID
table_lines.comment:
Manufacturer's Unique Identifier (UID) for the class of the device.
A class is a manufacturer-specific grouping concept with no DICOM-defined scope or criteria. A class is independent from a marketing-defined make, model or version.
A class allows grouping of devices with a similar set of capabilities.
This Attribute may be multi-valued if this device is a member of more than one class.

table_lines.name: Device Serial Number
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer's serial number of the equipment that produced the Composite Instances.

table_lines.name: Gantry ID
table_lines.comment: Identifier of the gantry or positioner.

table_lines.name: UDI Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Unique Device Identifier (UDI) of the entire equipment. For example, the entire CT Scanner.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Device UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identifier of the equipment that produced the Composite Instances.

table_lines.name: Spatial Resolution
table_lines.comment: The inherent limiting resolution in mm of the acquisition equipment for high contrast objects for the data gathering and reconstruction technique chosen. If variable across the images of the Series, the value at the image center.

table_lines.name: Date of Manufacture
table_lines.comment: The date the equipment that produced the Composite Instances was originally manufactured or re-manufactured (as opposed to refurbished).

table_lines.name: Date of Installation
table_lines.comment: The date the equipment that produced the Composite Instances was installed in its current location. The equipment may or may not have been used prior to installation in its current location.

table_lines.name: Pixel Padding Value
table_lines.comment: Required if Pixel Padding Range Limit (0028,0121) is present and either Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) or Pixel Data Provider URL (0028,7FE0) is present. May be present otherwise only if Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) or Pixel Data Provider URL (0028,7FE0) is present.

table_lines.name: Manufacturer
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer of the equipment that produced the Composite Instances.

table_lines.name: Manufacturer's Model Name
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer's model name of the equipment that produced the Composite Instances.

table_lines.name: Device Serial Number
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer's serial number of the equipment that produced the Composite Instances.

table_lines.name: Instance Number
table_lines.comment: A number that identifies this image.

table_lines.name: Content Date
table_lines.comment:
The date the image pixel data creation started.
Required if image is part of a Series in which the images are temporally related. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Content Time
table_lines.comment:
The time the image pixel data creation started.
Required if image is part of a Series in which the images are temporally related. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Image Comments
table_lines.comment: User-defined comments about the image.

table_lines.name: Quality Control Image
table_lines.comment:
Indicates whether or not quality control material (such as calibration or control material, or a phantom) is present in this image.
If this Attribute is absent, then the image may or may not be a quality control or phantom image. The phantom device or quality control material in the image can be described using the

table_lines.name: Burned In Annotation
table_lines.comment:
Indicates whether or not image contains sufficient burned in annotation to identify the patient and date the image was acquired.
If this Attribute is absent, then the image may or may not contain burned in annotation.

table_lines.name: Recognizable Visual Features
table_lines.comment:
Indicates whether or not the image contains sufficiently recognizable visual features to allow the image or a reconstruction from a set of images to identify the Patient.
If this Attribute is absent, then the image may or may not contain recognizable visual features.

table_lines.name: Lossy Image Compression
table_lines.comment:
Specifies whether an Image has undergone lossy compression (at a point in its lifetime).
Once this value has been set to "01" it shall not be reset.
See

table_lines.name: Lossy Image Compression Ratio
table_lines.comment:
Describes the approximate lossy compression ratio(s) that have been applied to this image.
See

table_lines.name: Lossy Image Compression Method
table_lines.comment:
A label for the lossy compression method(s) that have been applied to this image.
See

table_lines.name: Icon Image Sequence
table_lines.comment:
This icon image is representative of the Image.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Presentation LUT Shape
table_lines.comment:
When present, specifies an identity transformation for the Presentation LUT such that the output of all grayscale transformations, if any, are defined to be in P-Values.
When this Attribute is used with a color photometric interpretation then the luminance component is in P-Values.

table_lines.name: Real World Value Mapping Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The mapping of stored values to associated Real World values.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Image Laterality
table_lines.comment:
Laterality of (possibly paired) body part (as described in Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218)) examined.
Shall be consistent with any laterality information contained in Primary Anatomic Structure Modifier Sequence (0008,2230) and/or Laterality (0020,0060), if present.

table_lines.usage:
Anatomic Region Sequence B

Anatomic Region Sequence B

table_lines.name: Slice Thickness
table_lines.comment: Nominal slice thickness, in mm.

table_lines.name: Spacing Between Slices
table_lines.comment:
Spacing between adjacent slices, in mm. The spacing is measured from the center-to-center of each slice.
If present, shall not be negative, unless specialized to define the meaning of the sign in a specialized IOD, e.g., as in the

table_lines.usage:
Required if the IOD is not being transferred in a STOW-RS Request and is not encoded as metadata and compressed bulk pixel data. May be present otherwise.

See

table_lines.name: Pixel Data
table_lines.comment: Required if Pixel Data Provider URL (0028,7FE0) is not present.

table_lines.name: Pixel Data Provider URL
table_lines.comment:
A URL of a provider service that supplies the pixel data of the Image.
Required if the image is to be transferred in one of the following presentation contexts identified by Transfer Syntax UID:

table_lines.name: Pixel Padding Range Limit
table_lines.comment: Required if pixel padding is to be defined as a range rather than a single value.

table_lines.name: Extended Offset Table
table_lines.comment:
Byte offsets of the Frames in the Sequence of Items in Encapsulated Pixel Data encoded in Pixel Data (7FE0,0010).
See
May only be present when:

table_lines.name: Extended Offset Table Lengths
table_lines.comment:
Byte lengths of the Frames in the Sequence of Items in Encapsulated Pixel Data encoded in Pixel Data (7FE0,0010).
See
Required if Extended Offset Table (7FE0,0001) is present and every frame is encoded as a single fragment.

table_lines.name: Rows
table_lines.comment:
Number of rows in the image.
Shall be an exact multiple of the vertical downsampling factor if any of the samples (planes) are encoded downsampled in the vertical direction for pixel data encoded in a Native (uncompressed) format. E.g., required to be an even value for a Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) of YBR_FULL_422.

table_lines.name: Columns
table_lines.comment:
Number of columns in the image.
Shall be an exact multiple of the horizontal downsampling factor if any of the samples (planes) are encoded downsampled in the horizontal direction for pixel data encoded in a Native (uncompressed) format. E.g., required to be an even value for a Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) of YBR_FULL_422.

table_lines.name: Bits Allocated
table_lines.comment: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. Bits Allocated (0028,0100) shall be either 1, or a multiple of 8. See

table_lines.name: Bits Stored
table_lines.comment: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored. See

table_lines.name: High Bit
table_lines.comment: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. Each sample shall have the same high bit. High Bit (0028,0102) shall be one less than Bits Stored (0028,0101). See

table_lines.name: Pixel Representation
table_lines.comment: Data representation of the pixel samples. Each sample shall have the same pixel representation.

table_lines.name: Smallest Image Pixel Value
table_lines.comment: The minimum actual pixel value encountered in this image.

table_lines.name: Largest Image Pixel Value
table_lines.comment: The maximum actual pixel value encountered in this image.

table_lines.name: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
Green Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data
Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data
Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data
ICC Profile
table_lines.comment:
An ICC Profile encoding the transformation of device-dependent color stored pixel values into PCS-Values.
See
When present, defines the color space of color Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) values, and the output of Palette Color Lookup Table Data (0028,1201-1203).

table_lines.name: Color Space
table_lines.comment:
A label that identifies the well-known color space of the image. Shall be consistent with any ICC Profile (0028,2000) that is also present.
See

table_lines.name: Contrast/Bolus Agent
table_lines.comment: Contrast or bolus agent.

table_lines.name: Contrast/Bolus Agent Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies the contrast agent.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Contrast/Bolus Route
table_lines.comment: Administration route of contrast agent.

table_lines.name: Contrast/Bolus Administration Route Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies the route of administration of contrast agent.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Additional Drug Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies any additional drug that is administered with the contrast agent bolus.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Contrast/Bolus Volume
table_lines.comment: Volume injected in milliliters of diluted contrast agent.

table_lines.name: Contrast/Bolus Start Time
table_lines.comment: Time of start of injection.

table_lines.name: Contrast/Bolus Stop Time
table_lines.comment: Time of end of contrast injection.

table_lines.name: Contrast/Bolus Total Dose
table_lines.comment: Total amount in milliliters of the undiluted contrast agent.

table_lines.name: Contrast Flow Rate
table_lines.comment: Rate(s) of injection(s) in milliliters/sec.

table_lines.name: Contrast Flow Duration
table_lines.comment: Duration(s) of injection(s) in seconds. Each Contrast Flow Duration value shall correspond to a value of Contrast Flow Rate (0018,1046).

table_lines.name: Contrast/Bolus Ingredient
table_lines.comment: Active ingredient of agent.

table_lines.name: Contrast/Bolus Ingredient Concentration
table_lines.comment: Milligrams of active ingredient per milliliter of (diluted) agent.

table_lines.name: Contrast/Bolus Agent Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies one or more contrast agents administered prior to or during the acquisition.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Contrast/Bolus Agent Number
table_lines.comment: Identifying number, unique within this SOP Instance, of the agent administered. Used to reference this particular agent from the Contrast/Bolus Functional Group Macro. The number shall be 1 for the first Item and increase by 1 for each subsequent Item.

table_lines.name: >Contrast/Bolus Administration Route Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies the route of administration of contrast agent.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Contrast/Bolus Ingredient Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Active ingredient of agent.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Contrast/Bolus Volume
table_lines.comment: Total volume administered in milliliters of diluted contrast agent.

table_lines.name: >Contrast/Bolus Ingredient Concentration
table_lines.comment: Milligrams of active ingredient per milliliter of agent.

table_lines.name: >Contrast/Bolus Ingredient Percent by Volume
table_lines.comment: Percentage by volume of active ingredient in the total volume.

table_lines.name: >Contrast/Bolus Ingredient Opaque
table_lines.comment:
Absorption of the ingredient greater than the absorption of water (tissue).
See

table_lines.name: >Contrast/Bolus T1 Relaxivity
table_lines.comment: T1 Relaxivity of the MR Contrast/Bolus used specified in s

table_lines.name: >Contrast Administration Profile Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that describes one or more phases of contrast administered.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Contrast/Bolus Volume
table_lines.comment: Volume administered during this phase in milliliters of diluted contrast agent.

table_lines.name: >>Contrast/Bolus Start Time
table_lines.comment: Time of start of administration.

table_lines.name: >>Contrast/Bolus Stop Time
table_lines.comment: Time of end of administration.

table_lines.name: >>Contrast Flow Rate
table_lines.comment: Rate of administration in milliliters/sec. Only a single value shall be present.

table_lines.name: >>Contrast Flow Duration
table_lines.comment: Duration of injection in seconds. Only a single value shall be present.

table_lines.name: Preferred Playback Sequencing
table_lines.comment: Describes the preferred playback sequencing for a multi-frame image.

table_lines.name: Start Trim
table_lines.comment: The frame number of the first frame of the Multi-frame image to be displayed.

table_lines.name: Stop Trim
table_lines.comment: The Frame Number of the last frame of a Multi-frame image to be displayed.

table_lines.name: Recommended Display Frame Rate
table_lines.comment: Recommended rate at which the frames of a Multi-frame image should be displayed in frames/second.

table_lines.name: Cine Rate
table_lines.comment: Number of frames per second.

table_lines.name: Frame Delay
table_lines.comment: Time (in msec) from Content Time (0008,0033) to the start of the first frame in a Multi-frame image.

table_lines.name: Image Trigger Delay
table_lines.comment: Delay time in milliseconds from trigger (e.g., X-Ray on pulse) to the first frame of a Multi-frame image.

table_lines.name: Effective Duration
table_lines.comment: Total time in seconds that data was actually taken for the entire Multi-frame image.

table_lines.name: Actual Frame Duration
table_lines.comment: Elapsed time of data acquisition in msec per each frame.

table_lines.name: Multiplexed Audio Channels Description Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Zero or more Items may be included in this Sequence.
Required if the Transfer Syntax used to encode the multi-frame image contains multiplexed (interleaved) audio channels, such as is possible with MPEG2 Systems (see

table_lines.name: >Channel Identification Code
table_lines.comment: A reference to the audio channel as identified within Transfer Syntax encoded bit stream (1 for the main channel, 2 for the second channel and 3 to 9 to the complementary channels).

table_lines.name: >Channel Mode
table_lines.comment: A coded descriptor qualifying the mode of the channel:

table_lines.name: >Channel Source Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A coded descriptor of the audio channel source.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Encapsulated Pixel Data Value Total Length
table_lines.comment: The length of the pixel data bit stream encapsulated in Pixel Data (7FE0,0010), in bytes, when all the fragments have been combined, not including any trailing padding to even length in the last Fragment added for encapsulation.

table_lines.name: Representative Frame Number
table_lines.comment: The frame number selected for use as a pictorial representation (e.g., icon) of the Multi-frame Image.

table_lines.name: Frame Numbers Of Interest (FOI)
table_lines.comment: Frame number(s) selected as frames of interest. A frame number may appear more than once.

table_lines.name: Frame Of Interest Description
table_lines.comment: Description of each one of the Frame(s) of Interest selected in (0028,6020). If multiple Frames of Interest are selected and this Attribute is used, it shall contain the same number of values as are in Frame Numbers of Interest (0028,6020).

table_lines.name: Frame of Interest Type
table_lines.comment: A Defined Term for each one of the Frame(s) of Interest (0028,6020) that identifies the significance of the frame. If multiple Frames of Interest are selected and this Attribute is used, it shall contain the same number of values as are in Frame Numbers of Interest (0028,6020).

table_lines.name: Mask Subtraction Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Defines a Sequence that describes mask subtraction operations for a Multi-frame Image.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Subtraction Item ID
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the Subtraction Item used to associate a certain Mask Sub-Pixel Shift (0028,6114) in the Frame Pixel Shift Functional Group.
See
Required if SOP Class UID (0008,0016) equals "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.12.1.1" or "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.12.2.1". May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Applicable Frame Range
table_lines.comment: Required if Mask Operation (0028,6101) equals REV_TID. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Mask Frame Numbers
table_lines.comment: Specifies the frame numbers of the pixel data used to generate this mask. Frames in a Multi-frame Image are specified by sequentially increasing number values beginning with 1. Required if Mask Operation (0028,6101) is AVG_SUB.

table_lines.name: >Contrast Frame Averaging
table_lines.comment: Specifies the number of contrast frames to average together before performing the mask operation. If the Attribute is missing, no averaging is performed.

table_lines.name: >TID Offset
table_lines.comment:
If Mask Operation is TID, specifies the offset to be subtracted from the current frame number in order to locate the mask frame in TID mode.
If Mask Operation is REV_TID, specifies the initial offset to be subtracted from the first contrast frame number. See
If zero length, TID Offset defaults to 1. Required if Mask Operation (0028,6101) is TID or REV_TID.

table_lines.name: >Mask Operation Explanation
table_lines.comment: Free form explanation of this particular mask operation.

table_lines.name: >Mask Selection Mode
table_lines.comment: Specifies the method of selection of the mask operations of this Item.

table_lines.name: Recommended Viewing Mode
table_lines.comment: Specifies the recommended viewing protocol(s).

table_lines.name: Shutter Shape
table_lines.comment:
Shape(s) of the shutter defined for display.
This multi-valued Attribute shall contain at most one of each Enumerated Value. When multiple values are present, and the shutter is applied to a displayed image, then all of the shapes shall be combined and applied simultaneously, that is, the least amount of image remaining shall be visible (unoccluded). See

table_lines.name: Shutter Left Vertical Edge
table_lines.comment: Required if Shutter Shape (0018,1600) is RECTANGULAR. Location of the left edge of the rectangular shutter with respect to pixels in the image given as column.

table_lines.name: Shutter Right Vertical Edge
table_lines.comment: Required if Shutter Shape (0018,1600) is RECTANGULAR. Location of the right edge of the rectangular shutter with respect to pixels in the image given as column.

table_lines.name: Shutter Upper Horizontal Edge
table_lines.comment: Required if Shutter Shape (0018,1600) is RECTANGULAR. Location of the upper edge of the rectangular shutter with respect to pixels in the image given as row.

table_lines.name: Shutter Lower Horizontal Edge
table_lines.comment: Required if Shutter Shape (0018,1600) is RECTANGULAR. Location of the lower edge of the rectangular shutter with respect to pixels in the image given as row.

table_lines.name: Center of Circular Shutter
table_lines.comment: Required if Shutter Shape (0018,1600) is CIRCULAR. Location of the center of the circular shutter with respect to pixels in the image given as row and column.

table_lines.name: Radius of Circular Shutter
table_lines.comment: Required if Shutter Shape (0018,1600) is CIRCULAR. Radius of the circular shutter with respect to pixels in the image given as a number of pixels along the row direction.

table_lines.name: Vertices of the Polygonal Shutter
table_lines.comment:
Required if Shutter Shape (0018,1600) is POLYGONAL.
Multiple Values where the first set of two values are:
Two or more pairs of values follow and are the row and column coordinates of the other vertices of the polygon shutter. Polygon shutters are implicitly closed from the last vertex to the origin vertex and all edges shall be non-intersecting except at the vertices.

table_lines.name: Shutter Presentation Value
table_lines.comment: A single gray unsigned value used to replace those parts of the image occluded by the shutter, when rendered on a monochrome display. The units are specified in P-Values, from a minimum of 0000H (black) up to a maximum of FFFFH (white).

table_lines.name: Device Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A Sequence of Items describing devices used that may be visible in the image.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Manufacturer
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer of the device.

table_lines.name: >Manufacturer's Model Name
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer's model name of the device.

table_lines.name: >Device Serial Number
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer's serial number of the device.

table_lines.name: >Date of Manufacture
table_lines.comment: The date the device was originally manufactured or re-manufactured (as opposed to refurbished).

table_lines.name: >Device ID
table_lines.comment: User-supplied identifier for the device.

table_lines.name: >Device Diameter Units
table_lines.comment: Required if Device Diameter (0050,0016) is present.

table_lines.name: >Device Description
table_lines.comment: Further description in free form text describing the device.

table_lines.name: Intervention Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence describing interventional therapies or procedures.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Intervention Status
table_lines.comment: Temporal relation of SOP Instance to intervention

table_lines.name: >Intervention Drug Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies the interventional drug.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Intervention Drug Start Time
table_lines.comment: Time of administration of the interventional drug.

table_lines.name: >Intervention Drug Stop Time
table_lines.comment: Time of completion of administration of the intervention drug.

table_lines.name: >Administration Route Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies the Administration Route.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Intervention Description
table_lines.comment: Further description in free form text describing the therapy or other intervention.

table_lines.name: Acquisition Context Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A Sequence of Items that describes the conditions present during the acquisition of the data of the SOP Instance.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Acquisition Context Description
table_lines.comment: Free-text description of the image-acquisition context.

table_lines.name: Shutter Shape
table_lines.comment:
Shape of the shutter defined for display.
This Attribute shall contain one Value.

table_lines.name: Shutter Overlay Group
table_lines.comment: sect_C.9.2sect_C.9.2

table_lines.name: Shutter Presentation Value
table_lines.comment: A single gray unsigned value used to replace those parts of the image occluded by the shutter, when rendered on a monochrome display. The units are specified in P-Values, from a minimum of 0000H (black) up to a maximum of FFFFH (white).

table_lines.name: Shared Functional Groups Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that contains the Functional Group Macros that are shared for all frames in this SOP Instance and Concatenation.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: Per-Frame Functional Groups Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that contains the Functional Group Sequence Attributes corresponding to each frame of the Multi-frame Image. The first Item corresponds with the first frame, and so on.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence. The number of Items shall be the same as the number of frames in the Multi-frame image. See
Required if for any frame, there are Per-Frame Functional Groups that are not empty.

table_lines.name: Instance Number
table_lines.comment: A number that identifies this Instance. The value shall be the same for all SOP Instances of a Concatenation, and different for each separate Concatenation and for each SOP Instance not within a Concatenation in a Series.

table_lines.name: Content Date
table_lines.comment: The date the data creation was started.

table_lines.name: Content Time
table_lines.comment: The time the data creation was started.

table_lines.name: Concatenation Frame Offset Number
table_lines.comment:
Offset of the first frame in a multi-frame image of a concatenation. Logical frame numbers in a concatenation can be used across all its SOP Instances. This offset can be applied to the implicit frame number to find the logical frame number in a concatenation. The offset is numbered from zero; i.e., the instance of a concatenation that begins with the first frame of the concatenation has a Concatenation Frame Offset Number (0020,9228) of zero.
Required if Concatenation UID (0020,9161) is present.

table_lines.name: Representative Frame Number
table_lines.comment: The frame number selected for use as a pictorial representation (e.g., icon) of the multi-frame Image.

table_lines.name: Concatenation UID
table_lines.comment:
Identifier of all SOP Instances that belong to the same concatenation.
Required if a group of multi-frame image SOP Instances within a Series are part of a Concatenation.

table_lines.name: SOP Instance UID of Concatenation Source
table_lines.comment: Required if Concatenation UID (0020,9161) is present.

table_lines.name: In-concatenation Number
table_lines.comment: Required if Concatenation UID (0020,9161) is present.

table_lines.name: In-concatenation Total Number
table_lines.comment:
The number of SOP Instances sharing the same Concatenation UID.
If present, shall have a value greater than one, unless an IOD overrides this constraint to enumerate a value of 1 to prevent the use of Concatenations (e.g., see

table_lines.name: Encapsulated Pixel Data Value Total Length
table_lines.comment: The length of the pixel data bit stream encapsulated in Pixel Data (7FE0,0010), in bytes, when all the fragments have been combined, not including any trailing padding to even length in the last Fragment added for encapsulation.

table_lines.name: Pixel Measures Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the physical characteristics of the pixels of this frame.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Pixel Spacing
table_lines.comment:
Required if:
May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Slice Thickness
table_lines.comment:
Nominal reconstructed slice thickness (for tomographic imaging) or depth of field (for optical non-tomographic imaging), in mm.
See
Required if:
May be present otherwise, if

table_lines.name: >Spacing Between Slices
table_lines.comment:
Spacing between adjacent slices, in mm. The spacing is measured from the center-to-center of each slice, and if present shall not be negative.
Required if Dimension Organization Type (0020,9311) is TILED_FULL and Total Pixel Matrix Focal Planes (0048,0303) is greater than 1. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Frame Content Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifies general characteristics of this frame.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Frame Acquisition Number
table_lines.comment: A number identifying the single continuous gathering of data over a period of time that resulted in this frame.

table_lines.name: >Frame Reference DateTime
table_lines.comment:
Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL, and the SOP Class UID is not:
May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Frame Acquisition DateTime
table_lines.comment:
Required if
May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Frame Acquisition Duration
table_lines.comment:
Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL, and the SOP Class UID is not:
May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Cardiac Cycle Position
table_lines.comment: Description of the position in the cardiac cycle that is most representative of this frame.

table_lines.name: >Respiratory Cycle Position
table_lines.comment: Description of the position in the respiratory cycle that is most representative of this frame.

table_lines.name: >Dimension Index Values
table_lines.comment:
Contains the values of the indices defined in the Dimension Index Sequence (0020,9222) for this multi-frame header frame. The number of values is equal to the number of Items of the Dimension Index Sequence and shall be applied in the same order.
See
Required if the value of Dimension Index Sequence (0020,9222) exists.

table_lines.name: >Temporal Position Index
table_lines.comment:
Ordinal number (starting from 1) of the frame in the set of frames with different temporal positions.
Required if the value of SOP Class UID (0008,0016) equals "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.130" or Functional MR Sequence (0018,9621) is present. May be present otherwise. See

table_lines.name: >Stack ID
table_lines.comment:
Identification of a group of frames, with different positions and/or orientations that belong together, within a dimension organization.
See
Required if the value of SOP Class UID (0008,0016) equals "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.130" or Functional MR Sequence (0018,9621) is present. May be present otherwise. See

table_lines.name: >In-Stack Position Number
table_lines.comment:
The ordinal number of a frame in a group of frames, with the same Stack ID (0020,9056).
Required if Stack ID (0020,9056) or Functional MR Sequence (0018,9621) is present.
See

table_lines.name: >Frame Comments
table_lines.comment: User-defined comments about the frame.

table_lines.name: >Frame Label
table_lines.comment:
Label corresponding to a specific dimension index value. Selected from a set of dimension values defined by the application.
This Attribute may be referenced by the Dimension Index Pointer (0020,9165) Attribute in the
See

table_lines.name: Plane Position Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the position of the plane of this frame.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Image Position (Patient)
table_lines.comment:
Required if:
May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Plane Orientation Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifies orientation of the plane of this frame.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Image Orientation (Patient)
table_lines.comment:
Required if:
May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Describes the purpose for which the reference is made.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if SOP Class UID is not "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.2.2" (Legacy Converted Enhanced CT Image Storage) and not "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.4.4" (Legacy Converted Enhanced MR Image Storage) and not "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.128.1" (Legacy Converted Enhanced PET Image Storage), may be present otherwise.
See

table_lines.name: Derivation Image Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The set of Images or other composite SOP Instances that were used to derive this frame.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Derivation Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence. More than one Item indicates that successive derivation steps have been applied.
Required if SOP Class UID is not "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.2.2" (Legacy Converted Enhanced CT Image Storage) and not "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.4.4" (Legacy Converted Enhanced MR Image Storage) and not "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.128.1" (Legacy Converted Enhanced PET Image Storage), may be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Source Image Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The set of Images or other Composite SOP Instances that were used to derive this frame.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence. See

table_lines.name: >>Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Describes the purpose for which the reference is made, that is what role the source image or frame played in the derivation of this image or frame.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if SOP Class UID is not "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.2.2" (Legacy Converted Enhanced CT Image Storage) and not "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.4.4" (Legacy Converted Enhanced MR Image Storage) and not "1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.128.1" (Legacy Converted Enhanced PET Image Storage), may be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >>Spatial Locations Preserved
table_lines.comment: The extent to which the spatial locations of all pixels are preserved during the processing of the source image that resulted in the current image or frame.

table_lines.name: >>Patient Orientation
table_lines.comment:
The Patient Orientation values of the source image.
Required if the value of Spatial Locations Preserved (0028,135A) is REORIENTED_ONLY.

table_lines.name: Cardiac Synchronization Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that describes the frame specific cardiac synchronization parameters.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Nominal Percentage of Cardiac Phase
table_lines.comment:
The nominal time relative to the preceding R peak divided by the nominal R-R interval multiplied by 100.
Required if used as a dimension index, may be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Actual Cardiac Trigger Delay Time
table_lines.comment: Required if Intervals Acquired (0018,1083) is present and has a value of 1. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Nominal Cardiac Trigger Time Prior to R-peak
>Actual Cardiac Trigger Time Prior to R-peak
>Intervals Acquired
table_lines.comment: Number of R-R intervals acquired.

table_lines.name: >Intervals Rejected
table_lines.comment: Number of R-R intervals rejected.

table_lines.name: >Heart Rate
table_lines.comment: Average number of heart beats per minute for the collection period for this frame. This shall include all accepted beats as well as rejected beats.

table_lines.name: >R-R Interval Time Nominal
table_lines.comment: Required if Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE or REALTIME. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Low R-R Value
table_lines.comment: R-R interval low limit for beat rejection, in ms.

table_lines.name: >High R-R Value
table_lines.comment: R-R interval high limit for beat rejection, in ms.

table_lines.name: Frame Anatomy Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifies anatomic characteristics of this frame.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Frame Laterality
table_lines.comment:
Laterality of (possibly paired) body parts (as described in Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218)) examined.
Shall be consistent with any laterality information contained in Primary Anatomic Structure Modifier Sequence (0008,2230), if present.

table_lines.usage:
Anatomic Region Sequence D

Anatomic Region Modifier Sequence (0008,2220) D

Primary Anatomic Structure Modifier Sequence (0008,2230) D

table_lines.name: Pixel Value Transformation Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Contains the Attributes involved in the transformation of stored pixel values.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Rescale Intercept
table_lines.comment:
The value b in relationship between stored values (SV) and the output units.
Output units = m*SV + b.

table_lines.name: >Rescale Slope
table_lines.comment: m in the equation specified by Rescale Intercept (0028,1052).

table_lines.name: >Rescale Type
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the output units of Rescale Slope (0028,1053) and Rescale Intercept (0028,1052).
See

C.7.6.16-10b.table_caption: Identity Pixel Value Transformation Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Pixel Value Transformation Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Contains the Attributes involved in the transformation of stored pixel values.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Rescale Intercept
table_lines.comment:
The value b in relationship between stored values (SV) and the output units.
Output units = m*SV + b.

table_lines.name: >Rescale Slope
table_lines.comment: m in the equation specified by Rescale Intercept (0028,1052).

table_lines.name: >Rescale Type
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the output units of Rescale Slope (0028,1053) and Rescale Intercept (0028,1052).
See

table_lines.name: Frame VOI LUT Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Window Center and Width values applied to the frame.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Window Center & Width Explanation
table_lines.comment: Explanation of the Window Center and Width.

table_lines.name: >VOI LUT Function
table_lines.comment:
Describes a VOI LUT function to apply to the values of Window Center (0028,1050) and Window Width (0028,1051).
See
When this Attribute is not present, the interpretation of the values of Window Center (0028,1050) and Window Width (0028,1051) is linear as in

C.7.6.16-11b.table_caption: Frame VOI LUT with LUT Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Frame VOI LUT Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The VOI LUT transformations applied to this frame.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

C.7.6.16-12.table_caption: Real World Value Mapping Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Real World Value Mapping Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The mapping of stored values to associated Real World values.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

C.7.6.16-12b.table_caption: Real World Value Mapping Item Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Real World Value First Value Mapped
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the first stored value mapped for the Real Word Value Intercept (0040,9224) and Real World Value Slope (0040,9225) or Real World Value LUT Data (0040,9212) of this Item.
Required if Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) or Real World Value LUT Data (0040,9212) is present or Double Float Real World Value First Value Mapped (0040,9214) is absent.
See

table_lines.name: Real World Value Last Value Mapped
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the last stored value mapped for the Real Word Value Intercept (0040,9224) and Real World Value Slope (0040,9225) or Real World Value LUT Data (0040,9212) of this Item.
Required if Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) or Real World Value LUT Data (0040,9212) is present or Double Float Real World Value Last Value Mapped (0040,9213) is absent.
See

table_lines.name: Double Float Real World Value First Value Mapped
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the first stored value mapped for the Real Word Value Intercept (0040,9224) and Real World Value Slope (0040,9225) of this Item.
Required if Real World Value First Value Mapped (0040,9216) is absent.

table_lines.name: Double Float Real World Value Last Value Mapped
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the last stored value mapped for the Real Word Value Intercept (0040,9224) and Real World Value Slope (0040,9225) of this Item.
Required if Real World Value Last Value Mapped (0040,9211) is absent.

table_lines.name: Real World Value Intercept
table_lines.comment:
The Intercept value in relationship between stored values (SV) and the Real World values.
See
Required if Float Pixel Data (7FE0,0008) or Double Float Pixel Data (7FE0,0009) are present or Real World Value LUT Data (0040,9212) is not present.

table_lines.name: Real World Value Slope
table_lines.comment:
The Slope value in relationship between stored values (SV) and the Real World Values.
See
Required if Float Pixel Data (7FE0,0008) or Double Float Pixel Data (7FE0,0009) are present or Real World Value LUT Data (0040,9212) is not present.

table_lines.name: Real World Value LUT Data
table_lines.comment:
LUT Data in this Sequence.
Required if Real World Value Intercept (0040,9224) is not present.

table_lines.name: LUT Explanation
table_lines.comment: Free form text explanation of the meaning of the transformation in this Item.

table_lines.name: LUT Label
table_lines.comment: Label that is used to identify the transformation of this Item.

table_lines.name: Measurement Units Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Units of measurement.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: Quantity Definition Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A list of name-value pairs that describe the characteristics of the quantity represented by the Real World Value.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage:
B

Other TIDs may be defined by the IOD or application that uses this Macro.

table_lines.name: Contrast/Bolus Usage Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Contains the Attributes describing the use of contrast for this frame.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Contrast/Bolus Agent Number
table_lines.comment: sect_C.7.6.4b

table_lines.name: >Contrast/Bolus Agent Administered
table_lines.comment: The administration of the selected agent had begun by the time this frame was acquired.

table_lines.name: >Contrast/Bolus Agent Detected
table_lines.comment:
The selected agent was detected in the frame.
May only be zero length if the acquisition device is not capable of detecting the presence of this contrast agent in the frame.

table_lines.name: >Contrast/Bolus Agent Phase
table_lines.comment:
Nominal phase of intravenous contrast administration.
Required if Contrast/Bolus Administration Route Sequence (0018,0014) for the Contrast/Bolus Agent Number (0018,9337) defined in the Contrast/Bolus Agent Sequence (0018,0012) is

C.7.6.16-14.table_caption: Pixel Intensity Relationship LUT Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Pixel Intensity Relationship LUT Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Defines a Sequence of Pixel Intensity Relationship LUTs.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
If Pixel Intensity Relationship (0028,1040) value equals LOG, exactly one Item with LUT Function (0028,9474) value TO_LINEAR LUT shall be present; other Items with other values of LUT Function (0028,9474) may be present.

table_lines.name: >LUT Descriptor
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the format of the LUT Data in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >LUT Data
table_lines.comment: LUT Data in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >LUT Function
table_lines.comment: The transformation function this LUT applies to the stored pixel values.

table_lines.name: Frame Pixel Shift Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence containing the pixel shift for a number of masks for this frame.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Subtraction Item ID
table_lines.comment:
Identifier of the Subtraction Item in the Mask Subtraction Sequence (0028,6100) to which this pixel shift is associated.
See

table_lines.name: >Mask Sub-pixel Shift
table_lines.comment:
A pair of floating point numbers specifying the fractional vertical [adjacent row spacing] and horizontal [adjacent column spacing] pixel shift applied to the mask before subtracting it from this contrast frame.
See

C.7.6.16-16.table_caption: Patient Orientation in Frame Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Patient Orientation in Frame Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence containing the row and column directions for this frame in the patient.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Patient Orientation
table_lines.comment:
Patient direction of the rows and columns of this frame.
See

table_lines.name: Frame Display Shutter Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence containing the display shutter parameters for this frame.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Respiratory Synchronization Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that describes the frame specific respiratory synchronization parameters.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Respiratory Interval Time
table_lines.comment: Required if Respiratory Motion Compensation Technique (0018,9170) equals other than NONE or REALTIME and Respiratory Trigger Type (0020,9250) is absent or has a value of TIME or BOTH.

table_lines.name: >Nominal Percentage of Respiratory Phase
table_lines.comment:
The nominal time relative to the preceding respiratory inspiration maximum divided by the nominal respiratory interval multiplied by 100.
Required if used as a dimension index, may be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Actual Respiratory Trigger Delay Time
table_lines.comment: Required if Respiratory Trigger Type (0020,9250) is TIME or BOTH.

table_lines.name: >Starting Respiratory Amplitude
table_lines.comment:
Nominal amplitude of the respiratory signal at which the acquisition of data for this frame begins, in percent of the nominal maximum value (which represents maximum inspiration).
Required if Respiratory Trigger Type (0020,9250) is AMPLITUDE or BOTH.

table_lines.name: >Starting Respiratory Phase
table_lines.comment:
The phase of respiration at which the Starting Respiratory Amplitude (0020,9246) was measured.
Required if Starting Respiratory Amplitude (0020,9246) is present.

table_lines.name: >Ending Respiratory Amplitude
table_lines.comment:
Nominal amplitude of the respiratory signal at which the acquisition of data for this frame ends, in percent of the nominal maximum value (which represents maximum inspiration).
Required if Respiratory Trigger Type (0020,9250) is AMPLITUDE or BOTH.

table_lines.name: >Ending Respiratory Phase
table_lines.comment:
The phase of respiration at which the Ending Respiratory Amplitude (0020,9248) was measured.
Required if Ending Respiratory Amplitude (0020,9248) is present.

table_lines.name: Irradiation Event Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence containing the Irradiation Event Identification for this frame.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Irradiation Event UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identification of the irradiation event(s) associated with the acquisition of this image.

table_lines.name: Radiopharmaceutical Usage Sequence
table_lines.comment: One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Patient Physiological State Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Contains the Attributes describing the physiological state of the patient for this frame.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Patient Physiological State Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The physiological state of the patient.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Plane Position (Volume) Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the position of the plane of this frame.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Image Position (Volume)
table_lines.comment: The x, y, and z coordinates, in mm, of the upper left hand corner (center of the first voxel transmitted) of the plane in the Volume Frame of Reference.

table_lines.name: Plane Orientation (Volume) Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifies orientation of the plane of this frame.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Image Orientation (Volume)
table_lines.comment: The direction cosines of the first row and the first column of the frame with respect to the Volume Frame of Reference.

table_lines.name: Temporal Position Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the temporal position of the plane of this frame.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Temporal Position Time Offset
table_lines.comment: Time offset of the frame in the set of frames with different temporal positions, in seconds.

table_lines.name: Image Data Type Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the data type characteristics of this frame.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Data Type
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the data type of a frame.
See

table_lines.name: >Aliased Data Type
table_lines.comment:
Indicates whether this data type is "aliased".
See

table_lines.name: >Zero Velocity Pixel Value
table_lines.comment:
Data value at which velocity is zero.
See
Required if Data Type (0018,9808) is TISSUE_VELOCITY, FLOW_VELOCITY or DIRECTION_POWER. May be present otherwise.

C.7.6.16.2.25.1-1.table_caption: Unassigned Shared Converted Attributes Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Unassigned Shared Converted Attributes Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Contains all of the Standard and Private Attributes that are present in all of the converted Classic images, that have the same number of values, that have the same values, and that are not in the top-level Data Set.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if any unassigned shared Attributes are present.

C.7.6.16.2.25.2-1.table_caption: Unassigned Per-Frame Converted Attributes Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Unassigned Per-Frame Converted Attributes Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Contains all of the Standard and Private Attributes that are present in only some of the converted Classic images, or that have a different number of values, or that have different values.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if any unassigned per-frame Attributes are present for this frame.

C.7.6.16.2.25.3-1.table_caption: Image Frame Conversion Source Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Conversion Source Attributes Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The image or other composite SOP Instance that was converted to this frame.
