Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

C.7.6.16.2.26-1.table_caption: Stored Value Color Range Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Stored Value Color Range Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the range of stored pixel values of this frame mapped using the Palette Color LUT.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

C.7.6.16.2.27-1.table_caption: Frame Usefulness Functional Group Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Frame Usefulness Group Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that contains the Functional Groups Sequence Attributes corresponding to the current frame or audio sample.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Includes Information
table_lines.comment: Whether or not the current frame includes useful information, i.e. not noise nor void

table_lines.name: >Includes Imaging Subject
table_lines.comment: Whether or not the current frame includes the imaging subject.

C.7.6.16.2.28-1.table_caption: Camera Position Functional Group Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Camera Position Group Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that contains the Functional Groups Sequence Attributes corresponding to the current frame or audio sample.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Render Projection
table_lines.comment: Projection style.

table_lines.name: >Viewpoint Position
table_lines.comment:
Position of the viewpoint in volume space.
A point (x,y,z) in the Frame Reference Coordinate System referenced in the

table_lines.name: >Viewpoint LookAt Point
table_lines.comment:
Point the viewpoint is looking at.
A point (x,y,z) in the Frame Reference Coordinate System referenced in the

table_lines.name: >Viewpoint Up Direction
table_lines.comment:
Vertical orientation of the view.
A vector (x,y,z) in the Frame Reference Coordinate System referenced in the

table_lines.name: >Render Field of View
table_lines.comment:
The field of view specified as a 6-tuple of values (X
See

C.7.6.16.2.29-1.table_caption: Time of Frame Functional Group Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Time of Frame Group Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Time characteristics of the current frame or audio sample.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Frame Origin Timestamp
table_lines.comment: This timestamp contains the capture time of the payload content for this frame or audio sample. It is in TAI, not UTC.

table_lines.name: Dimension Organization Sequence
table_lines.comment: One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Dimension Organization Type
table_lines.comment: Dimension organization of the Instance.

table_lines.name: Dimension Index Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the Sequence containing the indices used to specify the dimension of the multi-frame object.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if Dimension Organization Type (0020,9311) is absent or not TILED_FULL. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Dimension Index Private Creator
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the creator of a group of Private Data Elements.
Required if the Dimension Index Pointer (0020,9165) value is the Data Element Tag of a Private Attribute.

table_lines.name: >Functional Group Pointer
table_lines.comment:
Contains the Data Element Tag of the Functional Group Sequence that contains the Attribute that is referenced by the Dimension Index Pointer (0020,9165).
See
Required if the value of Dimension Index Pointer (0020,9165) is the Data Element Tag of an Attribute that is contained within a Functional Group Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Functional Group Private Creator
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the creator of a group of Private Data Elements.
Required if the Functional Group Pointer (0020,9167) value is the Data Element Tag of a Private Attribute.

table_lines.name: >Dimension Description Label
table_lines.comment: Free text description that explains the meaning of the dimension.

table_lines.name: Cardiac Synchronization Technique
table_lines.comment:
Defines if a cardiac synchronization technique was applied during or after the acquisition.
Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Cardiac Signal Source
table_lines.comment:
Cardiac Signal Source.
Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE.
Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE.

table_lines.name: Cardiac RR Interval Specified
table_lines.comment:
R-R interval in ms measured prior to or during the scan.
Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE.
Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE.

table_lines.name: Cardiac Beat Rejection Technique
table_lines.comment:
Cardiac arrhythmia rejection technique.
Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals PROSPECTIVE or RETROSPECTIVE.
Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals PROSPECTIVE or RETROSPECTIVE.

table_lines.name: Low R-R Value
table_lines.comment:
R-R interval low limit for beat rejection, in ms.
Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals PROSPECTIVE or RETROSPECTIVE.
Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals PROSPECTIVE or RETROSPECTIVE.

table_lines.name: High R-R Value
table_lines.comment:
R-R interval high limit for beat rejection, in ms.
Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals PROSPECTIVE or RETROSPECTIVE.
Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals PROSPECTIVE or RETROSPECTIVE.

table_lines.name: Intervals Acquired
table_lines.comment:
Number of R-R intervals acquired and used to create the image (not including the intervals rejected).
Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE.
Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE.

table_lines.name: Intervals Rejected
table_lines.comment:
Number of R-R intervals rejected.
Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE.
Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Cardiac Synchronization Technique (0018,9037) equals other than NONE.

table_lines.name: Skip Beats
table_lines.comment: Number of beats prescribed to be skipped after each detected arrhythmia.

table_lines.name: Cardiac Framing Type
table_lines.comment: Required if type of framing is not time forward from trigger, may be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Respiratory Motion Compensation Technique
table_lines.comment:
Applied technique to reduce respiratory motion artifacts.
Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Respiratory Signal Source
table_lines.comment:
Signal source from which respiratory motion is derived.
Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Respiratory Motion Compensation Technique (0018,9170) equals other than NONE.
Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Respiratory Motion Compensation Technique (0018,9170) equals other than NONE.

table_lines.name: Respiratory Trigger Delay Threshold
table_lines.comment: Required if Respiratory Motion Compensation Technique (0018,9170) equals other than NONE, REALTIME or BREATH_HOLD and if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Respiratory Trigger Type
table_lines.comment:
Characteristic of the respiratory signal used to the define the respiratory triggering.
Required if the value is not TIME, may be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Bulk Motion Compensation Technique
table_lines.comment:
Applied technique to reduce bulk or other physiology motion artifacts.
Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Bulk Motion Signal Source
table_lines.comment:
Signal source to measure motion.
Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL or MIXED and Bulk Motion Compensation Technique (0018,9172) equals other than NONE.
Otherwise may be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is DERIVED and Bulk Motion Compensation Technique (0018,9172) equals other than NONE.

C.7.6.19-1.table_caption: Supplemental Palette Color Lookup Table Module Attributes

table_lines.name: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
Green Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data
Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data
Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data

C.7.6.21-1.table_caption: Image - Equipment Coordinate Relationship Module Attributes

table_lines.name: Issuer of the Container Identifier Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Organization that assigned the Container Identifier.
Zero or one Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Alternate Container Identifier Sequence
table_lines.comment: Sequence of alternate identifiers for the container that contains the specimen(s) being imaged. These may have been assigned, e.g., by the manufacturer, or by another institution that collected the specimen. One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Container Identifier
table_lines.comment: The identifier for the container that contains the specimen(s) being imaged.

table_lines.name: >Issuer of the Container Identifier Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Organization that assigned the Container Identifier.
Zero or one Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Container Type Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Type of container that contains the specimen(s) being imaged.
Zero or one Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Container Description
table_lines.comment: Description of the container.

table_lines.name: Container Component Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Description of one or more components of the container (e.g., description of the slide and of the coverslip).
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Container Component Type Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Type of container component.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Manufacturer
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer of the container component.

table_lines.name: >Manufacturer's Model Name
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer's model name of the container component.

table_lines.name: >Container Component ID
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer's identifier of the container component, e.g., Lot Number and/or Version.

table_lines.name: >Container Component Length
table_lines.comment: Length in mm of container component.

table_lines.name: >Container Component Width
table_lines.comment: Width in mm of container component.

table_lines.name: >Container Component Diameter
table_lines.comment: Diameter in mm of container component for cylindrical or circular components.

table_lines.name: >Container Component Thickness
table_lines.comment: Thickness in mm of container component.

table_lines.name: >Container Component Material
table_lines.comment: Material of container component.

table_lines.name: >Container Component Description
table_lines.comment: Container component text description.

table_lines.name: Specimen Description Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of identifiers and detailed description of the specimen(s) being imaged.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
Each specimen imaged in the Pixel Data shall be identified by an Item in this Sequence. Other specimens in/on the container, but not imaged in the Pixel Data, may also be identified by Items in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Specimen Identifier
table_lines.comment: If a single specimen is present in a container, the value of the Specimen Identifier and the value of the Container Identifier are typically the same.

table_lines.name: >Issuer of the Specimen Identifier Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The name or code for the institution that has assigned the Specimen Identifier.
Zero or one Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Specimen Type Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Specimen Type.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Specimen Short Description
table_lines.comment: Short textual specimen description (may include ancestor specimen descriptions).

table_lines.name: >Specimen Detailed Description
table_lines.comment: Detailed textual specimen description (may include ancestor specimen descriptions).

table_lines.name: >Specimen Preparation Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items identifying the process steps used to prepare the specimen for image acquisition. This includes description of all processing necessary to interpret the image.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
This Sequence includes description of the specimen sampling step from an ancestor specimen, potentially back to the original part collection.
See

table_lines.name: >>Specimen Preparation Step Content Item Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Content Items identifying the processes used in one preparation step to prepare the specimen for image acquisition.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage:
Original anatomic location in patient of specimen. This location may be identical to that of the parent specimen, may be further refined by modifiers depending on the sampling procedure for this specimen, or may be a distinct concept.

B

table_lines.name: >Specimen Localization Content Item Sequence
table_lines.comment:
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if multiple specimens present in the image. May be present otherwise.

C.7.6.23-1.table_caption: Enhanced Palette Color Lookup Table Module Attributes

table_lines.name: Data Frame Assignment Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items each assigning frames of one particular value of Data Type (0018,9808) to a data path in the Enhanced Blending and Display Pipeline.
One, two, or three Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Data Type
table_lines.comment: Identification of the data type of frames using this data path assignment.

table_lines.name: >Data Path Assignment
table_lines.comment:
The data path to use for this data type in the Enhanced Blending and Display Pipeline.
See

table_lines.name: >Bits Mapped to Color Lookup Table
table_lines.comment:
The number of most significant bits of each value of Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) from this frame contributing to the Palette Color Lookup Table input.
If absent, Bits Stored (0028,0101) bits of each value of Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) from this frame contributes to the Palette Color Lookup Table input.
See

table_lines.name: Blending LUT 1 Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Specification of the weight of the primary path input to the Blending Operation, i.e., the value that is referred to as "Weight 1" in the Enhanced Blending and Display Pipeline.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if there are one or more Items of the Data Path Assignment Sequence (0028,1402) other than PRIMARY_PVALUES.

table_lines.name: >Blending LUT 1 Transfer Function
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the algorithm used to determine the output value of Blending LUT 1.
See

table_lines.name: >Blending Weight Constant
table_lines.comment:
Constant value of the Weight input to blending operation. Shall be from 0.0 to 1.0, inclusive.
Required if Blending LUT 1 Transfer Function (0028,1405) is CONSTANT.

table_lines.name: >Blending Lookup Table Descriptor
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the format of Blending Lookup Table Data (0028,1408) in this Sequence Item.
The second value (first stored pixel value mapped) shall be zero.
See
Required if Blending LUT 1 Transfer Function (0028,1405) is TABLE.

table_lines.name: >Blending Lookup Table Data
table_lines.comment:
Contains the Blending Lookup Table values for this Weight input to the Blending Operation.
Required if Blending LUT 1 Transfer Function (0028,1405) is TABLE.

table_lines.name: Blending LUT 2 Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Specification of the weight of the secondary path input to the Blending Operation, i.e., the value that is referred to as "Weight 2" in the Enhanced Blending and Display Pipeline.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if there are one or more Items of the Data Path Assignment Sequence (0028,1402) other than PRIMARY_PVALUES.

table_lines.name: >Blending LUT 2 Transfer Function
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the algorithm used to determine the output value of Blending LUT 2.
See

table_lines.name: >Blending Weight Constant
table_lines.comment:
Constant value of the Weight input to blending operation. Shall be from 0.0 to 1.0, inclusive.
Required if Blending LUT 2 Transfer Function (0028,140D) is CONSTANT.

table_lines.name: >Blending Lookup Table Descriptor
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the format of Blending Lookup Table Data (0028,1408) in this Sequence Item.
The second value (first stored pixel value mapped) shall be zero.
See
Required if Blending LUT 2 Transfer Function (0028,140D) is TABLE.

table_lines.name: >Blending Lookup Table Data
table_lines.comment:
Contains the Blending Lookup Table values for this Weight input to the Blending operation.
Required if Blending LUT 2 Transfer Function (0028,140D) is TABLE.

table_lines.name: Enhanced Palette Color Lookup Table Sequence
table_lines.comment:
This Sequence contains the Palette Color Lookup Table.
One or two Items shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if Data Path Assignment (0028,1402) is present with a value other than PRIMARY_PVALUES.

table_lines.name: >Data Path ID
table_lines.comment:
Identifier of the data path in which this Palette Color Lookup Table is used.
Each Item shall have a distinct value of Data Path ID.

table_lines.name: >RGB LUT Transfer Function
table_lines.comment: Specifies the mapping that takes place between the input value and RGB input to the Blending Operation.

table_lines.name: >Alpha LUT Transfer Function
table_lines.comment: Specifies the transformation that is used to create the Alpha input to the Blending LUTs.

table_lines.name: >Red Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the format of the Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data (0028,1201).
The second value (first stored pixel value mapped) shall be zero.
Required if RGB LUT Transfer Function (0028,140F) is TABLE.

table_lines.name: >Green Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the format of the Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data (0028,1202).
The second value (first stored pixel value mapped) shall be zero.
Required if RGB LUT Transfer Function (0028,140F) is TABLE.

table_lines.name: >Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the format of the Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data (0028,1203).
The second value (first stored pixel value mapped) shall be zero.
Required if RGB LUT Transfer Function (0028,140F) is TABLE.

table_lines.name: >Alpha Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the format of the Alpha Palette Color Lookup Table Data.
The second value (first stored pixel value mapped) shall be zero.
Required if Alpha LUT Transfer Function (0028,1410) is TABLE.

table_lines.name: >Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data
table_lines.comment:
Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data.
Required if RGB LUT Transfer Function (0028,140F) is TABLE.

table_lines.name: >Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data
table_lines.comment:
Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data.
Required if RGB LUT Transfer Function (0028,140F) is TABLE.

table_lines.name: >Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data
table_lines.comment:
Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data.
Required if RGB LUT Transfer Function (0028,140F) is TABLE.

table_lines.name: >Alpha Palette Color Lookup Table Data
table_lines.comment:
Alpha LUT contains the blending values for the data frames.
Required if Alpha LUT Transfer Function (0028,1410) is TABLE.

table_lines.name: ICC Profile
table_lines.comment:
An ICC Profile encoding the transformation of device-dependent color stored pixel values into PCS-Values.
See
When present, defines the color space of the output of the Enhanced Blending and Display Pipeline.
Required if Data Path Assignment (0028,1402) is present and there exists any value other than PRIMARY_PVALUES.

table_lines.name: Color Space
table_lines.comment:
A label that identifies the well-known color space of the image. Shall be consistent with any ICC Profile (0028,2000) that is also present.
See

C.7.6.24-1.table_caption: Floating Point Image Pixel Module Attributes

table_lines.name: Photometric Interpretation
table_lines.comment: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data.

table_lines.name: Rows
table_lines.comment: Number of rows in the image.

table_lines.name: Columns
table_lines.comment: Number of columns in the image.

table_lines.name: Bits Allocated
table_lines.comment: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. See PS3.5 for further explanation.

table_lines.name: Float Pixel Data
table_lines.comment: A data stream of the pixel samples that comprise the Image. The order of pixels encoded for each image plane is left to right, top to bottom, i.e., the upper left pixel (labeled 1,1) is encoded first followed by the remainder of row 1, followed by the first pixel of row 2 (labeled 2,1) then the remainder of row 2 and so on.

table_lines.name: Float Pixel Padding Value
table_lines.comment: One limit (inclusive) of a range of pixel values used in an image to pad to rectangular format or to signal background that may be suppressed.

table_lines.name: Float Pixel Padding Range Limit
table_lines.comment:
Pixel value that represents one limit (inclusive) of a range of padding values used together with Float Pixel Padding Value (0028,0122).
Required if Float Pixel Padding Value (0028,0122) is present.

C.7.6.25-1.table_caption: Double Floating Point Image Pixel Module Attributes

table_lines.name: Photometric Interpretation
table_lines.comment: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data.

table_lines.name: Rows
table_lines.comment: Number of rows in the image.

table_lines.name: Columns
table_lines.comment: Number of columns in the image.

table_lines.name: Bits Allocated
table_lines.comment: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated. See PS3.5 for further explanation.

table_lines.name: Double Float Pixel Data
table_lines.comment: A data stream of the pixel samples that comprise the Image. The order of pixels encoded for each image plane is left to right, top to bottom, i.e., the upper left pixel (labeled 1,1) is encoded first followed by the remainder of row 1, followed by the first pixel of row 2 (labeled 2,1) then the remainder of row 2 and so on.

table_lines.name: Double Float Pixel Padding Value
table_lines.comment: One limit (inclusive) of a range of pixel values used in an image to pad to rectangular format or to signal background that may be suppressed.

table_lines.name: Double Float Pixel Padding Range Limit
table_lines.comment:
Pixel value that represents one limit (inclusive) of a range of padding values used together with Double Float Pixel Padding Value (0028,0123).
Required if Double Float Pixel Padding Value (0028,0123) is present.

C.7.6.26-1.table_caption: Real-Time Bulk Data Flow Module Attributes

table_lines.name: Real-Time Bulk Data Flow Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the Source and Flows of a SMPTE ST 2110 communication providing Bulk Data.
At least one item shall be included in this sequence.

table_lines.name: >Source Identifier
table_lines.comment:
UUID of the Source of the Flow(s).
See

table_lines.name: >Flow Identifier Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the Flow(s) provided by the Source.
One or more items shall be included in this sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Flow Identifier
table_lines.comment:
UUID of the Flow.
See

table_lines.name: >>Flow Transfer Syntax UID
table_lines.comment:
UID of the encoding method of the referenced Flow
See

table_lines.name: >>Flow RTP Sampling Rate
table_lines.comment:
Sampling rate in Hertz used by RTP for generating timestamp
See

C.7.6.27-1.table_caption: Current Frame Functional Groups Module Attributes

table_lines.name: Current Frame Functional Groups Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that contains the Functional Groups Sequence Attributes corresponding to the current frame or audio sample.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Shared Functional Groups Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that contains the Functional Group Macros that are shared for all frames.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

C.7.6.29-1.table_caption: Sparse Multi-frame Functional Groups Module Attributes

table_lines.name: Shared Functional Groups Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that contains the Functional Group Macros that are shared for all frames in this SOP Instance and Concatenation.
Note
The contents of this Sequence are the same in all SOP Instances that comprise a Concatenation.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: Selected Frame Functional Groups Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that contains the Functional Group Sequence Attributes corresponding to selected frames of the Multi-frame Image.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence. The number of Items shall be greater than zero and the less as the number of frames in the Multi-frame image. See

table_lines.name: >Selected Frame Number
table_lines.comment: Identifies the corresponding frame in the SOP Instance.

table_lines.name: Instance Number
table_lines.comment: A number that identifies this Instance. The value shall be the same for all SOP Instances of a Concatenation, and different for each separate Concatenation and for each SOP Instance not within a Concatenation in a Series.

table_lines.name: Content Date
table_lines.comment:
The date the data creation was started.
Note
For Instance, this is the date the pixel data is created, not the date the data is acquired.

table_lines.name: Content Time
table_lines.comment:
The time the data creation was started.
Note
For Instance, this is the time the pixel data is created, not the time the data is acquired.

table_lines.name: Concatenation Frame Offset Number
table_lines.comment:
Offset of the first frame in a multi-frame image of a concatenation. Logical frame numbers in a concatenation can be used across all its SOP Instances. This offset can be applied to the implicit frame number to find the logical frame number in a concatenation. The offset is numbered from zero; i.e., the instance of a concatenation that begins with the first frame of the concatenation has a Concatenation Frame Offset Number (0020,9228) of zero.
Required if Concatenation UID (0020,9161) is present.

table_lines.name: Representative Frame Number
table_lines.comment: The frame number selected for use as a pictorial representation (e.g., icon) of the multi-frame Image.

table_lines.name: Concatenation UID
table_lines.comment:
Identifier of all SOP Instances that belong to the same concatenation.
Required if a group of multi-frame image SOP Instances within a Series are part of a Concatenation.

table_lines.name: SOP Instance UID of Concatenation Source
table_lines.comment:
Note
May be used to reference the entire Instance rather than individual Instances of the concatenation, which may be transient (e.g., from a presentation state).
Required if Concatenation UID (0020,9161) is present.

table_lines.name: In-concatenation Number
table_lines.comment: Required if Concatenation UID (0020,9161) is present.

table_lines.name: In-concatenation Total Number
table_lines.comment:
The number of SOP Instances sharing the same Concatenation UID.
If present, shall have a value greater than one, unless an IOD overrides this constraint to enumerate a value of 1 to prevent the use of Concatenations (e.g., see

C.7-22.table_caption: Palette Color Lookup Table Module Attributes

C.7-22a.table_caption: Palette Color Lookup Table Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
Green Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Descriptor
Palette Color Lookup Table UID
table_lines.comment: sect_C.7.9.1

table_lines.name: Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data
Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data
Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data
Segmented Red Palette Color Lookup Table Data
table_lines.comment: sect_C.7.9.2

table_lines.name: Segmented Green Palette Color Lookup Table Data
table_lines.comment: sect_C.7.9.2

table_lines.name: Segmented Blue Palette Color Lookup Table Data
table_lines.comment: sect_C.7.9.2

table_lines.name: Acquisition UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identification of the single continuous gathering of data over a period of time that resulted in this instance.

table_lines.name: Acquisition Number
table_lines.comment: A number identifying the single continuous gathering of data over a period of time that resulted in this instance.

table_lines.name: Acquisition Date
table_lines.comment: The date the acquisition of data that resulted in this instance started.

table_lines.name: Acquisition Time
table_lines.comment: The time the acquisition of data that resulted in this instance started.

table_lines.name: Acquisition DateTime
table_lines.comment: The date and time that the acquisition of data that resulted in this instance started.

table_lines.name: Acquisition Duration
table_lines.comment: Duration of the single continuous gathering of data over a period of time that resulted in this instance, in seconds.

table_lines.name: Images in Acquisition
table_lines.comment: Number of images that resulted from this acquisition of data.

table_lines.name: Pyramid UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identifier of a multi-resolution representation of an image.

table_lines.name: Pyramid Label
table_lines.comment: User-defined label identifying a multi-resolution representation of an image.

table_lines.name: Pyramid Description
table_lines.comment: User-defined description of a multi-resolution representation of an image.

table_lines.name: Body Part Examined
table_lines.comment: Text description of the part of the body examined. See

table_lines.name: View Position
table_lines.comment:
Radiographic view associated with Patient Position (0018,5100).
For humans:
For non-human organisms, capitalized versions with hyphens replaced by underscores of the abbreviations defined in "Smallwood et al. A Nomenclature for Radiographic Projections Used In Veterinary Medicine" shall be used. See

table_lines.name: Filter Type
table_lines.comment: Label for the type of filter inserted into the X-Ray beam.

table_lines.name: Collimator/grid Name
table_lines.comment: Label describing any grid inserted.

table_lines.name: Focal Spot(s)
table_lines.comment: Size of the focal spot in mm. For devices with variable focal spot or multiple focal spots, small dimension followed by large dimension.

table_lines.name: Plate Type
table_lines.comment: Label of the type of storage phosphor plates used in this Series.

table_lines.name: Phosphor Type
table_lines.comment: Label of type of phosphor on the plates.

table_lines.name: Photometric Interpretation
table_lines.comment: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data.

table_lines.name: KVP
table_lines.comment: Peak kilo voltage output of the X-Ray generator used.

table_lines.name: Plate ID
table_lines.comment: The ID or serial number of the sensing plate upon which the image was acquired.

table_lines.name: Distance Source to Detector
table_lines.comment: Distance in mm from source to detector center.

table_lines.name: Distance Source to Patient
table_lines.comment: Distance in mm from source to center of field of view.

table_lines.name: Exposure Time
table_lines.comment: Time of X-Ray exposure in msec.

table_lines.name: X-Ray Tube Current
table_lines.comment: X-Ray Tube Current in mA.

table_lines.name: Exposure
table_lines.comment: The exposure expressed in mAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-Ray Tube Current.

table_lines.name: Exposure in uAs
table_lines.comment: The exposure expressed in uAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-Ray Tube Current.

table_lines.name: Imager Pixel Spacing
table_lines.comment:
Physical distance measured at the front plane of the Image Receptor housing between the center of each pixel. Specified by a numeric pair - row spacing value (delimiter) column spacing value - in mm.
In the case of CR, the front plane is defined to be the external surface of the CR plate closest to the patient and radiation source.

table_lines.name: Generator Power
table_lines.comment: Power in kW to the X-Ray generator.

table_lines.name: Acquisition Device Processing Description
table_lines.comment: Describes device-specific processing associated with the image (e.g., Organ Description).

table_lines.name: Acquisition Device Processing Code
table_lines.comment: Code representing the device-specific processing associated with the image (e.g., CR Organ Filtering code).

table_lines.name: Cassette Orientation
table_lines.comment: Orientation of cassette, used to properly position the image for display.

table_lines.name: Cassette Size
table_lines.comment: Size of cassette.

table_lines.name: Exposures on Plate
table_lines.comment: Total number of X-Ray exposures that have been made on the plate identified in Plate ID (0018,1004).

table_lines.name: Relative X-Ray Exposure
table_lines.comment: Relative X-Ray exposure on the plate. Meaning of values is implementation specific. May be used to adjust the dynamic range of the plate digitizer (scanner).

table_lines.name: Sensitivity
table_lines.comment: Read out sensitivity.

table_lines.name: Multi-energy CT Acquisition
table_lines.comment: Indicates whether the image is created by means of Multi-energy technique.

table_lines.name: Rescale Intercept
table_lines.comment:
The value b in relationship between stored values (SV) and the output units.
Output units = m*SV+b
If Image Type (0008,0008) Value 1 is ORIGINAL and Value 3 is not LOCALIZER, and Multi-energy CT Acquisition (0018,9361) is either absent or NO, output units shall be Hounsfield Units (HU).

table_lines.name: Rescale Slope
table_lines.comment: m in the equation specified in Rescale Intercept (0028,1052).

table_lines.name: Rescale Type
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the output units of Rescale Slope (0028,1053) and Rescale Intercept (0028,1052).
See
Required if the Rescale Type is not HU (Hounsfield Units), or Multi-energy CT Acquisition (0018,9361) is YES. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: KVP
table_lines.comment:
Peak kilo voltage output of the X-Ray generator used.
Shall be empty if this Attribute is present in Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362).

table_lines.name: Acquisition Number
table_lines.comment: A number identifying the single continuous gathering of data over a period of time that resulted in this image.

table_lines.name: Scan Options
table_lines.comment: Parameters of scanning sequence.

table_lines.name: Data Collection Diameter
table_lines.comment:
The diameter in mm of the region over which data were collected.
Shall not be present if this Attribute is present in Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362) and the value of this Attribute is not the same in all Items of the Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362).

table_lines.name: Reconstruction Diameter
table_lines.comment:
Diameter in mm of the region from within which data were used in creating the reconstruction of the image. Data may exist outside this region and portions of the patient may exist outside this region.
The diameter defines a circular region that is entirely contained within the encoded Pixel Data (7FE0,0010), unless the encoded image has been cropped after reconstruction.

table_lines.name: Distance Source to Detector
table_lines.comment:
Distance in mm from source to detector center.
Shall not be present if this Attribute is present in Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362) and the value of this Attribute is not the same in all Items of the Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362).

table_lines.name: Distance Source to Patient
table_lines.comment: Distance in mm from source to isocenter (center of field of view).

table_lines.name: Gantry/Detector Tilt
table_lines.comment: Nominal angle of tilt in degrees of the scanning gantry. Not intended for mathematical computations.

table_lines.name: Table Height
table_lines.comment: The distance in mm of the top of the patient table to the center of rotation; below the center is positive.

table_lines.name: Rotation Direction
table_lines.comment: Direction of rotation of the source when relevant, about nearest principal axis of equipment.

table_lines.name: Exposure Time
table_lines.comment:
Time of X-Ray exposure in msec.
If Acquisition Type (0018,9302) equals SPIRAL, the value of this Attribute shall be Revolution Time (0018,9305) divided by the Spiral Pitch Factor (0018,9311). See
Shall not be present if the corresponding Attribute, Exposure Time in ms (0018,9328), is present in Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362) and the value of this Attribute is not the same in all Items of the Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362).

table_lines.name: X-Ray Tube Current
table_lines.comment:
X-Ray Tube Current in mA.
Shall not be present if the corresponding Attribute, X-Ray Tube Current in mA (0018,9330), is present in Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362) and the value of this Attribute is not the same in all Items of the Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362).

table_lines.name: Exposure
table_lines.comment:
The exposure expressed in mAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-Ray Tube Current.
Shall not be present if the corresponding Attribute, Exposure in mAs (0018,9332), is present in Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362) and the value of this Attribute is not the same in all Items of the Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362).

table_lines.name: Exposure in uAs
table_lines.comment:
The exposure expressed in uAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-Ray Tube Current.
Shall not be present if the corresponding Attribute, Exposure in mAs (0018,9332), is present in Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362) and the value of this Attribute is not the same in all Items of the Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362).

table_lines.name: Filter Type
table_lines.comment:
Label for the type of filter inserted into the X-Ray beam.
Shall not be present if this Attribute is present in Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362) and the value of this Attribute is not the same in all Items of the Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362).

table_lines.name: Generator Power
table_lines.comment:
Power in kW to the X-Ray generator.
Shall not be present if this Attribute is present in Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362) and the value of this Attribute is not the same in all Items of the Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362).

table_lines.name: Focal Spot(s)
table_lines.comment:
Size of the focal spot in mm. For devices with variable focal spot or multiple focal spots, small dimension followed by large dimension.
Shall not be present if this Attribute is present in Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362) and the value of this Attribute is not the same in all Items of the Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362).

table_lines.name: Convolution Kernel
table_lines.comment: A label describing the convolution kernel or algorithm used to reconstruct the data.

table_lines.name: Revolution Time
table_lines.comment: The time in seconds of a complete revolution of the source around the gantry orbit.

table_lines.name: Single Collimation Width
table_lines.comment:
The width of a single row of acquired data (in mm).
Shall not be present if this Attribute is present in Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362) and the value of this Attribute is not the same in all Items of the Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362).

table_lines.name: Total Collimation Width
table_lines.comment:
The width of the total collimation (in mm) over the area of active X-Ray detection.
Shall not be present if this Attribute is present in Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362) and the value of this Attribute is not the same in all Items of the Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence (0018,9362).

table_lines.name: Table Speed
table_lines.comment: The distance in mm that the table moves in one second during the gathering of data that resulted in this image.

table_lines.name: Table Feed per Rotation
table_lines.comment: Motion of the table (in mm) during a complete revolution of the source around the gantry orbit.

table_lines.name: Spiral Pitch Factor
table_lines.comment: Ratio of the Table Feed per Rotation (0018,9310) to the Total Collimation Width (0018,9307).

table_lines.name: Exposure Modulation Type
table_lines.comment: A label describing the type of exposure modulation used for the purpose of limiting the dose.

table_lines.name: CTDIvol
table_lines.comment: biblio_IEC60601-2-44

table_lines.name: CTDI Phantom Type Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Water Equivalent Diameter
table_lines.comment: biblio_AAPM_TG220

table_lines.name: Water Equivalent Diameter Calculation Method Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The method of calculation of Water Equivalent Diameter (0018,1271).
Required if Water Equivalent Diameter (0018,1271) is present.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Image and Fluoroscopy Area Dose Product
table_lines.comment: X-Ray dose, measured in dGy*cm*cm, to which the patient was exposed for the acquisition of the entire Irradiation Event from which this image was reconstructed.

table_lines.name: Calcium Scoring Mass Factor Patient
table_lines.comment:
The calibration factor for the calcium mass score. These factors incorporate the effects of
See

table_lines.name: Calcium Scoring Mass Factor Device
table_lines.comment:
The calibration factors for the calcium mass score of the device. These factors incorporate the effects of
This a multi-value Attribute, the first value specifies the mass factor for a small patient size, the second value for a medium patient size and the third value for a large patient size.
See

table_lines.name: Energy Weighting Factor
table_lines.comment:
The weighting factor of the data from the primary source in a multiple energy composition image. This factor incorporates the effects of
Required if one Derivation Code Sequence (0008,9215) Item value is

table_lines.name: CT Additional X-Ray Source Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Acquisition parameters for X-Ray sources beyond the primary X-Ray source, which is specified in other Attributes of this Module.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
Shall not be present if Multi-energy CT Acquisition (0018,9361) is YES.

table_lines.name: >KVP
table_lines.comment: Peak kilo voltage output of the X-Ray generator used.

table_lines.name: >X-Ray Tube Current in mA
table_lines.comment: Nominal X-Ray tube current in milliamperes.

table_lines.name: >Data Collection Diameter
table_lines.comment: The diameter in mm of the region over which data were collected.

table_lines.name: >Focal Spot(s)
table_lines.comment: Used nominal size of the focal spot in mm.

table_lines.name: >Filter Type
table_lines.comment: Type of filter(s) inserted into the X-Ray beam.

table_lines.name: >Filter Material
table_lines.comment: The X-Ray absorbing material used in the filter.

table_lines.name: >Exposure in mAs
table_lines.comment: The exposure expressed in milliampere seconds, for example calculated from exposure time and X-Ray tube current.

table_lines.name: >Energy Weighting Factor
table_lines.comment:
The weighting factor of the data from this additional source in a multiple energy composition image. This factor incorporates the effects of
Required if one Derivation Code Sequence (0008,9215) Item value is

table_lines.name: Isocenter Position
table_lines.comment: Isocenter coordinates (x,y,z), in mm. Specifies the location of the machine isocenter in the Patient-Based Coordinate System associated with the Frame of Reference. It allows transformation from the Equipment-Based Coordinate System to the Patient-Based Coordinate System.

table_lines.name: Multi-energy CT Acquisition Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The Attributes of a Multi-energy CT Image acquisition.
One Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Multi-energy Acquisition Description
table_lines.comment: Human readable summary of the Multi-Energy technique applied during the acquisition.

C.8.2.2-2.table_caption: Multi-energy CT X-Ray Source Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Multi-energy CT X-Ray Source Sequence
table_lines.comment: One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >X-Ray Source Index
table_lines.comment:
Identification number of this item in the Multi-energy CT X-Ray Source Sequence.
The number shall be 1 for the first Item and increase by 1 for each subsequent Item.

table_lines.name: >X-Ray Source ID
table_lines.comment:
Identifier of the physical X-Ray source. This might be the serial number.
The X-Ray Source ID (0018,9367) will have the same value for different values of X-Ray Source Index (0018,9366) if a single source generates different nominal energies.

table_lines.name: >Multi-energy Source Technique
table_lines.comment: Technique used to acquire Multi-energy data.

table_lines.name: >Switching Phase Number
table_lines.comment:
A number, unique within the sequence, to identify the switching phase.
Required if Multi-energy Source Technique (0018,9368) is "SWITCHING_SOURCE".

table_lines.name: >Switching Phase Nominal Duration
table_lines.comment:
Duration, in microseconds, that the energy is nominally in the target KV for this switching phase. I.e., the Switching Phase Nominal Duration does not include the Switching Phase Transition Duration (0018,936D).
The target KV is the value of KVP (0018,0060) for the item in the CT X-Ray Details Sequence (0018,9325) that identifies the Multi-energy CT Path Index (0018,937A) that corresponds to this X-Ray Source.

table_lines.name: >Switching Phase Transition Duration
table_lines.comment:
Duration, in microseconds, that the energy has left the target KV for this switching phase, but has not yet reached the target KV for the next phase.
The target KV is the value of KVP (0018,0060) for the item in the CT X-Ray Details Sequence (0018,9325) that identifies the Multi-energy CT Path Index (0018,937A) that corresponds to this X-Ray Source.

table_lines.name: >Generator Power
table_lines.comment: Power in kW going into the X-Ray generator.

C.8.2.2-3.table_caption: Multi-energy CT X-Ray Detector Macro Attributes

table_lines.name: Multi-energy CT X-Ray Detector Sequence
table_lines.comment: One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >X-Ray Detector Index
table_lines.comment:
Identification number of this item in the Multi-energy CT X-Ray Detector Sequence.
The number shall be 1 for the first Item and increase by 1 for each subsequent Item.

table_lines.name: >X-Ray Detector ID
table_lines.comment:
Identifier of the physical X-Ray detector. This might be the serial number.
When a single detector discriminates different energies, the X-Ray Detector ID (0018,9371) will have the same value in different Items of Multi-energy CT X-Ray Detector Sequence (0018,936F).

table_lines.name: >Multi-energy Detector Type
table_lines.comment: Technology used to detect multiple energies.

table_lines.name: >X-Ray Detector Label
table_lines.comment: Label of this item in the Multi-energy CT X-Ray Detector Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Nominal Max Energy
table_lines.comment: Required if Multi-energy Detector Type (0018,9372) is PHOTON_COUNTING. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Nominal Min Energy
table_lines.comment: Required if Multi-energy Detector Type (0018,9372) is PHOTON_COUNTING. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Multi-energy CT Path Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Two or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
See also

table_lines.name: >Multi-energy CT Path Index
table_lines.comment:
Identification number of the element in the Multi-energy CT Path Sequence.
The number shall be 1 for the first Item and increase by 1 for each subsequent Item.

table_lines.name: >Referenced X-Ray Source Index
table_lines.comment: References the X-Ray Source Index (0018,9366) in the Multi-energy CT X-Ray Source Sequence (0018,9365) in this path.

table_lines.name: >Referenced X-Ray Detector Index
table_lines.comment: References the X-Ray Detector Index (0018,9370) in the Multi-energy CT X-Ray Detector Sequence (0018,936F) in this path.

table_lines.name: Bits Stored
table_lines.comment: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored.

table_lines.name: High Bit
table_lines.comment: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. Each sample shall have the same high bit. High Bit (0028,0102) shall be one less than Bits Stored (0028,0101).

table_lines.name: Scanning Sequence
table_lines.comment: Description of the type of data taken.

table_lines.name: Sequence Variant
table_lines.comment: Variant of the Scanning Sequence.

table_lines.name: Scan Options
table_lines.comment: Parameters of scanning sequence.

table_lines.name: MR Acquisition Type
table_lines.comment: Identification of data encoding scheme.

table_lines.name: Repetition Time
table_lines.comment:
The period of time in msec between the beginning of a pulse sequence and the beginning of the succeeding (essentially identical) pulse sequence.
Required if Sequence Variant (0018,0021) is SK or if Scanning Sequence (0018,0020) is not EP. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Echo Time
table_lines.comment: Time in ms between the middle of the excitation pulse and the peak of the echo produced (kx=0). In the case of segmented k-space, the TE(eff) is the time between the middle of the excitation pulse to the peak of the echo that is used to cover the center of k-space (i.e., -kx=0, ky=0).

table_lines.name: Echo Train Length
table_lines.comment: Number of lines in k-space acquired per excitation per image.

table_lines.name: Inversion Time
table_lines.comment: Time in msec after the middle of inverting RF pulse to middle of excitation pulse to detect the amount of longitudinal magnetization. Required if Scanning Sequence (0018,0020) has values of IR.

table_lines.name: Trigger Time
table_lines.comment: Time, in msec, between peak of the R wave and the peak of the echo produced. In the case of segmented k-space, the TE(eff) is the time between the peak of the echo that is used to cover the center of k-space. Required for Scan Options (0018,0022) that include heart gating (e.g., CG, PPG, etc.).

table_lines.name: Sequence Name
table_lines.comment: User defined name for the combination of Scanning Sequence (0018,0020) and Sequence Variant (0018,0021).

table_lines.name: Angio Flag
table_lines.comment: Angio Image Indicator. Primary image for Angio processing.

table_lines.name: Number of Averages
table_lines.comment: Number of times a given pulse sequence is repeated before any parameter is changed.

table_lines.name: Imaging Frequency
table_lines.comment: Precession frequency in MHz of the nucleus being addressed.

table_lines.name: Imaged Nucleus
table_lines.comment: Nucleus that is resonant at the imaging frequency. Examples: 31P, 1H.

table_lines.name: Echo Number(s)
table_lines.comment: The echo number used in generating this image. In the case of segmented k-space, it is the effective Echo Number.

table_lines.name: Magnetic Field Strength
table_lines.comment: Nominal field strength of MR magnet, in Tesla.

table_lines.name: Number of Phase Encoding Steps
table_lines.comment: Total number of lines in k-space in the 'y' direction collected during acquisition.

table_lines.name: Percent Sampling
table_lines.comment: Fraction of acquisition matrix lines acquired, expressed as a percent.

table_lines.name: Percent Phase Field of View
table_lines.comment: Ratio of field of view dimension in phase direction to field of view dimension in frequency direction, expressed as a percent.

table_lines.name: Pixel Bandwidth
table_lines.comment: Reciprocal of the total sampling period, in hertz per pixel.

table_lines.name: Nominal Interval
table_lines.comment: Average R-R interval used for the scans, in msec.

table_lines.name: Beat Rejection Flag
table_lines.comment: Beat length sorting has been applied.

table_lines.name: Low R-R Value
table_lines.comment: R-R interval low limit for beat rejection, in msec.

table_lines.name: High R-R Value
table_lines.comment: R-R interval high limit for beat rejection, in msec.

table_lines.name: Intervals Acquired
table_lines.comment: Number of R-R intervals acquired.

table_lines.name: Intervals Rejected
table_lines.comment: Number of R-R intervals rejected.

table_lines.name: PVC Rejection
table_lines.comment: Description of type of PVC rejection criteria used.

table_lines.name: Skip Beats
table_lines.comment: Number of beats skipped after a detected arrhythmia.

table_lines.name: Heart Rate
table_lines.comment: Beats per minute.

table_lines.name: Cardiac Number of Images
table_lines.comment: Number of images per cardiac cycle.

table_lines.name: Trigger Window
table_lines.comment: Percent of R-R interval, based on Heart Rate (0018,1088), prescribed as a window for a valid/usable trigger.

table_lines.name: Reconstruction Diameter
table_lines.comment:
Diameter in mm. of the region from within which data were used in creating the reconstruction of the image. Data may exist outside this region and portions of the patient may exist outside this region.
The diameter defines a circular region that is entirely contained within the encoded Pixel Data (7FE0,0010), unless the encoded image has been cropped after reconstruction.

table_lines.name: Receive Coil Name
table_lines.comment: Receive coil used.

table_lines.name: Transmit Coil Name
table_lines.comment: Transmit coil used.

table_lines.name: Acquisition Matrix
table_lines.comment:
Dimensions of the acquired frequency /phase data before reconstruction.
Multi-valued: frequency rows\frequency columns\phase rows\phase columns.

table_lines.name: In-plane Phase Encoding Direction
table_lines.comment: The axis of phase encoding with respect to the image.

table_lines.name: Flip Angle
table_lines.comment: Steady state angle in degrees to which the magnetic vector is flipped from the magnetic vector of the primary field.

table_lines.name: SAR
table_lines.comment: Calculated whole body Specific Absorption Rate in watts/kilogram.

table_lines.name: Variable Flip Angle Flag
table_lines.comment: Flip angle variation applied during image acquisition.

table_lines.name: dB/dt
table_lines.comment: The rate of change of the gradient coil magnetic flux density with time (T/s).

table_lines.name: Temporal Position Identifier
table_lines.comment: Temporal order of a dynamic or functional set of Images.

table_lines.name: Number of Temporal Positions
table_lines.comment: Total number of temporal positions prescribed.

table_lines.name: Temporal Resolution
table_lines.comment: Time delta between Images in a dynamic or functional set of Images.

table_lines.name: Isocenter Position
table_lines.comment: Isocenter coordinates (x,y,z), in mm. Specifies the location of the machine isocenter in the Patient-Based Coordinate System associated with the Frame of Reference. It allows transformation from the Equipment-Based Coordinate System to the Patient-Based Coordinate System.

table_lines.name: B1rms
table_lines.comment: biblio_IEC60601-2-33

table_lines.name: Patient Orientation Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: Zero or one Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage:
B

Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

table_lines.name: >Patient Orientation Modifier Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: Zero or one Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage:
B

Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

table_lines.name: Patient Gantry Relationship Code Sequence
table_lines.comment: Zero or one Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage:
B

Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

table_lines.name: Samples per Pixel
table_lines.comment: Number of samples (color planes) in this image. The value shall be 1.

table_lines.name: Bits Allocated
table_lines.comment: Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits allocated.

table_lines.name: Bits Stored
table_lines.comment: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored. The value shall be the same as the value in Bits Allocated (0028,0100).

table_lines.name: High Bit
table_lines.comment: Most significant bit for pixel sample data. Each sample shall have the same high bit. Shall be one less than the value in Bits Stored (0028,0101).

table_lines.name: Number of Rotations
table_lines.comment:
Number of rotations. Required if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3 is
TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.
See

table_lines.name: Image ID
table_lines.comment: User or equipment generated Image identifier.

table_lines.name: Lossy Image Compression
table_lines.comment:
Specifies whether an Image has undergone lossy compression (at a point in its lifetime).
Once this value has been set to "01" it shall not be reset.
See
Required if Lossy Compression has been performed on the Image. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Acquisition Termination Condition
table_lines.comment:
Description of how the data collection was stopped.
See

table_lines.name: Table Height
table_lines.comment:
The height of the patient table in mm. The range and values of this element are determined by the manufacturer. Should not be included if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, is
TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

table_lines.name: Table Traverse
table_lines.comment:
Location of the patient table (or gantry relative to the table) in mm. The range and values of this element are determined by the manufacturer. Should not be included if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, is
TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

table_lines.name: Actual Frame Duration
table_lines.comment:
Elapsed time for data acquisition in msec. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 is:
WHOLE BODY or
STATIC.
See

table_lines.name: Count Rate
table_lines.comment: Maximum count rate achieved during the acquisition in counts/sec.

table_lines.name: Processing Function
table_lines.comment: Code or description of processing functions applied to the data.

table_lines.name: Corrected Image
table_lines.comment: One or more values that indicate which, if any, corrections have been applied to the image. Corrections are applied to all frames in the image.

table_lines.name: Whole Body Technique
table_lines.comment: The type of scan performed. Used only if Image Type (0008,0008), Value 3, contains the value WHOLE BODY.

table_lines.name: Scan Velocity
table_lines.comment: The speed of the camera motion over the body in mm/sec. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 contains the value WHOLE BODY.

table_lines.name: Scan Length
table_lines.comment: Size of the imaged area in the direction of scanning motion, in mm. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 contains the value WHOLE BODY.

table_lines.name: Trigger Source or Type
table_lines.comment: Text indicating trigger source.

table_lines.usage: No CID for the Anatomic Region Sequence is defined.

table_lines.name: Real World Value Mapping Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The mapping of stored values to associated Real World Values.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Scan Progression Direction
table_lines.comment: The anatomical order in which the slices were acquired.

table_lines.name: Energy Window Information Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items that describe the energy window groups used.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
The number of Items shall be equal to Number of Energy Windows (0054,0011). The first Item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Energy Window Vector (0054,0010), the second Item with value 2, etc.

table_lines.name: >Energy Window Name
table_lines.comment: A user defined name that describes this Energy Window.

table_lines.name: >Energy Window Range Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items that describes this energy window group.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Radiopharmaceutical Information Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items that describe isotope information.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Radionuclide Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies the radionuclide.
Zero or one Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage:
B

Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

table_lines.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Route
table_lines.comment: Route of injection.

table_lines.name: >Administration Route Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies the administration route for the radiopharmaceutical.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage:
B

Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

table_lines.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Volume
table_lines.comment: Volume of injection in cubic cm.

table_lines.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Administration Event UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identification of the administration of the radiopharmaceutical to the patient.

table_lines.name: >Calibration Data Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that contains calibration data.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Energy Window Number
table_lines.comment: The Item number in the Energy Window Information Sequence to which the following calibration data relates. The Items are numbered starting from 1.

table_lines.name: >Radiopharmaceutical
table_lines.comment: Name of the radiopharmaceutical.

table_lines.name: >Radiopharmaceutical Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies the radiopharmaceutical.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage:
B

Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

table_lines.name: Intervention Drug Information Sequence
table_lines.comment: Sequence of Items that describes the intervention drugs used. One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Intervention Drug Name
table_lines.comment: Name of intervention drug.

table_lines.name: >Intervention Drug Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies the intervention drug name.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage:
B

Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

table_lines.name: >Administration Route Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that identifies the administration route for the intervention drug.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage:
B

Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

table_lines.name: >Intervention Drug Start Time
table_lines.comment: Time of administration of the intervention drug, using the same time base as for Acquisition Time (0008,0032).

table_lines.name: >Intervention Drug Stop Time
table_lines.comment: Time of completion of administration of the intervention drug, using the same time base as for Acquisition Time (0008,0032).

table_lines.name: >Intervention Drug Dose
table_lines.comment: Intervention drug dose, in mg.

table_lines.name: Detector Information Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items that describe the detectors used.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
The number of Items shall be equal to Number of Detectors (0054,0021). The first Item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in Detector Vector (0054,0020), the second Item with value 2, etc.

table_lines.name: >Collimator/Grid Name
table_lines.comment: Label describing the collimator used (LEAP, hires, etc.).

table_lines.name: >Collimator Type
table_lines.comment: Collimator type.

table_lines.name: >Field of View Shape
table_lines.comment: Shape of the field of view of the Nuclear Medicine detector.

table_lines.name: >Field of View Dimension(s)
table_lines.comment:
Dimensions of the field of view, in mm. If Field of View Shape (0018,1147) is:
RECTANGLE: row dimension followed by column.
ROUND: diameter.
HEXAGONAL: diameter of a circumscribed circle.

table_lines.name: >Distance Source to Detector
table_lines.comment: Distance in mm from transmission source to the detector face. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 4 is TRANSMISSION and Value 3 is not any of TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

table_lines.name: >Start Angle
table_lines.comment: Position of the detector about the patient for the start of the acquisition, in degrees. Zero degrees is referenced to the origin at the patient's back. Viewing from the patient's feet, angle increases in a counter-clockwise direction (detector normal rotating from the patient's back towards the patient's left side). Should not be included if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

table_lines.name: >Radial Position
table_lines.comment: Radial distance of the detector from the center of rotation, in mm. Should not be included if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO.

table_lines.name: >View Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that describes the projection of the anatomic region of interest on the image receptor.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage:
B

Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

table_lines.name: >>View Modifier Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
View Modifier. Required if needed to fully specify the View.
Zero or one Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage:
B

Code Meaning (0008,0104) shall be Type 3 for historical reasons.

table_lines.name: Rotation Information Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items that describe TOMO rotational groups. A new rotation is defined whenever the direction of the detector motion changes, or Table Traverse (0018,1131) changes.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
The number of Items shall be equal to Number of Rotations (0054,0051). If Rotation Vector (0054,0050) is present, the first Item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in Rotation Vector (0054,0050), the second Item with value 2, etc.

table_lines.name: >Start Angle
table_lines.comment: Position of the detector about the patient for the start of this rotation, in degrees. Zero degrees is referenced to the origin at the patient's back. Viewing from the patient's feet, angle increases in a counter-clockwise direction (detector normal rotating from the patient's back towards the patient's left side).

table_lines.name: >Rotation Direction
table_lines.comment: Direction of rotation of the detector about the patient. See Start Angle (0054,0200) for further explanation of direction.

table_lines.name: >Scan Arc
table_lines.comment: The effective angular range of the scan data in degrees. The value shall be positive.

table_lines.name: >Actual Frame Duration
table_lines.comment: Nominal acquisition time per angular position, in msec.

table_lines.name: >Radial Position
table_lines.comment: Radial distance of the detector from the center of rotation, in mm. It shall have a single value that is an average value for this rotation, or it shall have one value per angular view.

table_lines.name: >Distance Source to Detector
table_lines.comment: Distance in mm from transmission source to the detector face. Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 4 is TRANSMISSION.

table_lines.name: >Number of Frames in Rotation
table_lines.comment: Number of angular views in this rotation.

table_lines.name: >Table Traverse
table_lines.comment: Location of the patient table (or gantry relative to the table) in mm. The range and values of this element are determined by the manufacturer.

table_lines.name: >Table Height
table_lines.comment: The distance in mm of the top of the patient table to the center of rotation. Table height below the center of rotation has a positive value.

table_lines.name: Type of Detector Motion
table_lines.comment: Describes the detector motion during acquisition.

table_lines.name: Beat Rejection Flag
table_lines.comment: Heart beat duration sorting has been applied.

table_lines.name: PVC Rejection
table_lines.comment: Description of type of arrhythmic beat rejection criteria used.

table_lines.name: Skip Beats
table_lines.comment: Number of beats skipped after a detected arrhythmia.

table_lines.name: Heart Rate
table_lines.comment: Average number of heart beats per minute for the collection period for these frames. This shall include all accepted beats as well as rejected beats.

table_lines.name: Gated Information Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items that describe R-R intervals. Each gated interval is defined by an upper and lower range of heart beat durations. Required if the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) contains the Tag for R-R Interval Vector (0054,0060).
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
The number of Items shall be equal to Number of R-R Intervals (0054,0061). The first Item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the R-R Interval Vector (0054,0060), the second Item with value 2, etc.

table_lines.name: >Trigger Time
table_lines.comment: Time interval measured in msec from the start of the R-wave to the beginning of the data taking.

table_lines.name: >Cardiac Framing Type
table_lines.comment:
Description of type of framing performed.
See

table_lines.name: >Data Information Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items that describe gating criteria.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >>Frame Time
table_lines.comment: Nominal time per individual frame in msec.

table_lines.name: >>Nominal Interval
table_lines.comment: Average duration of accepted beats, in msec.

table_lines.name: >>Low R-R Value
table_lines.comment: R-R interval lower limit for beat rejection, in msec.

table_lines.name: >>High R-R Value
table_lines.comment: R-R interval upper limit for beat rejection, in msec.

table_lines.name: >>Intervals Acquired
table_lines.comment: Number of heartbeats that fall within Low R-R Value (0018,1081) and High R-R Value (0018,1082), and were therefore accepted and contribute gamma events to this R-R Interval.

table_lines.name: >>Intervals Rejected
table_lines.comment: Number of heartbeats that fall outside Low R-R (0018,1081) and High R-R Value (0018,1082), and do not contribute gamma events to this R-R Interval. However, they may contribute gamma events to other R-R Intervals.

table_lines.name: >>Time Slot Information Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items that describe Time Slot Information. Required if the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) contains the Tag for Time Slot Vector (0054,0070).
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
The number of Items shall be equal to Number of Time Slots (0054,0071). The first Item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in the Time Slot Vector (0054,0070), the second Item with value 2, etc.

table_lines.name: Phase Information Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items that describes each dynamic phase. Required if the Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) contains the Tag for Phase Vector (0054,0030).
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
The number of Items shall be equal to Number of Phases (0054,0031). The first Item corresponds to frames with value of 1 in Phase Vector (0054,0030), the second Item with value 2, etc.

table_lines.name: >Phase Delay
table_lines.comment: Time paused between the last frame of the previous phase and the first frame of this phase, in msec.

table_lines.name: >Actual Frame Duration
table_lines.comment: Nominal time of acquisition per individual frame, in msec.

table_lines.name: >Pause Between Frames
table_lines.comment: Time paused between each frame of this phase (in msec).

table_lines.name: >Number of Frames in Phase
table_lines.comment: Number of frames in this phase.

table_lines.name: >Number of Triggers in Phase
table_lines.comment: The number of entries in Trigger Vector (0054,0210) for this phase. Required if Trigger Vector (0054,0210) is present.

table_lines.name: >Phase Description
table_lines.comment: Description of this phase of the Dynamic image.

table_lines.name: Reconstruction Diameter
table_lines.comment:
Diameter, in mm, of the region from within which the data was used in creating the reconstruction of the image. Data may exist outside this region and portions of the patient may exist outside this region.
The diameter defines a circular region that is entirely contained within the encoded Pixel Data (7FE0,0010), unless the encoded image has been cropped after reconstruction.

table_lines.name: Convolution Kernel
table_lines.comment: A label describing the convolution kernel or algorithm used to reconstruct the data.

table_lines.name: Slice Thickness
table_lines.comment: Nominal slice thickness, in mm.

table_lines.name: Slice Location
table_lines.comment:
Relative position of the image plane expressed in mm.
See

table_lines.name: Slice Progression Direction
table_lines.comment:
Describes the anatomical direction that slices are progressing as the slices are considered in order (as defined by Slice Vector (0054,0080)). Meaningful only for cardiac images.
When View Code Sequence (0054,0220) indicates a short axis view, then the Enumerated Values are:

table_lines.name: Sequence of Ultrasound Regions
table_lines.comment:
Defines a Sequence of Ultrasound Regions.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Region Location Min x0
table_lines.comment:
The bounds of a rectangle specifying the location of the region, x0,y0,x1,y1.
See

table_lines.name: >Region Location Min y0
table_lines.comment:
The bounds of a rectangle specifying the location of the region, x0,y0,x1,y1.
See

table_lines.name: >Region Location Max x1
table_lines.comment:
The bounds of a rectangle specifying the location of the region, x0,y0,x1,y1.
See

table_lines.name: >Region Location Max y1
table_lines.comment:
The bounds of a rectangle specifying the location of the region, x0,y0,x1,y1.
See

table_lines.name: >Physical Units X Direction
table_lines.comment:
The physical units of the dimensions of the region.
See

table_lines.name: >Physical Units Y Direction
table_lines.comment:
The physical units of the dimensions of the region.
See

table_lines.name: >Physical Delta X
table_lines.comment:
The physical value increments per positive X pixel increment. The units are as specified in the Physical Units X Direction (0018,6024).
See

table_lines.name: >Physical Delta Y
table_lines.comment:
The physical value increments per positive Y pixel increment. The units are as specified in the Physical Units Y Direction (0018,6026).
See

table_lines.name: >Reference Pixel x0
table_lines.comment:
This coordinate pair, x0,y0, defines the location of a virtual "reference" pixel.
See

table_lines.name: >Reference Pixel y0
table_lines.comment:
This coordinate pair, x0,y0, defines the location of a virtual "reference" pixel.
See

table_lines.name: >Reference Pixel Physical Value X
table_lines.comment: The Physical Value at the reference pixel x location. The units are specified in the Physical Units field.

table_lines.name: >Reference Pixel Physical Value Y
table_lines.comment: The Physical Value at the reference pixel y location. The units are specified in the Physical Units field.

table_lines.name: >Region Spatial Format
table_lines.comment:
The spatial organization of the data within the region.
See

table_lines.name: >Region Data Type
table_lines.comment:
The type of data within the region.
See

table_lines.name: >Region Flags
table_lines.comment:
Flags used for special handling of the region.
See

table_lines.name: >Pixel Component Organization
table_lines.comment:
Describes how the components of a pixel can be described. Required if pixel component calibration exists for this region.
See

table_lines.name: >Pixel Component Mask
table_lines.comment:
This value is ANDed with the composite pixel code for each pixel within the region, then shifted right by the number of contiguous least significant zeros in the mask to obtain what will be referred to as the "Shifted Masked Composite Pixel Code" (SMCPC). Required if Pixel Component Organization = Bit aligned.
See

table_lines.name: >Pixel Component Range Start
table_lines.comment:
Defines the start of the numeric range of values within the composite pixel where calibration is to be defined by the "pixel physical calibration table". To be used only when ranges are used to describe the portion of the composite pixel.
Required if Pixel Component Organization = Ranges.

table_lines.name: >Pixel Component Range Stop
table_lines.comment:
Defines the stop of the numeric range of values within the composite pixel where calibration is to be defined by the "pixel physical calibration table". To be used only when ranges are used to describe the portion of the composite pixel.
Required if Pixel Component Organization = Ranges.

table_lines.name: >Pixel Component Physical Units
table_lines.comment:
The physical units to be applied to the pixel component.
Required if Pixel Component Organization exists.
See

table_lines.name: >Pixel Component Data Type
table_lines.comment:
The type of data for the pixel component.
Required if Pixel Component Organization exists.
See

table_lines.name: >Number of Table Break Points
table_lines.comment:
The number of break point coordinate pairs used to describe a piece wise linear curve.
Required if Pixel Component Organization equals 0 or 1. Otherwise not used.
See

table_lines.name: >Table of X Break Points
table_lines.comment:
An array of X values used to create the piece wise linear curve.
