Required if Pixel Component Organization equals 0 or 1. Otherwise not used.
See

table_lines.name: >Table of Y Break Points
table_lines.comment:
An array of Y values used to create the piece wise linear curve.
Required if Pixel Component Organization equals 0 or 1. Otherwise not used.
See

table_lines.name: >Number of Table Entries
table_lines.comment:
The number of entries in the Table of Pixel Values.
Required if the value of Pixel Component Organization (0018,6044) is 2 or 3.
Otherwise not used. See

table_lines.name: >Table of Pixel Values
table_lines.comment:
A table of Pixel Values used in conjunction with the Table of Parameter Values (0018,605A) or Pixel Value Mapping Code Sequence (0040,9098) to provide a mapping from Pixel Value to a Real World Value.
Required if the Pixel Component Organization equals 2. Otherwise not used.
See

table_lines.name: >Table of Parameter Values
table_lines.comment:
A table of Parameter Values used in conjunction with the Table of Pixel Values (0018,6058) to provide a mapping from Pixel Value to Parameter Value.
Required if the value of Pixel Component Organization (0018,6044) is 2.
Otherwise not used. See

table_lines.name: >Pixel Value Mapping Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that, in conjunction with the Table of Pixel Values (0018,6058), provides a mapping from a Pixel Value to an associated Coded Concept.
One or more Items shall included in this Sequence. The number of Items shall be equal to the value of Number of Table Entries (0018,6056).
Required if the value of Pixel Component Organization (0018,6044) is 3 (Code Sequence look up).
See

table_lines.usage:
For IVUS B

No Baseline CID is defined otherwise.

table_lines.name: >Transducer Frequency
table_lines.comment: The manufacturer defined description of center frequency of the interrogating ultrasound energy. The units are kilohertz.

table_lines.name: >Pulse Repetition Frequency
table_lines.comment: The ultrasound pulse repetition frequency, as defined by the manufacturer, used to collect data in the region. The units are in hertz.

table_lines.name: >Doppler Correction Angle
table_lines.comment: The Doppler correction angle. The units are degrees.

table_lines.name: >Steering Angle
table_lines.comment: The steering angle, as defined by the manufacturer, used for a steered 2D image. The units are degrees.

table_lines.name: >Doppler Sample Volume X Position
table_lines.comment: The x displacement, in pixels, from the Reference pixel to the center of the Doppler sample volume.

table_lines.name: >Doppler Sample Volume Y Position
table_lines.comment: The y displacement, in pixels, from the Reference pixel to the center of the Doppler sample volume.

table_lines.name: >TM-Line Position X0
table_lines.comment:
The starting and ending coordinates pairs of the M-line. Where the X0,Y0 are the starting point and X1,Y1 are the end point of the TM-line.
See

table_lines.name: >TM-Line Position Y0
table_lines.comment:
The starting and ending coordinates pairs of the M-line. Where the X0,Y0 are the starting point and X1,Y1 are the end point of the TM-line.
See

table_lines.name: >TM-Line Position X1
table_lines.comment:
The starting and ending coordinates pairs of the M-line. Where the X0,Y0 are the starting point and X1,Y1 are the end point of the TM-line.
See

table_lines.name: >TM-Line Position Y1
table_lines.comment:
The starting and ending coordinates pairs of the M-line. Where the X0,Y0 are the starting point and X1,Y1 are the end point of the TM-line.
See

table_lines.name: Samples Per Pixel
table_lines.comment:
Number of samples (planes) in this image.
See

table_lines.name: Photometric Interpretation
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data.
See

table_lines.name: Bits Allocated
table_lines.comment:
Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample.
See

table_lines.name: Bits Stored
table_lines.comment:
Number of bits stored for each pixel sample.
See

table_lines.name: High Bit
table_lines.comment:
Most significant bit for pixel sample data.
See

table_lines.name: Planar Configuration
table_lines.comment:
Indicates whether the pixel data are encoded color-by-plane or color-by-pixel.
Required if Samples per Pixel (0028,0002) has a value greater than 1.
See

table_lines.name: Pixel Representation
table_lines.comment:
Data representation of pixel samples.
See

table_lines.name: Image Type
table_lines.comment:
Image identification characteristics.
See

table_lines.name: Lossy Image Compression
table_lines.comment:
Specifies whether an Image has undergone lossy compression (at a point in its lifetime).
Once this value has been set to "01" it shall not be reset.
See
Required if Lossy Compression has been performed on the Image. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Number of Stages
table_lines.comment: Number of Stages in this protocol. Required if image was acquired in a Staged protocol.

table_lines.name: Number of Views in Stage
table_lines.comment: Number of views in this Stage. Required if image was acquired in a Staged protocol.

table_lines.name: R Wave Time Vector
table_lines.comment: The time offset(s) of the reported R Wave peaks, each relative to the time of the start of the acquisition of the first frame in msec. Multi-valued, with one value per reported R Wave.

table_lines.name: Ultrasound Color Data Present
table_lines.comment:
This element indicates if any ultrasound color data is present in an image.
See

table_lines.name: Stage Name
table_lines.comment: A Stage is a particular time slice of a protocol in which a set of images are collected. The names can be free form text.

table_lines.name: Stage Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items describing the performed Ultrasound Protocol Stage(s).
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Stage Number
table_lines.comment: A number that identifies the Stage. Stage Number starts at one.

table_lines.name: View Name
table_lines.comment: A View is a particular combination of the position and orientation when a set of images are acquired. Images are acquired at the same View in different Stages for the purpose of comparison.

table_lines.name: View Number
table_lines.comment: A number that identifies the View. View Number starts at one.

table_lines.name: Number of Event Timers
table_lines.comment: The number of event timers used at the time of acquisition of a Multi-frame image.

table_lines.name: Event Elapsed Time(s)
table_lines.comment: An array of values associated with each event timer. Units in milliseconds.

table_lines.name: Event Timer Name(s)
table_lines.comment: Name that identifies the event timer.

table_lines.usage:
For intravascular ultrasound, D

No other CIDs are specified.

table_lines.name: Acquisition DateTime
table_lines.comment:
The date and time that the acquisition of data that resulted in this image started.
Required if Modality (0008,0060) = IVUS
May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Trigger Time
table_lines.comment: Time interval measured in msec from the start of the R-wave to the beginning of data taking.

table_lines.name: Nominal Interval
table_lines.comment: Average R-R interval used for these data, in msec.

table_lines.name: Beat Rejection Flag
table_lines.comment: Beat length sorting has been applied.

table_lines.name: Low R-R Value
table_lines.comment: R-R interval low limit for beat rejection, in msec.

table_lines.name: High R-R Value
table_lines.comment: R-R interval high limit for beat rejection, in msec.

table_lines.name: Heart Rate
table_lines.comment: Beats per minute.

table_lines.name: IVUS Acquisition
table_lines.comment: Required if Modality (0008,0060) = IVUS.

table_lines.name: IVUS Pullback Rate
table_lines.comment:
Required if IVUS Acquisition (0018,3100) value is MOTOR_PULLBACK. Specified in units of mm/sec.
See

table_lines.name: IVUS Gated Rate
table_lines.comment:
Required if IVUS Acquisition (0018,3100) value is GATED_PULLBACK. Specified in units of mm/beat.
See

table_lines.name: IVUS Pullback Start Frame Number
table_lines.comment:
Required if IVUS Acquisition (0018,3100) value is MOTOR_PULLBACK or GATED_PULLBACK.
See

table_lines.name: IVUS Pullback Stop Frame Number
table_lines.comment:
Required if IVUS Acquisition (0018,3100) value is MOTOR_PULLBACK or GATED_PULLBACK.
See

table_lines.name: Lesion Number
table_lines.comment:
Identifier(s) of the lesion(s) of interest imaged within the current SOP Instance. Each lesion shall have a unique numeric integer identifier within the Study.
See

table_lines.name: Output Power
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer defined character string description of ultrasound output level(s) used in generating a given image. Data may be expressed in dB, %, W/cm

table_lines.name: Transducer Data
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer defined code or description of ultrasound transducer used.

table_lines.name: Transducer Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identification of the ultrasound transducer used.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Focus Depth
table_lines.comment: The depth, from the transducer face, of the manufacturer defined beam focus used for the image, in cm.

table_lines.name: Processing Function
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer defined description of processing of echo information. Data may include code or description of gain (initial, overall, TGC, dynamic range, etc.), preprocessing, postprocessing, Doppler processing parameters, e.g., cutoff filters, etc., as used in generating a given image.

table_lines.name: Depth of Scan Field
table_lines.comment: The depth, in mm, from the transducer face to the deepest point included in the displayed image - the field of view.

table_lines.name: Overlay Subtype
table_lines.comment:
Defined Term that identifies the intended purpose of the ROI Overlay Type.
Required if this Overlay Group is referenced in an Item of the Sequence of Ultrasound Regions (0018,6011). May be present otherwise.
See

table_lines.name: Conversion Type
table_lines.comment: Describes the kind of image conversion.

table_lines.name: Modality
table_lines.comment:
Type of device, process or method that originally acquired the data used to create the Instances in this Series.
This type definition shall override the definition in the
See

table_lines.name: Secondary Capture Device ID
table_lines.comment: User defined identification of the device that converted the image.

table_lines.name: Secondary Capture Device Manufacturer
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer of the Secondary Capture Device.

table_lines.name: Secondary Capture Device Manufacturer's Model Name
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer's model number of the Secondary Capture Device.

table_lines.name: Secondary Capture Device Software Versions
table_lines.comment: Manufacturer's designation of software version of the Secondary Capture Device.

table_lines.name: Video Image Format Acquired
table_lines.comment: Original format of the captured video image (e.g., NTSC, PAL, Videomed-H).

table_lines.name: Digital Image Format Acquired
table_lines.comment: Additional information about digital interface used to acquire the image.

table_lines.name: Date of Secondary Capture
table_lines.comment: The date the Secondary Capture Image was captured.

table_lines.name: Time of Secondary Capture
table_lines.comment: The time the Secondary Capture Image was captured.

table_lines.name: Nominal Scanned Pixel Spacing
table_lines.comment: Shall be consistent with Pixel Aspect Ratio (0028,0034), if present.

table_lines.name: Document Class Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Classifications of a scanned document, e.g., for Modality (0008,0060) DOC. Equivalent to HL7 v2.x TXA-2.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Burned In Annotation
table_lines.comment: Indicates whether or not image contains sufficient burned in annotation to identify the patient and date the image was acquired.

table_lines.name: Recognizable Visual Features
table_lines.comment:
Indicates whether or not the image contains sufficiently recognizable visual features to allow the image or a reconstruction from a set of images to identify the patient.
If this Attribute is absent, then the image may or may not contain recognizable visual features.

table_lines.name: Presentation LUT Shape
table_lines.comment:
Specifies an identity transformation for the Presentation LUT, such that the output of all grayscale transformations defined in the IOD containing this Module are defined to be P-Values.
Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) is MONOCHROME2, and Bits Stored (0028,0101) is greater than 1.

table_lines.name: Illumination
table_lines.comment: Luminance of a hypothetical viewing device illuminating a piece of monochrome transmissive film, or for the case of reflective media, luminance obtainable from diffuse reflection of the illumination present. Expressed as L0, in candelas per square meter (cd/m

table_lines.name: Reflected Ambient Light
table_lines.comment: For scanned monochrome transmissive film viewed on a hypothetical viewing device, the luminance contribution due to reflected ambient light. Expressed as La, in candelas per square meter (cd/m

table_lines.name: Rescale Intercept
table_lines.comment:
The value b in the relationship between stored values (SV) in Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) and the output units specified in Rescale Type (0028,1054).
Output units = m*SV + b.
Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) is MONOCHROME2, and Bits Stored (0028,0101) is greater than 1.

table_lines.name: Rescale Slope
table_lines.comment:
m in the equation specified by Rescale Intercept (0028,1052).
Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) is MONOCHROME2, and Bits Stored (0028,0101) is greater than 1.

table_lines.name: Rescale Type
table_lines.comment:
Specifies the output units of Rescale Slope (0028,1053) and Rescale Intercept (0028,1052).
Required if Photometric Interpretation (0028,0004) is MONOCHROME2, and Bits Stored (0028,0101) is greater than 1.

table_lines.name: Nominal Scanned Pixel Spacing
table_lines.comment:
Required if Conversion Type (0008,0064) is DF (Digitized Film). May also be present if Conversion Type (0008,0064) is SD (Scanned Document) or SI (Scanned Image).
Shall be consistent with Pixel Aspect Ratio (0028,0034), if present.

table_lines.name: Rotation of Scanned Film
table_lines.comment: Angle of the edge of the film relative to the transport direction in degrees greater than or equal to -45 and less than or equal to +45.

table_lines.name: Frame Time Vector
table_lines.comment:
An array that contains the real time increments (in msec) between frames for a Multi-frame image.
See
Required if Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) points to Frame Time Vector (0018,1065).

table_lines.name: Page Number Vector
table_lines.comment:
An array that contains, for each of the image frames, the corresponding page numbers of the original document.
Required if Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) points to Page Number Vector (0018,2001).

table_lines.name: Frame Label Vector
table_lines.comment:
An array that contains, for each of the image frames, a descriptive label.
Required if Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) points to Frame Label Vector (0018,2002).

table_lines.name: Frame Primary Angle Vector
table_lines.comment:
An array that contains, for each of the image frames, the primary angle of rotation about an undefined axis, in degrees. May be used for annotative purposes for "cine loops" of 3D reprojected images
Required if Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) points to Frame Primary Angle Vector (0018,2003).

table_lines.name: Frame Secondary Angle Vector
table_lines.comment:
An array that contains, for each of the image frames, the secondary angle of rotation about an undefined axis that is orthogonal to that used for Frame Primary Angle Vector (0018,2003), in degrees. May be used for annotative purposes for "cine loops" of 3D reprojected images
Required if Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) points to Frame Secondary Angle Vector (0018,2004).

table_lines.name: Slice Location Vector
table_lines.comment: Required if Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) points to Slice Location Vector (0018,2005).

table_lines.name: Display Window Label Vector
table_lines.comment:
An array that contains, for each of the image frames, a label or number of the display window of a graphical user interface from which the frame was captured.
Required if Frame Increment Pointer (0028,0009) points to Display Window Label Vector (0018,2006).

table_lines.name: Frame Increment Pointer
table_lines.comment:
Required if Multi-frame Image.
Contains the Data Element Tag of the Attribute that is used as the Frame increment in Multi-frame image pixel data (see

table_lines.name: Lossy Image Compression
table_lines.comment:
Specifies whether an Image has undergone lossy compression (at a point in its lifetime).
Once this value has been set to "01" it shall not be reset.
See
Required if Lossy Compression has been performed on the Image. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Image Type
table_lines.comment:
Image identification characteristics.
See

table_lines.name: Pixel Intensity Relationship
table_lines.comment:
The relationship between the Pixel sample values and the X-Ray beam intensity.
See

table_lines.name: Samples per Pixel
table_lines.comment: Number of samples (color planes) in this image shall have a value of 1.

table_lines.name: Photometric Interpretation
table_lines.comment: Specifies the intended interpretation of the pixel data.

table_lines.name: Bits Allocated
table_lines.comment:
Number of bits allocated for each pixel sample.
See

table_lines.name: Bits Stored
table_lines.comment:
Number of bits stored for each pixel sample.
See

table_lines.name: High Bit
table_lines.comment:
Most significant bit for pixel sample data.
See

table_lines.name: Pixel Representation
table_lines.comment:
Data representation of the pixel samples.
Shall have the value:
0000H = Unsigned Integer.

table_lines.name: Scan Options
table_lines.comment:
Parameters of scanning sequence.
See

table_lines.usage: No CID for the Anatomic Region Sequence is defined.

table_lines.name: R Wave Pointer
table_lines.comment: Marks the location(s) of the R Wave in the cardiac cycles by referencing frame numbers; frame numbers begin with 1.

table_lines.name: Referenced Image Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Other images significantly related to this image. Shall be present if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 is BIPLANE A or BIPLANE B. May be present otherwise.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Describes the purpose for which the reference is made.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Derivation Description
table_lines.comment:
A text description of how this image was derived.
See

table_lines.name: Acquisition Device Processing Description
table_lines.comment:
Indicates any visual processing performed on the images prior to exchange.
See

table_lines.name: Frame Label Vector
table_lines.comment: A multi-valued Attribute that contains a descriptive label for each of the image frames. The number of values shall equal the number of frames.

table_lines.name: Frame Dimension Pointer
table_lines.comment: Shall not be present if it would contain only one value and that value would be Frame Time (0018,1063) or Frame Time Vector (0018,1065).

table_lines.name: Calibration Image
table_lines.comment:
Indicates whether a reference object (phantom) of known size is present in the image and was used for calibration.
Device is identified using the

table_lines.name: KVP
table_lines.comment: Peak kilo voltage output of the X-Ray generator used.

table_lines.name: Radiation Setting
table_lines.comment: Identify the general level of X-Ray dose exposure.

table_lines.name: X-Ray Tube Current
table_lines.comment: X-Ray Tube Current in mA. Required if Exposure (0018,1152) is not present. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: X-Ray Tube Current in uA
table_lines.comment: X-Ray Tube Current in uA.

table_lines.name: Exposure Time in uS
table_lines.comment: Duration of X-Ray exposure in usec.

table_lines.name: Exposure
table_lines.comment: The exposure expressed in mAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-Ray Tube Current. Required if either Exposure Time (0018,1150) or X-Ray Tube Current (0018,1151) are not present. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Exposure in uAs
table_lines.comment: The exposure expressed in uAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-Ray Tube Current.

table_lines.name: Grid
table_lines.comment: Identify the grid. Only a single value shall be present.

table_lines.name: Average Pulse Width
table_lines.comment: Average width of X-Ray pulse in msec.

table_lines.name: Radiation Mode
table_lines.comment: Specifies X-Ray radiation mode.

table_lines.name: Type of Filters
table_lines.comment: Type of filter(s) inserted into the X-Ray beam (e.g., wedges).

table_lines.name: Intensifier Size
table_lines.comment: Diameter of X-Ray intensifier in mm.

table_lines.name: Field of View Dimension(s)
table_lines.comment: Dimensions of the Image Intensifier Field of View in mm. If Rectangle, row dimension followed by column; if Round, diameter.

table_lines.name: Imager Pixel Spacing
table_lines.comment: The value of this Attribute shall never be adjusted to account for correction for the effect of geometric magnification or calibration against an object of known size; Pixel Spacing (0028,0030) is specified for that purpose.

table_lines.name: Focal Spot(s)
table_lines.comment: Nominal focal spot size in mm used to acquire this image.

table_lines.name: Image and Fluoroscopy Area Dose Product
table_lines.comment: X-Ray dose, measured in dGy*cm*cm, to which the patient was exposed for the acquisition of this image plus any non-digitally recorded fluoroscopy that may have been performed to prepare for the acquisition of this image.

table_lines.name: Collimator Shape
table_lines.comment:
Shape(s) of the collimator.
This multi-valued Attribute shall contain at most one of each Enumerated Value.

table_lines.name: Vertices of the Polygonal Collimator
table_lines.comment:
Required if a value of Collimator Shape (0018,1700) is POLYGONAL.
Multiple Values where the first set of two values are:
row of the origin vertex;
column of the origin vertex.
Two or more pairs of values follow and are the row and column coordinates of the other vertices of the polygon collimator. Polygon collimators are implicitly closed from the last vertex to the origin vertex and all edges shall be non-intersecting except at the vertices.

table_lines.name: Table Vertical Increment
table_lines.comment:
Incremental change in Vertical position of the table relative to first frame of Multi-frame image given in mm.
Required if Table Motion is DYNAMIC.

table_lines.name: Table Longitudinal Increment
table_lines.comment: Required if Table Motion is DYNAMIC.

table_lines.name: Table Lateral Increment
table_lines.comment: Required if Table Motion is DYNAMIC.

table_lines.name: Table Angle
table_lines.comment: Angle of table plane in degrees relative to horizontal plane [Gravity plane]. Positive values indicate that the head of the table is upwards.

table_lines.name: Distance Source to Patient
table_lines.comment: Distance in mm from source to center of field of view.

table_lines.name: Distance Source to Detector
table_lines.comment: Distance in mm from source to detector center.

table_lines.name: Estimated Radiographic Magnification Factor
table_lines.comment: Ratio of Source Image Receptor Distance (SID) over Source Object Distance (SOD).

table_lines.name: Positioner Motion
table_lines.comment:
Used to describe the activity of the imaging devices.
See
Required if Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) contains more than one frame. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Positioner Primary Angle
table_lines.comment:
Position of the X-Ray Image Intensifier about the patient from the RAO to LAO direction where movement from RAO to vertical is positive.
See

table_lines.name: Positioner Secondary Angle
table_lines.comment:
Position of the X-Ray Image Intensifier about the patient from the CAU to CRA direction where movement from CAU to vertical is positive.
See

table_lines.name: Positioner Primary Angle Increment
table_lines.comment:
Incremental change in primary positioner angle for each frame.
See
Required if Positioner Motion (0018,1500) equals DYNAMIC.

table_lines.name: Positioner Secondary Angle Increment
table_lines.comment:
Incremental change in secondary positioner angle for each frame.
See
Required if Positioner Motion (0018,1500) equals DYNAMIC.

table_lines.name: Detector Primary Angle
table_lines.comment:
Angle of the X-Ray beam in the row direction in degrees relative to the normal to the detector plane. Positive values indicate that the X-Ray beam is tilted towards higher numbered columns. Negative values indicate that the X-Ray beam is tilted towards lower numbered columns.
See

table_lines.name: Detector Secondary Angle
table_lines.comment:
Angle of the X-Ray beam in the column direction in degrees relative to the normal to the detector plane. Positive values indicate that the X-Ray beam is tilted towards lower numbered rows. Negative values indicate that the X-Ray beam is tilted towards higher numbered rows.
See

table_lines.name: Distance Source to Detector
table_lines.comment: Distance in mm from source to detector center.

table_lines.name: Distance Source to Patient
table_lines.comment: Distance in mm from source to center of field of view.

table_lines.name: Estimated Radiographic Magnification Factor
table_lines.comment: Ratio of SID (Source Image Receptor Distance) over SOD (Source Object Distance).

table_lines.name: Column Angulation
table_lines.comment: Angle of the X-Ray beam in degree relative to an orthogonal axis to the detector plane. Positive values indicate that the tilt is towards the head of the table.

table_lines.name: Tomo Layer Height
table_lines.comment: Distance in mm between the table surface and the sharp image plane.

table_lines.name: Tomo Angle
table_lines.comment: Angle span in degrees of rotation of X-Ray Source during X-Ray acquisition.

table_lines.name: Tomo Time
table_lines.comment: Time in seconds the source has taken to rotate the Tomo Angle during X-Ray acquisition.

table_lines.name: Tomo Type
table_lines.comment: Type of tomography.

table_lines.name: Tomo Class
table_lines.comment: Form of tomography:

table_lines.name: Number of Tomosynthesis Source Images
table_lines.comment: sect_C.7.6.1

table_lines.name: KVP
table_lines.comment: Peak kilo voltage output of the X-Ray generator used.

table_lines.name: X-Ray Tube Current
table_lines.comment: X-Ray Tube Current in mA.

table_lines.name: X-Ray Tube Current in uA
table_lines.comment: X-Ray Tube Current in uA.

table_lines.name: Exposure Time
table_lines.comment: Duration of X-Ray exposure in msec.

table_lines.name: Exposure Time in uS
table_lines.comment: Duration of X-Ray exposure in usec.

table_lines.name: Exposure
table_lines.comment: The exposure expressed in mAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-Ray Tube Current.

table_lines.name: Exposure in uAs
table_lines.comment: The exposure expressed in uAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-Ray Tube Current.

table_lines.name: Distance Source to Detector
table_lines.comment: Distance in mm from source to detector center.

table_lines.name: Distance Source to Patient
table_lines.comment: Distance in mm from source to the table, support or bucky side that is closest to the Imaging Subject, as measured along the central ray of the X-Ray beam.

table_lines.name: Image and Fluoroscopy Area Dose Product
table_lines.comment: X-Ray dose, measured in dGy*cm*cm, to which the patient was exposed for the acquisition of this image plus any non-digitally recorded fluoroscopy that may have been performed to prepare for the acquisition of this image.

table_lines.name: Body Part Thickness
table_lines.comment: The average thickness in mm of the body part examined when compressed, if compression has been applied during exposure.

table_lines.name: Relative X-Ray Exposure
table_lines.comment: Indication of the applied dose, in manufacturer specific units.

table_lines.name: Entrance Dose
table_lines.comment: Average entrance dose value measured in dGy at the surface of the patient during the acquisition of this image.

table_lines.name: Entrance Dose in mGy
table_lines.comment: Average entrance dose value measured in mGy at the surface of the patient during the acquisition of this image.

table_lines.name: Entrance Dose Derivation
table_lines.comment:
Describes what type of dose is represented by the values of Entrance Dose (0040,0302) and Entrance Dose in mGy (0040,8302).
Only meaningful if Entrance Dose (0040,0302) or Entrance Dose in mGy (0040,8302) is present.

table_lines.name: Exposed Area
table_lines.comment: Typical dimension of the exposed area at the detector plane. If Rectangular: row dimension followed by column; if Round: diameter. Measured in cm.

table_lines.name: Distance Source to Entrance
table_lines.comment: Distance in mm from the source to the surface of the patient closest to the source during the acquisition of this image.

table_lines.name: Comments on Radiation Dose
table_lines.comment: User-defined comments on any special conditions related to radiation dose encountered during the acquisition of this image.

table_lines.name: X-Ray Output
table_lines.comment: The X-Ray output at the patient entrance surface and kVp used to acquire the image, measured in mGy/mAs.

table_lines.name: Half Value Layer
table_lines.comment: The thickness of Aluminum in mm required to reduce the X-Ray Output (0040,0312) by a factor of two.

table_lines.name: Organ Dose
table_lines.comment: Average organ dose value measured in dGy during the acquisition of this image.

table_lines.name: Organ Exposed
table_lines.comment: Organ to which Organ Dose (0040,0316) applies.

table_lines.name: Anode Target Material
table_lines.comment: The primary material in the anode of the X-Ray source.

table_lines.name: Rectification Type
table_lines.comment: Type of rectification used in the X-Ray generator.

table_lines.name: KVP
table_lines.comment: Peak kilo voltage output of the X-Ray generator used.

table_lines.name: X-Ray Tube Current
table_lines.comment: X-Ray Tube Current in mA.

table_lines.name: X-Ray Tube Current in uA
table_lines.comment: X-Ray Tube Current in uA.

table_lines.name: Exposure Time
table_lines.comment: Duration of X-Ray exposure in msec.

table_lines.name: Exposure Time in uS
table_lines.comment: Duration of X-Ray exposure in usec.

table_lines.name: Exposure
table_lines.comment: The exposure expressed in mAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-Ray Tube Current.

table_lines.name: Exposure in uAs
table_lines.comment: The exposure expressed in uAs, for example calculated from Exposure Time and X-Ray Tube Current.

table_lines.name: Exposure Control Mode
table_lines.comment: Type of exposure control.

table_lines.name: Exposure Control Mode Description
table_lines.comment:
Text description of the mechanism of exposure control.
May describe the number and type of exposure sensors or position of the sensitive area of the imaging detector.

table_lines.name: Exposure Status
table_lines.comment: Whether the exposure was normally completed or not.

table_lines.name: Phototimer Setting
table_lines.comment: Nominal percentage phototimer setting, where a more positive value indicates greater exposure and a more negative value indicates less exposure.

table_lines.name: Focal Spot(s)
table_lines.comment: Nominal focal spot size in mm used to acquire this image.

table_lines.name: Anode Target Material
table_lines.comment: The primary material in the anode of the X-Ray source.

table_lines.name: Rectification Type
table_lines.comment: Type of rectification used in the X-Ray generator.

table_lines.name: Generator ID
table_lines.comment: Identifier of the generator.

table_lines.name: Filter Type
table_lines.comment: Type of filter(s) inserted into the X-Ray beam (e.g., wedges).

table_lines.name: Filter Material
table_lines.comment: The X-Ray absorbing material used in the filter. May be multi-valued.

table_lines.name: Filter Thickness Minimum
table_lines.comment: The minimum thickness in mm of the X-Ray absorbing material used in the filters. May be multi-valued, with values corresponding to the respective values in Filter Material (0018,7050).

table_lines.name: Filter Thickness Maximum
table_lines.comment: The maximum thickness in mm of the X-Ray absorbing material used in the filters. May be multi-valued, with values corresponding to the respective values in Filter Material (0018,7050).

table_lines.name: Filter Beam Path Length Minimum
table_lines.comment: The minimum length (in mm) of the X-Ray beam path in the Filter Material that is not blocked by collimation. May be multi-valued, with values corresponding to the respective values in Filter Material (0018,7050).

table_lines.name: Filter Beam Path Length Maximum
table_lines.comment: The maximum length (in mm) of the X-Ray beam path in the Filter Material that is not blocked by collimation. May be multi-valued, with values corresponding to the respective values in Filter Material (0018,7050).

table_lines.name: Grid
table_lines.comment: Identifies the grid. May be multi-valued.

table_lines.name: Grid Absorbing Material
table_lines.comment: The X-Ray absorbing material used in the grid.

table_lines.name: Grid Spacing Material
table_lines.comment: The spacing material used in the grid.

table_lines.name: Grid Thickness
table_lines.comment: The thickness in mm of the X-Ray absorbing material used in the grid.

table_lines.name: Grid Pitch
table_lines.comment: The pitch in mm of the X-Ray absorbing material used in the grid.

table_lines.name: Grid Aspect Ratio
table_lines.comment: Ratio of the vertical spacing and horizontal spacing of the X-Ray absorbing material used in the grid. Specified by a pair of integer values where the first value is the vertical size, and the second value is the horizontal size.

table_lines.name: Grid Period
table_lines.comment:
Period in mSec of reciprocation cycle.
Only meaningful if a value of Grid (0018,1166) is RECIPROCATING.

table_lines.name: Grid Focal Distance
table_lines.comment: Focal distance in mm of a FOCUSED grid.

table_lines.name: Grid ID
table_lines.comment: Identifier of the grid.

table_lines.name: Modality
table_lines.comment:
Type of device, process or method that originally acquired the data used to create the Instances in this Series.
See

table_lines.name: Series Instance UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identifier of the Series.

table_lines.name: Series Number
table_lines.comment: A number that identifies this Series.

table_lines.name: Series Date
table_lines.comment: Date the Series started.

table_lines.name: Series Time
table_lines.comment: Time the Series started.

table_lines.name: Series Description
table_lines.comment: Description of the Series.

table_lines.name: Series Description Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A coded description of the Series.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Operators' Name
table_lines.comment: Name(s) of the operator(s) supporting the Series.

table_lines.name: Operator Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment: Identification of the operator(s) supporting the Series. One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Operators' Name (0008,1070), if present.

table_lines.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Uniquely identifies the Performed Procedure Step SOP Instance to which the Series is related.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Request Attributes Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence that contains Attributes from the Imaging Service Request.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Treatment Session UID
table_lines.comment: A unique identifier of the RT Treatment Session to which Instances in this Series belong.

table_lines.name: Pixel Intensity Relationship
table_lines.comment:
The relationship between the Pixel sample values and the X-Ray beam intensity.
See

table_lines.name: Pixel Intensity Relationship Sign
table_lines.comment:
The sign of the relationship between the Pixel sample values stored in Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) and the X-Ray beam intensity.
Required if Pixel Intensity Relationship (0028,1040) is present.
See

table_lines.name: RT Image Label
table_lines.comment: User-defined label for RT Image.

table_lines.name: RT Image Name
table_lines.comment: User-defined name for RT Image.

table_lines.name: RT Image Description
table_lines.comment: User-defined description of RT Image.

table_lines.name: Conversion Type
table_lines.comment: Describes the kind of image conversion.

table_lines.name: Reported Values Origin
table_lines.comment: Describes the origin of the parameter values reported in the image. Required if Value 3 of Image Type (0008,0008) is SIMULATOR or PORTAL.

table_lines.name: RT Image Plane
table_lines.comment: Describes whether or not image plane is normal to beam axis.

table_lines.name: RT Image Orientation
table_lines.comment: The direction cosines of the first row and the first column with respect to the IEC X-RAY IMAGE RECEPTOR coordinate system. Required if RT Image Plane (3002,000C) is NON_NORMAL. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: Radiation Machine Name
table_lines.comment: User-defined name identifying radiation machine used in acquiring or computing image (i.e., name of conventional simulator, electron accelerator, X-Ray device, or machine modeled when calculating DRR).

table_lines.name: Primary Dosimeter Unit
table_lines.comment: Measurement unit of machine dosimeter.

table_lines.name: Radiation Machine SAD
table_lines.comment: Radiation source to Gantry rotation axis distance of radiation machine used in acquiring or computing image (mm).

table_lines.name: Radiation Machine SSD
table_lines.comment: Source to Patient surface distance (in mm) of radiation machine used in acquiring or computing image.

table_lines.name: Enhanced RT Beam Limiting Device Definition Flag
table_lines.comment: Whether the RT Beam Limiting Devices are specified by the Enhanced RT Beam Limiting Device Sequence (3008,00A1).

table_lines.name: Enhanced RT Beam Limiting Device Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Enhanced RT Beam Limiting Device Descriptions.
Required if Enhanced RT Beam Limiting Device Definition Flag (3008,00A3) is present and has the value YES.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.usage:
Device Type Code Sequence (3010,002E) within

See

table_lines.name: Source to Reference Object Distance
table_lines.comment: Source to reference object distance (in mm), as used for magnification calculation of RADIOGRAPH and SIMULATOR images.

table_lines.name: Referenced RT Plan Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of one Class/Instance pair describing RT Plan associated with image.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Referenced Fraction Group Number
table_lines.comment: Identifier of Fraction Group within RT Plan referenced in Referenced RT Plan Sequence (300C,0002).

table_lines.name: Fraction Number
table_lines.comment: Fraction Number of fraction during which image was acquired, within Fraction Group referenced by Referenced Fraction Group Number (300C,0022) within RT Plan referenced in Referenced RT Plan Sequence (300C,0002).

table_lines.name: Start Cumulative Meterset Weight
table_lines.comment: Cumulative Meterset Weight within Beam referenced by Referenced Beam Number (300C,0006) at which image acquisition starts.

table_lines.name: End Cumulative Meterset Weight
table_lines.comment: Cumulative Meterset Weight within Beam referenced by Referenced Beam Number (300C,0006) at which image acquisition ends.

table_lines.name: Exposure Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Exposure parameter sets, corresponding to exposures used in generating the image.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence. See

table_lines.name: >Referenced Frame Number
table_lines.comment: Identifies corresponding image frame in multi-frame image. Required if there is more than one Item in Exposure Sequence (3002,0030), and image is a multi-frame image.

table_lines.name: >KVP
table_lines.comment: Peak kilo voltage output (kV) of X-Ray generator used to acquire image. Required if Value 3 of Image Type (0008,0008) is PORTAL, SIMULATOR or RADIOGRAPH.

table_lines.name: >Primary Fluence Mode Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence defining whether the primary fluence of the treatment beam uses a non-standard fluence-shaping.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Fluence Mode
table_lines.comment: Describes whether the fluence shaping is the standard mode for the beam or an alternate.

table_lines.name: >>Fluence Mode ID
table_lines.comment:
Identifier for the specific fluence-shaping mode.
Required if Fluence Mode (3002,0051) has value NON_STANDARD.

table_lines.name: >X-Ray Tube Current
table_lines.comment: Imaging device X-Ray Tube Current (mA). Required if Value 3 of Image Type (0008,0008) is SIMULATOR or RADIOGRAPH. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >X-Ray Tube Current in mA
table_lines.comment: X-Ray Tube Current in mA. An average in the case of fluoroscopy (continuous radiation mode).

table_lines.name: >Exposure Time
table_lines.comment:
Time of X-Ray exposure (msec). Required if Value 3 of Image Type (0008,0008) is SIMULATOR or RADIOGRAPH. May be present otherwise.
See

table_lines.name: >Exposure Time in ms
table_lines.comment:
Duration of X-Ray exposure in msec.
See

table_lines.name: >Meterset Exposure
table_lines.comment:
Treatment machine Meterset duration over which image has been acquired, specified in Monitor units (MU) or minutes as defined by Primary Dosimeter Unit (300A,00B3). Required if Value 3 of Image Type (0008,0008) is PORTAL.
See

table_lines.name: >Diaphragm Position
table_lines.comment: Positions of diaphragm jaw pairs (in mm) in IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate axis in the IEC order X1, X2, Y1, Y2.

table_lines.name: >Beam Limiting Device Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of beam limiting device (collimator) jaw or leaf (element) positions for given exposure.
Shall not be present if Enhanced RT Beam Limiting Device Definition Flag (3008,00A3) is present and has the value YES.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>RT Beam Limiting Device Type
table_lines.comment: Type of beam limiting device (collimator).

table_lines.name: >>Source to Beam Limiting Device Distance
table_lines.comment: Radiation source to beam limiting device (collimator) distance (mm).

table_lines.name: >>Number of Leaf/Jaw Pairs
table_lines.comment: Number of leaf (element) or jaw pairs (equal to 1 for standard beam limiting device jaws).

table_lines.name: >>Leaf Position Boundaries
table_lines.comment: Boundaries (in mm) of beam limiting device (collimator) leaves (elements) in IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate axis appropriate to RT Beam Limiting Device Type (300A,00B8), i.e., X-axis for MLCY, Y-axis for MLCX. Contains N+1 values, where N is the Number of Leaf/Jaw Pairs (300A,00BC), starting from Leaf (Element) Pair 1. Required if RT Beam Limiting Device Type (300A,00B8) is MLCX or MLCY. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >>Leaf/Jaw Positions
table_lines.comment:
Positions of beam limiting device (collimator) leaf or jaw (element) pairs (in mm) in IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate axis appropriate to RT Beam Limiting Device Type (300A,00B8), e.g., X-axis for MLCX, Y-axis for MLCY). Contains 2N values, where N is the Number of Leaf/Jaw Pairs (300A,00BC), in IEC leaf (element) subscript order 101, 102, … 1N, 201, 202, … 2N.
Required if Enhanced RT Beam Limiting Device Definition Flag (3008,00A3) is absent, or is present and has the value NO.

table_lines.name: >Enhanced RT Beam Limiting Opening Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of beam limiting device (collimator) jaw or leaf (element) positions.
Required if Enhanced RT Beam Limiting Device Definition Flag (3008,00A3) is present and has the value YES.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Gantry Angle
table_lines.comment: Treatment machine gantry angle, i.e., orientation of IEC GANTRY coordinate system with respect to IEC FIXED REFERENCE coordinate system (degrees).

table_lines.name: >Beam Limiting Device Angle
table_lines.comment: Treatment machine beam limiting device (collimator) angle, i.e., orientation of IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate system with respect to IEC GANTRY coordinate system (degrees).

table_lines.name: >Patient Support Angle
table_lines.comment: Patient Support angle, i.e., orientation of IEC PATIENT SUPPORT coordinate system with respect to IEC FIXED REFERENCE coordinate system (degrees).

table_lines.name: >Table Top Vertical Position
table_lines.comment: Table Top Vertical position in IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system (mm).

table_lines.name: >Table Top Longitudinal Position
table_lines.comment: Table Top Longitudinal position in IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system (mm).

table_lines.name: >Table Top Lateral Position
table_lines.comment: Table Top Lateral position in IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system (mm).

table_lines.name: >Applicator Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Applicators associated with Beam.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Applicator ID
table_lines.comment: User or machine supplied identifier for Applicator.

table_lines.name: >>Accessory Code
table_lines.comment: An identifier for the accessory intended to be read by a device such as a bar-code reader.

table_lines.name: >>Applicator Type
table_lines.comment: Type of Applicator.

table_lines.name: >>Applicator Geometry Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Describes the applicator aperture geometry.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>>Applicator Aperture Shape
table_lines.comment: Aperture shape of the applicator.

table_lines.name: >>>Applicator Opening
table_lines.comment:
Opening (in mm) of the applicator's aperture in IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate system. In case of square-shaped applicator contains the length of the sides of the square. In case of circular-shaped applicators, contains the diameter of the circular aperture.
Required if Applicator Aperture Shape (300A,0432) is SYM_SQUARE or SYM_CIRCULAR.

table_lines.name: >>>Applicator Opening X
table_lines.comment:
Opening (in mm) of the applicator's aperture in IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate system in X-Direction.
Required if Applicator Aperture Shape (300A,0432) is SYM_RECTANGLE.

table_lines.name: >>>Applicator Opening Y
table_lines.comment:
Opening (in mm) of the applicator's aperture in IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate system in Y-Direction.
Required if Applicator Aperture Shape (300A,0432) is SYM_RECTANGLE.

table_lines.name: >> Source to Applicator Mounting Position Distance
table_lines.comment: Radiation source to applicator mounting position distance (in mm) for current applicator.

table_lines.name: >>Applicator Description
table_lines.comment: User-defined description for Applicator.

table_lines.name: >General Accessory Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of General Accessories associated with the beam producing this image.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>General Accessory Number
table_lines.comment: Identification Number of the General Accessory. The value shall be unique within the Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>General Accessory ID
table_lines.comment: User or machine supplied identifier for General Accessory.

table_lines.name: >>General Accessory Description
table_lines.comment: User supplied description of General Accessory.

table_lines.name: >>General Accessory Type
table_lines.comment: Specifies the type of accessory.

table_lines.name: >>Accessory Code
table_lines.comment: Machine-readable identifier for this accessory.

table_lines.name: >>Source to General Accessory Distance
table_lines.comment: Radiation source to general accessory distance (in mm) for current accessory.

table_lines.name: >Number of Blocks
table_lines.comment: Number of shielding blocks associated with Beam.

table_lines.name: >Block Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of blocks associated with Beam. Required if Number of Blocks (300A,00F0) is non-zero.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Block Tray ID
table_lines.comment: User-supplied identifier for block tray.

table_lines.name: >>Tray Accessory Code
table_lines.comment: An identifier for the Tray intended to be read by a device such as a bar-code reader.

table_lines.name: >>Accessory Code
table_lines.comment: An identifier for the Block intended to be read by a device such as a bar-code reader.

table_lines.name: >>Source to Block Tray Distance
table_lines.comment: Radiation Source to attachment edge of block tray assembly (mm).

table_lines.name: >>Block Type
table_lines.comment: Type of block.

table_lines.name: >>Block Divergence
table_lines.comment: Indicates presence or otherwise of geometrical divergence

table_lines.name: >>Block Mounting Position
table_lines.comment: Indicates on which side of the Block Tray the block is mounted.

table_lines.name: >>Block Number
table_lines.comment: Identification Number of the Block. The value of Block Number (300A,00FC) shall be unique within the Beam in which it is created.

table_lines.name: >>Block Name
table_lines.comment: User-defined name for block.

table_lines.name: >>Material ID
table_lines.comment: User-supplied identifier for material used to manufacture Block.

table_lines.name: >>Block Thickness
table_lines.comment: Physical thickness of block (in mm) parallel to radiation beam axis.

table_lines.name: >>Block Number of Points
table_lines.comment: Number of (x,y) pairs defining the block edge.

table_lines.name: >>Block Data
table_lines.comment: A data stream of (x,y) pairs that comprise the block edge. The number of pairs shall be equal to Block Number of Points (300A,0104), and the vertices shall be interpreted as a closed polygon. Coordinates are projected onto the machine isocentric plane in the IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate system (mm).

table_lines.name: Fluence Map Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A Sequence of data describing the fluence map Attributes for a radiotherapy beam.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if the third value of Image Type (0008,0008) is FLUENCE.

table_lines.name: >Fluence Data Source
table_lines.comment: Source of fluence data.

table_lines.name: >Fluence Data Scale
table_lines.comment: The Meterset corresponding with a fluence map cell value of 1.0 expressed in units specified by Primary Dosimeter Units (300A,00B3). This is the Meterset value used for treatment, not the Meterset used to expose the film as defined by Meterset Exposure (3002,0032).

table_lines.name: Gantry Angle
table_lines.comment: Treatment machine gantry angle, i.e., orientation of IEC GANTRY coordinate system with respect to IEC FIXED REFERENCE coordinate system (degrees).

table_lines.name: Beam Limiting Device Angle
table_lines.comment: Treatment machine beam limiting device (collimator) angle, i.e., orientation of IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate system with respect to IEC GANTRY coordinate system (degrees).

table_lines.name: Patient Support Angle
table_lines.comment: Patient Support angle, i.e., orientation of IEC PATIENT SUPPORT coordinate system with respect to IEC FIXED REFERENCE coordinate system (degrees).

table_lines.name: Table Top Eccentric Axis Distance
table_lines.comment: Distance (positive) from the IEC PATIENT SUPPORT vertical axis to the IEC TABLE TOP ECCENTRIC vertical axis (mm).

table_lines.name: Table Top Eccentric Angle
table_lines.comment: Table Top (non-isocentric) angle, i.e., orientation of IEC TABLE TOP ECCENTRIC coordinate system with respect to IEC PATIENT SUPPORT system (degrees).

table_lines.name: Table Top Vertical Position
table_lines.comment: Table Top Vertical position in IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system (mm).

table_lines.name: Table Top Longitudinal Position
table_lines.comment: Table Top Longitudinal position in IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system (mm).

table_lines.name: Table Top Lateral Position
table_lines.comment: Table Top Lateral position in IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system (mm).

table_lines.name: Isocenter Position
table_lines.comment: Isocenter coordinates (x,y,z), in mm. Specifies the location of the machine isocenter in the Patient-Based Coordinate System associated with the Frame of Reference. It allows transformation from the equipment-based IEC coordinate system to the Patient-Based Coordinate System.

table_lines.name: Patient Position
table_lines.comment:
Patient position descriptor relative to the patient support device.
Required if Isocenter Position (300A,012C) is present. May be present otherwise.
See

table_lines.name: Exposure Time
table_lines.comment:
Time of X-Ray exposure (msec). Required if Value 3 of Image Type (0008,0008) is SIMULATOR or RADIOGRAPH. May be present otherwise.
See

table_lines.name: Exposure Time in ms
table_lines.comment:
Duration of X-Ray exposure in msec.
See

table_lines.name: Meterset Exposure
table_lines.comment:
Treatment machine Meterset duration over which image has been acquired, specified in Monitor units (MU) or minutes as defined by Primary Dosimeter Unit (300A,00B3).
See

table_lines.name: Content Date
table_lines.comment: The date the content of this Module was created.

table_lines.name: Content Time
table_lines.comment: The time the content of this Module was created.

table_lines.name: Dose Units
table_lines.comment: Units used to describe dose.

table_lines.name: Dose Type
table_lines.comment: Type of dose.

table_lines.name: Spatial Transform of Dose
table_lines.comment: The use of transformation in the calculation of the combined dose.

table_lines.name: Referenced Spatial Registration Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A reference to a Spatial Registration SOP Instance or a Deformable Spatial Registration SOP Instance, which defines the transformation used to transform the dose.
Required, if Spatial Transform of Dose (3004,0005) is provided and has a value of RIGID or NON_RIGID.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: Instance Number
table_lines.comment: A number that identifies this object Instance.

table_lines.name: Entity Long Label
table_lines.comment:
User-defined label for dose data.
See

table_lines.name: Dose Comment
table_lines.comment: User-defined comments for dose data.

table_lines.name: Dose Summation Type
table_lines.comment: Type of dose summation.

table_lines.name: Referenced RT Plan Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence describing RT Plan associated with dose.
Required if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is PLAN, MULTI_PLAN, FRACTION, BEAM, BRACHY, FRACTION_SESSION, BEAM_SESSION, BRACHY_SESSION or CONTROL_POINT.
May be present if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is PLAN_OVERVIEW.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence, unless Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is MULTI_PLAN, in which case two or more Items shall be included in this Sequence. See Note

table_lines.name: >Referenced Plan Overview Index
table_lines.comment:
The value of Plan Overview Index (300C,0117) from the Plan Overview Sequence (300C,0116) to which this RT Plan corresponds. Shall be unique, i.e., not be duplicated within another Item of this Referenced RT Plan Sequence (300C,0002).
Required if Plan Overview Sequence (300C,0116) is present.

table_lines.name: >Referenced Fraction Group Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of one Fraction Group containing beams or brachy application setups contributing to dose.
Required if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is FRACTION, BEAM, BRACHY, FRACTION_SESSION, BEAM_SESSION, BRACHY_SESSION or CONTROL_POINT.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence. See Note

table_lines.name: >>Referenced Beam Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Beams in current Fraction Group contributing to dose. Required if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is BEAM, BEAM_SESSION or CONTROL_POINT.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>>Referenced Control Point Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence defining the Control Points in current Beam contributing to dose.
Required if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is CONTROL_POINT.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>>>Referenced Start Control Point Index
table_lines.comment: Identifies Control Point specified by Control Point Index (300A,0112) within Beam referenced by Referenced Beam Number (300C,0006). This is the first of the two Control Points from which the Dose contribution to the Control Point can be calculated.

table_lines.name: >>>>Referenced Stop Control Point Index
table_lines.comment:
Identifies Control Point specified by Control Point Index (300A,0112) within Beam referenced by Referenced Beam Number (300C,0006). This is the second of the two Control Points from which the Dose contribution to the Control Point can be calculated.
The Control Point Index (300A,0112) referenced by Referenced
Stop Control Point Index (300C,00F6) shall be the Control Point Index (300A,0112) immediately following the Control Point Index (300A,0112) referenced by Referenced Start Control Point Index (300C,00F4) within the Referenced Beam Number (300C,0006).

table_lines.name: >>Referenced Brachy Application Setup Sequence
table_lines.comment: Sequence of Brachy Application Setups in current Fraction Group contributing to dose. Required if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is BRACHY or BRACHY_SESSION. One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Referenced Treatment Record Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence describing RT Beams Treatment Record associated with dose.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is RECORD.

table_lines.name: >Referenced Beam Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Beams contributing to dose.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.
Required, if the dose does not apply to the complete RT Beams Treatment Record referenced in the Referenced Treatment Record Sequence (3008,0030).

table_lines.name: Dose Grid Scaling
table_lines.comment: Required if Pixel Data (7FE0,0010) is present.

table_lines.name: Tissue Heterogeneity Correction
table_lines.comment: Specifies a list of patient heterogeneity characteristics used for calculating dose. This Attribute shall be multi-valued if beams used to compute the dose have differing correction techniques.

table_lines.name: Derivation Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A coded description of how this dose was derived from other RT Dose and/or RT Plan objects.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence. More than one Item indicates that successive derivation steps have been applied.

table_lines.name: Referenced Instance Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The set of SOP Instances used to derive this RT Dose SOP Instance.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Code describing the purpose of the reference to the Instance(s).
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Plan Overview Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Parameters providing an overview of the plan used to create this RT Dose Instance.
Required if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is PLAN_OVERVIEW. May be present if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is PLAN, MULTI_PLAN or RECORD.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is PLAN_OVERVIEW.
Only one Item shall be included in this Sequence if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is PLAN or RECORD.
Two or more Items shall be included in this Sequence if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is MULTI_PLAN.

table_lines.name: >Plan Overview Index
table_lines.comment:
The index of the Plan Overview within this Sequence.
The value shall start at 1 and increase monotonically by 1.

table_lines.name: >RT Plan Label
table_lines.comment: User-defined label of treatment plan.

table_lines.name: >Number of Fractions Included
table_lines.comment:
Number of fractions of the plan included in this RT Dose Instance.
Required if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is PLAN_OVERVIEW, PLAN or MULTI_PLAN.
If Dose Summation Type is PLAN or MULTI_PLAN the Number of Fractions Included (300C,0119) shall equal the Number of Fractions Planned (300A,0078) of the referenced RT Plan Instance.

table_lines.name: >Current Fraction Number
table_lines.comment:
Fraction Number of the fraction included in this RT Dose Instance.
Required if Dose Summation Type (3004,000A) is RECORD.

table_lines.name: >Treatment Site
table_lines.comment: A free-text label describing the anatomical treatment site.

table_lines.name: >Treatment Site Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Coded description of the treatment site.
Zero or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Treatment Site Modifier Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Coded description of the laterality of the treatment site.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequencee.

table_lines.name: >Prescription Overview Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Prescription parameters for evaluation of the dose matrix.
Zero or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Entity Long Label
table_lines.comment:
Label identifying the Prescription Overview.
For example, this may be the name of the related target ROI or the description of a Dose Reference.
Required if Prescription Overview Sequence (300C,0114) has more than one Item. May be present otherwise.

table_lines.name: >>Total Prescription Dose
table_lines.comment: Prescribed total dose in Gy for all fractions for the dose type defined in Dose Type (3004,0004).

table_lines.name: >>Referenced ROI Number
table_lines.comment: ROI for which the prescription parameters in this Sequence apply, specified by ROI Number (3006,0022) in the Instance referenced by Referenced Structure Set Sequence (300C,0060).

table_lines.name: >Referenced Structure Set Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Structure Set containing structures that were used to calculate the RT Dose.
Required if Referenced Image Sequence (0008,1140) is not present.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Referenced Image Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Images used to calculate the RT Dose.
Required if Referenced Structure Set Sequence (300C,0060) is not present.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Referenced Structure Set Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of one Class/Instance pair describing Structure Set containing structures that are used to calculate Dose-Volume Histograms (DVHs).
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence. See

table_lines.name: DVH Normalization Dose Value
table_lines.comment: Dose Value at DVH Normalization Point (3004,0040) used as reference for individual DVHs when Dose Units (3004,0002) is RELATIVE.

table_lines.name: DVH Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of DVHs.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >DVH Referenced ROI Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of referenced ROIs used to calculate DVH.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Referenced ROI Number
table_lines.comment: sect_C.8.8.5sect_C.8.8.3

table_lines.name: >DVH Type
table_lines.comment: Type of DVH.

table_lines.name: >Dose Units
table_lines.comment: Dose axis units.

table_lines.name: >Dose Type
table_lines.comment: Type of dose.

table_lines.name: >DVH Dose Scaling
table_lines.comment: Scaling factor that when multiplied by the dose bin widths found in DVH Data (3004,0058), yields dose bin widths in the dose units as specified by Dose Units (3004,0002).

table_lines.name: >DVH Volume Units
table_lines.comment: Volume axis units.

table_lines.name: >DVH Number of Bins
table_lines.comment: Number of bins n used to store DVH Data (3004,0058).

table_lines.name: >DVH Data
table_lines.comment: A data stream describing the dose bin widths Dn and associated volumes Vn in DVH Volume Units (3004,0054) in the order D1V1, D2V2, … DnVn.

table_lines.name: >DVH Minimum Dose
table_lines.comment: Minimum calculated dose to ROI(s) described by DVH Referenced ROI Sequence (3004,0060) in units specified by Dose Units (3004,0002) of the current Sequence Item.

table_lines.name: >DVH Maximum Dose
table_lines.comment: Maximum calculated dose to ROI(s) described by DVH Referenced ROI Sequence (3004,0060) in units specified by Dose Units (3004,0002) of the current Sequence Item.

table_lines.name: >DVH Mean Dose
table_lines.comment: Mean calculated dose to ROI(s) described by DVH Referenced ROI Sequence (3004,0060) in units specified by Dose Units (3004,0002) of the current Sequence Item.

table_lines.name: Structure Set Label
table_lines.comment: User-defined label for Structure Set.

table_lines.name: Structure Set Name
table_lines.comment: User-defined name for Structure Set.

table_lines.name: Structure Set Description
table_lines.comment: User-defined description for Structure Set.

table_lines.name: Instance Number
table_lines.comment: A number that identifies this object Instance.

table_lines.name: Structure Set Date
table_lines.comment: Date at which Structure Set was last modified.

table_lines.name: Structure Set Time
table_lines.comment: Time at which Structure Set was last modified.

table_lines.name: >Frame of Reference UID
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies Frame of Reference within Structure Set.

table_lines.name: >RT Referenced Study Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Studies containing Series to be referenced.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >>RT Referenced Series Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence describing Series of images within the referenced Study that are used in defining the Structure Set.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>>Series Instance UID
table_lines.comment: Unique identifier for the Series containing the images.

table_lines.name: >>>Contour Image Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Items describing images in a given Series used in defining the Structure Set (typically CT or MR images).
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: Structure Set ROI Sequence
table_lines.comment:
ROIs for current Structure Set.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >ROI Number
table_lines.comment: Identification number of the ROI. The value of ROI Number (3006,0022) shall be unique within the Structure Set in which it is created.

table_lines.name: >Conceptual Volume Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Identifies the Conceptual Volume which is represented by this ROI.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Referenced Frame of Reference UID
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies Frame of Reference in which ROI is defined, specified by Frame of Reference UID (0020,0052) in Referenced Frame of Reference Sequence (3006,0010).

table_lines.name: >ROI Name
table_lines.comment: User-defined name for ROI.

table_lines.name: >ROI Description
table_lines.comment: User-defined description for ROI.

table_lines.name: >ROI Volume
table_lines.comment: Volume of ROI (cubic centimeters).

table_lines.name: >ROI Generation Algorithm
table_lines.comment: Type of algorithm used to generate ROI.

table_lines.name: >ROI Generation Description
table_lines.comment: User-defined description of technique used to generate ROI.

table_lines.name: >ROI Derivation Algorithm Identification Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Software algorithm that derived the ROI.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Derivation Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
A coded description of how this ROI was derived.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >Definition Source Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Instances containing the source of the ROI Contour information.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Referenced Segment Number
table_lines.comment:
The value of Segment Number (0062,0004) in the referenced SOP Instance that identifies the segment that is the source of the ROI Contour information.
Required if Referenced SOP Class UID (0008,1150) is Segmentation Storage ("1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.66.4").

table_lines.name: >>Referenced Fiducial UID
table_lines.comment:
The value of Fiducials UID (0070,031A) in the referenced SOP Instance that identifies the fiducial that is the source of the ROI Contour information.
Required if Referenced SOP Class UID (0008,1150) is Spatial Fiducials Storage ("1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.66.2").

table_lines.name: Predecessor Structure Set Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The Structure Set that has been used to derive the current Structure Set.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: ROI Contour Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Contour Sequences defining ROIs.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Referenced ROI Number
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies the referenced ROI described in the Structure Set ROI Sequence (3006,0020).

table_lines.name: >ROI Display Color
table_lines.comment: RGB triplet color representation for ROI, specified using the range 0-255.

table_lines.name: >Recommended Display Grayscale Value
table_lines.comment: A default single gray unsigned value in which it is recommended that the contour be rendered on a monochrome display. The units are specified in P-Values from a minimum of 0000H (black) up to a maximum of FFFFH (white).

table_lines.name: >Source Pixel Planes Characteristics Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The characteristics of the pixel planes from which the grid-based representation of the Contours was derived.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >>Spacing Between Slices
table_lines.comment: Spacing between adjacent slices, in mm. The spacing is measured from the center-to-center of each slice, and shall not be negative.

table_lines.name: >>Number of Frames
table_lines.comment: Number of source pixel planes.

table_lines.name: >>Rows
table_lines.comment: Number of rows in the source pixel planes.

table_lines.name: >>Columns
table_lines.comment: Number of columns in the source pixel planes.

table_lines.name: >Contour Sequence
table_lines.comment: Sequence of Contours defining ROI. One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Contour Number
table_lines.comment: Identification number of the contour. The value of Contour Number (3006,0048) shall be unique within the Contour Sequence (3006,0040) in which it is defined. No semantics or ordering shall be inferred from this Attribute.

table_lines.name: >>Contour Image Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of images containing the contour.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
See

table_lines.name: >>Number of Contour Points
table_lines.comment: Number of points (triplets) in Contour Data (3006,0050).

table_lines.name: RT ROI Observations Sequence
table_lines.comment: One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Observation Number
table_lines.comment: Identification number of the Observation. The value of Observation Number (3006,0082) shall be unique within the RT ROI Observations Sequence (3006,0080).

table_lines.name: >Referenced ROI Number
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies the referenced ROI described in the Structure Set ROI Sequence (3006,0020).

table_lines.name: >RT Related ROI Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of significantly related ROIs, e.g., CTVs contained within a PTV.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Referenced ROI Number
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies the related ROI described in the Structure Set ROI Sequence (3006,0020).

table_lines.name: >>RT ROI Relationship
table_lines.comment: Relationship of referenced ROI with respect to referencing ROI.

table_lines.usage:
May not be necessary if the anatomy is implicit in the RT ROI Identification Code Sequence (3006,0086).

More than one item in Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218) may be used when a region of interest spans multiple anatomical locations and there is not a single pre-coordinated code describing the combination of locations. There is no requirement that the multiple locations be contiguous.

table_lines.name: >Segmented Property Category Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence defining the general category of the property this ROI represents.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.
See Note

table_lines.name: >RT ROI Identification Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence containing Code used to identify ROI.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.
See Note

table_lines.name: >>Segmented Property Type Modifier Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence defining the modifier of the property type of this segment.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Therapeutic Role Category Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The general category of the therapeutic role of this ROI.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Therapeutic Role Type Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The specific property type of the therapeutic role of this ROI.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Related RT ROI Observations Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of related ROI Observations.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>Observation Number
table_lines.comment: Uniquely identifies a related ROI Observation.

table_lines.name: >ROI Interpreter
table_lines.comment: Name of person performing the interpretation.

table_lines.name: >Material ID
table_lines.comment: User-supplied identifier for ROI material.

table_lines.name: >ROI Physical Properties Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence describing physical properties associated with current ROI interpretation.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>ROI Physical Property
table_lines.comment: Physical property specified by ROI Physical Property Value (3006,00B4).

table_lines.name: >>ROI Elemental Composition Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The elemental composition of the ROI and the atomic mass fraction of the elements in the ROI.
Required if ROI Physical Property (3006,00B2) equals ELEM_FRACTION.
One or more Items shall be included in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >>>ROI Elemental Composition Atomic Number
table_lines.comment: The atomic number of the element for which the ROI Elemental Composition Sequence (3006,00B6) is present.

table_lines.name: >>>ROI Elemental Composition Atomic Mass Fraction
table_lines.comment:
The fractional weight of the element for which the ROI Elemental Composition Sequence (3006,00B6) is present.
The sum of all ROI Elemental Composition Atomic Mass Fractions (3006,00B8) within the ROI Elemental Composition Sequence (3006,00B6) shall equal 1.0 within acceptable limits of floating point precision.

table_lines.name: >>ROI Physical Property Value
table_lines.comment: User-assigned value for physical property.

table_lines.name: RT Plan Label
table_lines.comment: User-defined label for treatment plan.

table_lines.name: RT Plan Name
table_lines.comment: User-defined name for treatment plan.

table_lines.name: RT Plan Description
table_lines.comment: User-defined description of treatment plan.

table_lines.name: Instance Number
table_lines.comment: A number that identifies this object Instance.

table_lines.name: RT Plan Date
table_lines.comment: Date treatment plan was last modified.

table_lines.name: RT Plan Time
table_lines.comment: Time treatment plan was last modified.

table_lines.name: Treatment Protocols
table_lines.comment: Planned treatment protocols.

table_lines.name: Plan Intent
table_lines.comment: Intent of this plan.

table_lines.name: Treatment Site
table_lines.comment: A free-text label describing the anatomical treatment site.

table_lines.name: Treatment Site Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Coded description of the treatment site.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Treatment Site Modifier Code Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Coded description of the laterality of the treatment site.
Only a single Item is permitted in this Sequencee.

table_lines.name: Referenced Structure Set Sequence
table_lines.comment:
The RT Structure Set on which the RT Plan is based.
Only a single Item shall be included in this Sequence.
Required if RT Plan Geometry (300A,000C) is PATIENT.

table_lines.name: Referenced Dose Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Related Instances of RT Dose (for grids and named/unnamed point doses).
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.
See Note

table_lines.name: Referenced RT Plan Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Related Instances of RT Plan.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >RT Plan Relationship
table_lines.comment: Relationship of referenced plan with respect to current plan.

table_lines.name: Frame of Reference to Displayed Coordinate System Transformation Matrix
table_lines.comment:
A 4x4 transformation matrix that transforms a coordinate of the Frame of Reference to a displayed coordinate system.
Only rigid transformation matrices are permitted (see definition in
Matrix elements shall be listed in row major order.

table_lines.name: Prescription Description
table_lines.comment: User-defined description of treatment prescription.

table_lines.name: Dose Reference Sequence
table_lines.comment:
Sequence of Dose References.
One or more Items are permitted in this Sequence.

table_lines.name: >Dose Reference Number
table_lines.comment: Identification number of the Dose Reference. The value of Dose Reference Number (300A,0012) shall be unique within the RT Plan in which it is created.

table_lines.name: >Dose Reference UID
table_lines.comment: A unique identifier for a Dose Reference that can be used to link the same entity across multiple RT Plan objects.

table_lines.name: >Dose Reference Structure Type
table_lines.comment: Structure type of Dose Reference.

table_lines.name: >Dose Value Purpose
table_lines.comment:
Purpose(s) for which dose values in this Sequence Item are provided.
See

table_lines.name: >Dose Value Interpretation
table_lines.comment:
Interpretation of the dose values.
See

table_lines.name: >Dose Reference Description
table_lines.comment: User-defined description of Dose Reference.

table_lines.name: >Referenced ROI Number
table_lines.comment: sect_C.8.8.5sect_C.8.8.9

table_lines.name: >Nominal Prior Dose
table_lines.comment: Dose (in Gy) from prior treatment to this Dose Reference (e.g., from a previous course of treatment).

table_lines.name: >Dose Reference Type
table_lines.comment: Type of Dose Reference.

table_lines.name: >Constraint Weight
